column16: I love this tank - fabric is great, its not too fitted and not too loose - perfect. I love the fabric too! Its not that cotton that looks old after you wash it. I have the black and the white - not crazy about the green. Please make other colors!
Love this tank. Keeps me cool no matter how hot it is and still can be covered. Best item I have ever ordered from here.

I love this so much that I bought it in green, black and the bright pink. Can't wait to get the white...I also want the long-sleeve version but its not currently offered. This is a looser fit top with a crew neck (which I prefer). There is a band around the waist so it doesn't just blouse out....it works great for workouts, but I also love wearing it out and about and to my kids' games out in the heat. The holes are NOT see-through...its perfectly appropriate. LOVE IT and want more colors!! I am 5'7", 128lbs and I ordered a 6. I could have gotten a 4, but I thought it might be too short.

This is my new favorite tank! Love so much I got all 3 colors. It fits with a Lil room to move. I thought the holes might be a little see through but they weren’t. I like that I can wear a cute colored sports bra under without showing my mid section. Love wearing this to the gym or my HIIT classes. If you sweat a lot it can stretch a lil but doesn’t bother me. Gave to a friend and she has since ordered the other colors as well.

I love the fit and style of these. I purchased all 3 colors. Great for spin or other sweaty workouts. I washed according to instructions and did have an issue with the white one where some of the holes stretched out and pilled, but contacted LLL and they let me exchange it by mail with no hassles at all.
Very cute and breezy top! It’s a loose fit but I got my regular lulu fitted top size and it worked great. Reminds me of a Billy Jean King tennis era throwback!

column14: Washed once and now partially damaged
column16: Loved the fit of this top so much that I purchased both white & olive colors. As soon as I washed these into the washing machine, some of the holes ripped in the front and now partially damaged. The material is too weak for machine washing.
column18:
Dear JKNYC,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that your Breeze By Muscle Tank II is not performing for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!

column16: I was so excited about this tank and wore it to 1 barre class and it now has 2 snags in it on the front that I can't get out and I'm a few days past the window to return or exchange...so disappointing! Lululemon clothes are not cheap and for only wearing this once it's such a disappointment!
column18:
Hey Love2wear,
We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

column12: knit fabric type, big arm holes
column16: First, I LOVE a crew neck in a top like this. Great for solving too-much-cleavage issues spin and yoga class and it makes my shoulders look great.

Finally! More shirts with coverage for those of us who don't like gaping armholes and our goods dangling out. Even though the shirt is perforated and looks see-through on the model, in person it has more modest coverage. I bought this in both black and white - sized up from 6 to an 8 so it was a bit looser (I'm 34DD). Bought it to wear for running, pilates and general to and fro.

I agree with the previous reviewer; this tank is much cuter than expected. I didn't think much of it when I saw it online, but decided to try it on whilst in the store shopping for tights. I needed some tank tops to wear around when I go on vacation in July, and this fit the bill perfectly. I love that the armholes aren't dropped down as low as the other muscle tanks. The fit is not too relaxed, and it isn't as see through as it appears in the online photos, making it perfect for casual or gym wear. It fits me TTS; for reference, I'm a 36C, muscular, and wear a 6 in most tops. Purchased in black and white, would love to see more colors.

column14: Even cuter than you would expect
column16: I bought this tank on a whim because I really needed a black tank. Wow, best purchase ever! I love the fit of it, which totally suits my curvy body, and I can wear it to work out, but it also looks amazing with jeans or a cute pair of shorts.

The holes in this shirt and not near as evident as they appear online... I love it! I got the pink color and its super bright! I love it! It is a loser tank which I was looking for! Please make in more colors!

I have both the prior version and the new one and love them both. The new version has higher armholes which makes it easier to wear. This tank is just loose enough without looking sloppy. Please make it in more colors like ruby wine, slate grey, sapphire blue!

Got the glossy and black. Nice neckline & arms were cut nicely. These colors have the improved smaller armpit holes, so that wasn't a problem. Stayed really cool on my run tonight. Neither color is see-through. Hope they put out more colors in these!

Bought this tank in the green color. Love it. Covers, yet gives so much ventilation. Side openings are quite large, if you are afraid of showing there, dont get this. I am 5'9, 153. Bought the 10, I could have fit in an 8, but I like my tops roomy. Tempted to get another one. Will wear for hot pilates and bikram.
I love this tank so much!! It is so comfortable and breathable, and goes low enough on the sides to show off cute sports bras. Perfect for casual wear or any workout. Want in every color!!

I was looking for a top to wear especially in the Body Pump classes I supplement my normal yoga regimen with, and this top definitely fits the bill. Have owned for about three months now and have worn 4-5 times. Am in love. The top falls a bit differently on me than on the model, but like another reviewer says, in a good way. I like the roomy armholes which basically allows me to never feel restricted. It is not ideal for yoga because the chest area kind of flops up to nose/mouth area during Down Dog, but I LOVE it for anything where I'm not going upside down. The breathability is WONDERFUL too!

These are absolutely my favorite top from Lulu- I have it in 4 colors! Please make more colors, Lulu! They fit GREAT and are so comfortable to wear, I can concentrate on my work out. I also wear these hiking. The drop arm holes are perfect and keep me cool.

Easy to pair with leggings and AWESOME to train in - the dropped arm holes don't restrict movement at all with lifting! Even worn a couple of times with jeans and a cute layer over the top. Love the wider hem at the bottom - not loose but not tight

column11: fit, deep arm hole, mesh-like material
column16:
Okay, I don't think this tank looks super cute in the photos, but in person it's awesome. Its currently my favorite top for training. Its very subtly sexy, covers and shows all the right spots. It comes down pretty low in the arm pit, but doesn't hang or look sloppy, so you can show off a cute sports bra, and even better have plenty of movement and no risk of chaffing.
The material is like a thick flexible mesh (that doesn't sound nice, but it is), and its great for sweaty sessions. Need more colors.

Love the skirts, great fit and the pleats give it that little something in detail. Wish there were more options in tall. The regular fits but over the age of 50 not that modest. I love the grips on the shorts. Just perfect.
The shorts stay in place and the skirt doesn’t ride up while walking or running. Love the pockets under the skirt for my phone. Length could be a touch longer for tall girls but I can deal.

I bought this skirt to wear golfing and I am OBSESSED! It is my first athletic skort and I am addicted now. I wear it to run errands, to workout, and like I said to golf. It is absolutely adorable, flattering, super comfy, and practical. I bought the pink skirt in size 6. I am 5'7 and weigh 130 lbs and usually wear size 4 in leggings but size 6 fits well in this skirt. My exact measurements are in between sizes 4 and 6 so I preferred to go up a size. Size 4 hugged my tummy a little too tight. If you're on the fence, I definitely recommend getting this skirt!

I bought this skort to run a 10K. I wanted to listen to my cadence playlist, but didn't want to carry my phone. This skirt supplied my need! The leg pocket held my phone securely, and the slit allowed me to thread the earbuds through my clothing, for a hands-free run. Oh, and the skirt is super cute! I usually wear a size 4 but this skort fit well in a size 6 Tall. For reference, I am 5'7", 128 pounds.
Love love love these skirts. This color is so cute but what I didn’t like was how sheer the fabric was. You can see the shorts underneath. Had to return ☹️
column18:
Hey MissyPoo,

I am sorry to hear you found your Pace Rival Skirt (Tall) *4-way Stretch to be too sheer. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: This is the cutest skirt...ever!!!! Please restock your out of stock colors and consider making one in gray. Even thought I am 5'5, I still order the tall so it is a little longer for those of us pushing the big 5-0. This is my go to for everything!!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!

This is the second one of these i have purchased - now I have white and black. So comfortable, relatively true to size, and easily goes from workouts to a casual dinner afterwards. One of my favorite pieces of my wardrobe.

This running skirt has it all! The tall length is more discreet and the liner shorts prevent leg chaffing, but the absolute deal maker is the no-slip grip hem on the liner shorts. I can wear the skirt higher on my waist for an awesome compression fit. I love, love, love running in this skirt and I feel so stylish wearing it around town too!

column12: not good for running, shorts did not stay put
column14: Sadly not up for the run
column16: I was so excited about this skirt/skort! First because it was longer length (yay for tall women) and also because of the great color options. I picked mulberry which is lovely. I tried 2 sizes - both 8 and 10 - and went with a true size 8 (what I wear in other brands). Unfortunately during my run the shorts did not stay put and rode up, ending up causing my legs to chafe :(. It was extremely painful. I was so bummed as I feel i have average legs, but the leg cutouts must be made for wide legs. The bottoms of the shorts do have sticky parts to try to keep them adhering to your legs ... but just too wide for me. I guess I won’t be wearing these in my next race :(
column18:
Hi InTrainingRunningGirl,
I'm sorry to hear you're having such trouble with your Pace Rival Skirt! I'd love to chat with you further about this and find a resolution. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

column16: I love the style, length and the color! I am so glad I made this purchase as I have been waiting for lululemon to come out with this red color as shown on website! I Love it!!!!!

column11: all my other pace rival skirts
column12: the fit of the miami pink
column14: Pace Rival Skirt Tall - Miami Pink
column16:
I play a lot of tennis and have many Pace Rival skirts from Lulu in both regular and tall sizing. I always order size 4 regular or 2 tall depending on color availability, the skirts normally fit fantastic except for the Miami Pink skirt I just received. I ordered the skirt in my normal size and it must have been cut wrong because this skirt is very tight. I wore the skirt in a match last night thinking I was crazy and it would stretch, but I was wrong, it's just too tight. I'm not sure what happened on the construction of this skirt because all my other 2 tall skirts fit great.
**All my other Pace Rival skirts in regular and tall are all 5 stars**
column18:
Hey Tennisenthusiast,

Thanks for reaching out and providing feedback for the Pace Rival Skirt (Tall) *4-way Stretch. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you! Best wishes!

column11: pockets, fabric, color choices, rubberized hem keeps shorts from riding up
column16: Nice skort but wish it were an inch longer. I wear this to and from the gym and drop off my kids before and errands after so a little extra length would be nicer. The fabric isn't thick but the white isn't see thru. I really like the pockets. Good for my phone and keys when I go for walks while waiting for one of my kids at a lesson or practice.
This skirt is super cute and flattering. I am 5'8 and 130lbs ordered a size 6 and it fits great. I am modest dresser and to me this is not too short. I think some of those reviews are old (2014).
The fabric on this was very cheap and mine caught on something and ripped. I loved the skirt, super comfortable and cute, I just wish it wore better and lasted me longer.

One of my favorite pieces of clothing to wear. I am 5' 3, but I am a PE teacher, so I always by the *tall for extra coverage. BUT---Why can we not have the same colors in the tall as the regular length skirt?!?! I'll still buy these up like crazy!

I'm so happy Lulu is finally making higher waisted items, and this skirt is wonderful. I have been waiting and waiting for the Tall skirt to be available in white...come on, Lulu- most of the girls I know are wearing this for tennis.

column14: I wish this skirt was a bit longer.
column16: I liked everything about this skirt except for the length. I'm not saying it should be significantly longer, but even an inch longer would make a big difference. It will be more suitable for a Tall category. Sadly, I returned the skirt due to it's length. I'm same way as a previous reviewer - thought this skirt could be wearable out and about. However, it's too short even for me 5'4" (size 6). Otherwise good fit and I loved the Dusty Dawn color. Circuit Breaker skirt is still my favorite.

column14: Would not call this "Tall"...tall girls beware!
column16: I am 5'5" but ordered the Tall version of this skirt in the hopes that it would be long enough to be appropriate to wear out & about. Personally, I am not comfortable wearing Lululemon skirts off of the tennis court since they are so small. I was so excited when the skirt arrived however, I would not consider this a long or tall item. This skirt is still "short" on me and just not appropriate to wear to class or running errands. I'm really disappointed because I love everything else about it!
I loved this skirt I bought a new pair then I noticed how loose they got! They were my fav. For when a went golfing but hate how my old ones feel to my new ones!
column18:
Good Day chriss26,

We’re writing to follow up on your recent review. We want your gear to support your golf pursuits and it sounds like your Pace Rival Skirt isn’t up to the task. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column14: Love it!! Sadly I ordered the wrong size
column16:
I really loved this skirt, especially that it was in tall.
I tend to go back and forth between a size 6 and a size 8.
I find it hard to read reviews and get a sense for the size, I think size is a personal thing and dependent on the body type.
I am 125pds, 5'8.5 and I feel best in a size 8. Having said that, I cannot stand the muffin top which is why I am returning the size 6 in this skirt and praying a size 8 is in the store....
Otherwise I highly recommend this skirt it is a must!

Got the blue stripy- love the vertical stripes on shorts, love the pleats, just didn't work for me as the horizontal stripes on the skirt part were rather adding the weight to my bottom-heavy frame
Nice soft fabric, good length, tts

column11: length, stays in place, aesthetically pleasing
column14: Only thing I'll wear in summer!
column16: After countless attempts at shorts (tight shorts, regular, loose, tight under loose outer) with no success at preventing thigh rub, I finally found this wonderful running skirt! Finally something that stays put! Unfortunately it's the only one Lulu makes that I like (the pleats in the front AND back really make it for me) and it only comes in one colour at the moment. If more colours come available in the tall version I will definitely be buying more :)

column14: Wish the liner is solid color
column16: Everything is good, length(Tall) is good, fit is perfectly TTS (maybe slightly smaller than Peace Setter), except I really hope they made the liner with just solid aqua or Cadet blue color, instead of stripes. I have the Aqua/Cool breeze/Cadet Blue one. So people who's not familiar with Lulu's products may think they saw my underwear due to my skirt is sheer, who would know it's just the liner color. That's my only concern. :(

I try on Lulu skorts every year, and every year I hate them. I tried on the Pace Rival Skort last week as part of my annual ritual. And much to my surprise, I LOVED it!! I love the pleats in the front and back. The Pacesetter never worked for me because the flat front didn't lay right, and looked terrible. This is a zillion times better (for me). I wore it for a WOD on Saturday, loved it, and bought another one on Sunday. The under shorts have grip on them, and they really work. I did wall balls and burpees and they didn't move. I'm usually a Lulu 8 and these were tts for me. I'm 5'8 so I got the tall. I highly recommend. Hoping for more colors!!

This skirt is great for working out AND for kicking around town. It is super flattering, even if you have a bigger derriere (which I do). Even though I am 5'5, I prefer the Tall as it is more appropriate for just walking around in public. I wish Lululemon would add this to their permanent collection, as it is a bit more of a classic cut than the pace setter (whose frills on the back look somewhat silly on women over the age of 30).

I recently injured my knee and need workout clothes for physical therapy that would keep the personal stuff covered but didn't cover my knee. This skirt is adorable! The only thing I could hope for is that the tall was longer. As mentioned in other pace setter tall skirt reviews, the talls aren't really for tall people. I'm 6'1" 150lbs and the size 8 fit well. If it were a few inches longer, I'd be more comfortable wearing it to dinner and other non-workout places

I love it, I love the fit! I own few Race pace setter skirts but I have to say that I prefer this one. I bought the same size for this skirt as for the pace setter skirt so it is true to size. I like my skirt to be a longer so I chose the tall model of this skirt and I am not even that tall (5'4). I would like if some of the models could be even longer but that is my preference. I will definitely buy more of these (tall version) when more colors come out!

This tank is a really great staple and I’m glad I finally pulled the trigger in purchasing. My normal size, size 8, left a roomy fit in the chest and underarms. It goes great with other ath-leisure items or even jeans. Will definitely get some more of these.
Love this. Ordering more. Please add more colors. The fit is roomy but not too loose. Flattering. I like the longer coverage over the butt.
Love this breathable, flattering too!
I have this tank in several colors. Both the 6 and the 8 fit me but I chose the 8 because it’s looser. I was struggling to find cute workout tanks that aren’t skin right and this is perfect.

column12: sometimes the armholes gap a bit
column16: I love the sculpt tanks - I have several colors and prints!
Thicker material which is nice in the cooler months. Has a nice flow for the fit. I have this tank in 4 or 5 different colors so I guess I do like it :)

column14: Great fit, but not color fast
column16: Purchased the tank in Aquamarine. Washed with dark colors. The mesh is now a dark aquamarine and the body material turned blue gray. Would have expected a synthetic material to hold its color. Bummed, but still a great tank and fit. Like the high neck so I don't get sunburned.
I really love this tank. The fabric feels great on the body, it's really comfortable and it hangs nicely. I love this fabric mixed with the mesh on top. It's a great tank for all uses!

I like the color, but that’s about it. The fabric clings unflattringly and becomes really see through when you sweat. I do hot yoga so not a good look. Mine also has a few stains (I have no idea from where) that will not come out. All in All a disappointing purchase..
column18:
Hey SuperHappyYogini,

We’re writing to follow up on your recent review. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Sculpt Tank II isn’t up to the task. We’d love to turn this around and get you into gear that works for you. Look out for an email from us soon!

column16: I loved the back look but front was to long and just didn’t fit perfectly to keep. I purchased size 4. So luckily this great company has easy return system. Will try again!
Have several of these, they are great! Perfect for the warmer months, hot yoga, outdoor workouts, etc.

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column16: I have 2 of these tanks and purchased a 3rd one in the same size. I removed the tags to wear to the gym, but this tank must have been sized incorrectly because there was a huge difference size wise. I compared the newest (aquamarine) to the other tanks (pink and black) and it is obvious this was mis-sized. I am so disappointed! I bought this one when I was out of town and threw my receipt away never imagining there would be a problem. No plans on taking back to a store, because I know how that would go without a receipt!
column18:
Hey 9392,

We’re writing to follow up on your recent review. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Sculpt Tank II isn’t up to the task. We’d love to turn this around and get you into gear that works for you. Keep an eye out for an email soon!

column16: I wore it to HITT class today, feels really good in it. Cute look, light material. The material is so light that I almost forgot this tank is on me. I got the multi blue color and no showing sweat spots at all. I like the neckline, which is higher than my other tanks, so I don't have to worry about showing too much when I am bending on the floor for movements. Mesh on the back adds some stylish to it. It's pricey, but a great tank.

Love it. My sister and I both got it and wear it often. Washes well and dries super fast. I like the shape... it’s not too open like some tanks. The mesh makes the solid color have some visual interest.
Comfortable for running and the gym. I really like the longer length in this shirt too.
I now have 3 of these tanks...they are true to size, super flattering and versatile enough to wear with yoga pants or a tennis skirt.
I have 5 of these shirts in different colors . I like the roomy fit and light weight .

column14: Agree with what others are saying
column16: I was so excited to give this tank a run for its money but experienced what others have stated in their reviews -- it stretches out! I bought a size 2 (I usually buy a 4/6) and its just way too big. I wish Lululemon was more consistent with their sizing.
column18:
Hey danipants,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're sorry that the sizing of your Sculpt Tank ll is not what you expected and we would love to make this right for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way!

column14: Must be very careful when wearing
column16: I absolutely LOVE the fit and look of this shirt and wanted it in every color, but it got multiple snags/pulls after the first workout in it. Very disappointing. The material is extremely light, which feels great during a workout, but doesn’t seem to hold up well.

My first purchase from this company. Wore this shirt only once and it rippled and stretched out very oddly throughout the whole front of this top. Very disappointed because for the price, I was expecting much better quality.
column18:
Dear TAbrolat,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear that your Sculpt Tank II has stretched out. We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column11: i love the length and feel of this tank.
column12: i am not crazy about the narrow "straps"., i prefer the wider version like sculpt i.
column14: Great tank, but neck stretches out after a couple wears/washes
column16: The Sculpt Tank II top has been my "go to" tank/top for a while, but I am extremely disappointed in how they are holding up. I first owned the original Sculpt Tank and absolutely LOVED it....unfortunately it is no longer available (as a side note, please please bring it back!!). I am very careful in wearing/ washing my Lulu tanks as well as all my Lulu clothes, so this is very disappointing. After a couple wears and washes it seems that the neck of all my Sculpt Tank II tops are stretched out and loose. I love this tank and hope this issue can be resolved! Thanks!!
column18:
Hi PureBarreRunner1470,
Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We hear your disappointment with the stretching out you’ve noticed on your Sculpt Tank II. We're eager to make things right because we stand behind our gear, so I'm sending you a follow up email to continue the conversation.

column16: Love this tank! I was hesitant to buy white due to the other reviews, but I have washed several times and it still looks like new! I sometimes have to size up to a 6 in lulu tanks, but did a 4 in this and it fits perfectly. Not a tight fitting tank. Good for summer runs.

I have an older version of the sculpt tank and I like it, but I found it to be too loose fitting and showed sweat too much. I needed a new tank and wanted something not super tight fitting but still giving good shape and the girl at the store recommended this. Also I will add that I am large chested and can only wear a few Lulu tanks. I LOVE it. It fits perfectly, not too loose but tight enough to still show my curves. Also, this version is better at wicking sweat. I use it for running, HIIT and for weight training. I also find that even though I am large chested (34 DD) I don't find it to fit too tight in the chest area, it is perfect. (I got a size 6) I got it in the blue pattern and wear it with Pace Rival navy leggings. Thank you Lulu.

column12: not great for hot yoga sticks to skin.
column16: I love love this tank! Probably have every color possible! Would not recommend the white, the color gets dull looking even though I wish it wish other whites. Kind makes it look old. But otherwise would 100% recommend this tank!

LOVED this tank at first. Fit and feel was great for summer runs. After two wears I start to notice the fabric pilling on the front. Not sure why this would happen after running. I washed it on delicate and hung dry. Very sad that is happening. I am a consistent lulu buyer and find certain items just don't hold up. This is one of them for me.
column18:
Dear RunTrain,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that the Sculpt Tank II is pilling, I would hate if that happened to mine. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!

column14: Fit loosened significantly after one wash and wrinkled easily
column16: I bought a size 4 in baby blue and fit well when I tried it on in-store. I washed it in gentle cycle along with my other Lululemon tanks and for some reason, this is the only top that became loose after; my other Lululemon tanks were fine. Now the fit is horrible - too loose and became too flow-y, almost like a maternity top. It doesn't look good to wear anymore.
column18:
Hey Elvie,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We definitely want you to have gear that works for you, keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: I love this top for spin class. I have at least 7 of them. I bought a pink one for a race I will be running; however, it faded in the wash. I followed the instructions and it is extremely pale and not bright as when I received it. The shape and functionality of the top are perfection, but for the price I would hope that the color would remain. Please try to rectify this in the future.

column11: i love the style of the tank
column16: My body is small framed, but I am a 32D. It's challenging to find workout tops that fit my bust without being excessively baggy on me. I thought the Sculpt Tank II was going to be a great option for my body type, so I ordered a size 2 (I had previously tried a size 4 Sculpt Tank, but it was too large). When i initially tried it on, it seemed perfect. So, I ripped the tags off and hung it in my closet. I'm not sure what bra I had on, but I tried it on again with my sports bra, and the fabric hangs awkwardly around the neck (because it's too tight in the bust). I'd return it if i hadn't ripped the tags off :(
column18:
Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on ITEM
I'm sorry to hear of the loose fit issues that you're experiencing on your tank and can understand why you're not pleased. We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!

column16: DO NOT BUY THE WHITE. Even though I washed it with only whites, it turned a weird color after only one wash.Having said that, the sculpt tank is my go to workout tank top. It is extremely comfortable and looks great. I own several colors and never had a problem until I bought a white one.
column18:
Hey Skiingdoc,
We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

column11: fabric, cut, length, neckline, back, colors, size
column16: These tanks are bae. The cut is perfect: Not too clingy, long enough and with a high enough neck to cover everything. The fabric is perfect: Super light and breezy and slippery, no pilling, but holds up really well. I like wearing these under my jiu jitsu gi instead of a rash guard because it's lighter, I can tuck it into my gi pants, the high (but still open) neck, the light weight. And again, the fabric is perfect for this application, as the rough gi material just slides right off of it. Of course, it's perfect for running and gym stuff too. Since it's loose, you might not want to do inversions in it, but seriously for every other application... Sculpt Tank 4eva!!!

Loved this tank when it came in the mail and during my first wear. I bought the white and the material was perfect and kept me cool during my workout. I had planned on buying more until I washed it. There are random stains all over it and it's even tinted yellow a bit. I washed by itself on delicate and hung to dry like I do with all my lulu stuff. I've never had this problem with lulu items before so I'm incredibly disappointed. What I thought was going to be my favorite tank now looks awful after one use
column18:
Hey apollo123,

We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing discoloration with your Sculpt Tank II. I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.

column12: how the material held up after one use.
column14: Nice Tank, But Super Sad After First Use
column16: I bought this tank in white. And before I ran in it, I loved it. A nice bright white with thin, but not cheap, wicking material. Just an all-around nice tank. However, after wearing it for one run (with a light-colored sports bra), the top yellowed so badly! I even tried to get the yellowing out with an Oxygen Whitening Power from Whole Foods, but it didn't work. Now I have a dingy looking tank in my closet, that I don't feel confident wearing anywhere beyond my home.
column18:
Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on Sculpt Tank II.

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.

column16: This is one of my favorite tanks right now. I love the lightweight and airy material. I have a longer torso and I love that this still gives me good coverage. I am normally a 6/8 in Lululemon and have this tank in both sizes. Both sizes work well for me.

column12: the white fabric turns yellow, runs large not true to size
column16: I wish I wouldn't have bought this in white, turned yellow after a single wash! Now I'm stuck with an expensive, yellow stained shirt that I never plan on wearing again! Shirt also runs large...Highly recommend sizing down!
column18:
Dear Kristenc024,

Thanks for making time to share your experience with the Sculpt Tank II. I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing as expected—I can understand the disappointment.

We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do, and we'd love to make this experience right for you. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

column16: I got two of these, I have love and constantly wear my black tank. The white one however, turned yellow after a single wash :( Stick with darker colors of this tank, otherwise you will be stuck with an expensive yellow-ish tank that you don't want to throw away but don't want to ware :)
column18:
Hey Lilnikkipop,

We appreciate your feedback regarding the Sculpt Tank II. We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.

column16: I was so pumped to receive this tank! Flowy and light - just what I need for a hardcore lifting and kicboxing workout. However, during my work out it was super clingy to my body and collected sweat.

I bought this tank last week and am very disappointed after wearing it to the gym a few times. The fabric is very light and comfortable but instead of wicking away sweat during my workout it collects it. As some other reviewers have mentioned, the tank gets heavy, wet and start to stick to your body by the end of a sweaty workout. Overall very disappointed with this tank as I cannot wear it to the gym when it's hot - which was kinda of the point of buying a loose, airy tank!
column18:
Hey DDWW,
Oh no, I'm bummed to hear you're not loving your Sculpt Tank II! I'd love to work with you towards a resolution -- keep your eye out for an email coming your way shortly! Chat soon.

column16: I have been very happy with this tank. I'm a runner and it is lightweight and airy for the hot, humid Louisiana temps. I wash all my LLL in a lingerie bag, and thus far I have had no defects or issues with this top. I have had this top for over a year now. I have purchased another pattern of the same top because I love it so much.

I am super disappointed with this tank. When I tried it in store it looked great and it was fine the first two times I wore it but it has now stretched so much that it's baggy, especially around the underarms and not flattering at all. It actually looks like it's a whole size bigger.
This turns out to be a very expensive tank for only 3 uses.
column18:
Dear Celoche,

Thanks for making time to review the Sculpt Tank II. We're sorry to hear that the top isn't holding up as intended.

We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do and we'd love to make this experience right for you. We have sent you an email outlining a few options.

column16: This was my first top purchased from Lulu. It looked great on and I thought I would love it but unfortunately, I don't! It seemed to collect sweat, looked gross, and felt heavy and cold after my workout. I was expecting more sweat wicking fabric.
column18:
Dear XtineA,

Thanks for making time to leave a review. We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.

column16: I now have 5 of these tanks, 4 are the first edition of the tank but I like the second edition just as well if not better. Perfect for all activities, nice and loose. Probably my fav Lulu tank.

I have 6 of these tops in different colors. I decided to go for the white color. A total FAIL! I received the top, wore it once and threw it in my hamper along with my other gym clothes. When I was taking it out to put in a lingerie bag for the washer, i noticed there were already stains!!! I tried soaking the stains in a spot cleaner and the stains haven't come out. I have never had this problem with any of the other colors and I am not a super sweaty/dirty person. I have no idea where these stains came from. Another reviewer also commented about how the white picks up colors so I would suggest skipping the white unless you want to risk wasting $60.

This is probably my favourite Lululemon tank. Its comfy and cute. I am 5'8", 140lbs and got the size 6 and it fits perfectly. I am a runner and work out in the gym and its perfect for all my workouts. Would absolutely recommend.

I love this tank!! It is the first tank I reach for in my drawer. It pairs well with shorts or leggings and is really soft and airy. The mesh detail on the back is a nice touch. I purchased the black a few weeks ago, and I have already ordered another. This will definitely be my new go to tank for gym sessions! I am normally an 8 in lulu tops, and the size 8 in this is a perfect fit.
I'm 5'5" and 127 pounds 34B 27" waist and bought this tank in a 2. I love the curved hem; its very flattering.

I love this top. It feels great during a workout and even afterwards. It doesn't stick to your skin, and the mesh gives you just enough airflow to stay cool. It's also super flattering. My favorite Lululemon top hands down.

I own 3 Sculpt Tanks from previous seasons, I think Sculpt Tank "1", and I wear them non-stop for cardio, core and tennis. I purchased a Sculpt Tank in white about 2 weeks ago to wear with a tennis skirt. The armholes are messed up, the shirt doesn't hang straight so it shows a lot of side sports bra. Not in a flattering way. And the white is kind of a disaster on my skin tone it is too sheer for tennis. Customer Service on LiveChat is helping me with a return for gift card. Hope LuLu brings back the original fit, and materials. The ones I previously purchased have been super easy to wear for the last 3 years!
Love this top. The material is awesome and sweat wicking which is a bonus as I sweat a lot. It is a looser fit so I wouldn't recommend for Yoga as it would fall down but a great shirt for running in!

This shirt is great at first but gradually over time has stretched so much. I have a lot of workout tops so they all don't get a lot of wear. This one now looks horrible and sloppy and I can no longer wear it. I only wash my workout wear on gentle and hang to dry so I don't know why this would happen, disappointed, especially for the price I paid for this tank!
column18:
Hi Lvis,
We want you to know, feedback is at the heart of everything we do, and we'd love to make this experience right for you. We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.

column16: I bought this in the Jasmine White/multi and was very pleased. The fabric is very smooth and breathable. Perfect for pilates, running, & tennis- yet classy enough to wear out to lunch with a cute pair of crops. I will be ordering more in other colors for summer!

I just received this tank in the gorgeous Persian Red Shade, and was lucky enough to get the lower price on We Made Too Much. As much as I love this piece though, I would not pay full price. It fits true to size, the colour is amazing, and very breathable. I love the colour, the fabric and the versatility of wearing it under a blazer to work, and then catch a yoga class at noon. It is the right amount of flowy, without being baggy, and the perfect length. The mesh on the back is a very nice touch too. Highly recommend!

column12: white picks up color easily and stains easily
column16: This is one of the most versatile tops I own. Wear it with a jacket or sweater to work, head out for a long walk at lunch and still make it to dinner. The material is perfect for hot sweaty days no matter what you do. I have worn this to hot yoga then off for lunch with friends and it never stopped looking great. You can wash and hang to dry in minutes. So if you need it again that day it is perfect. Doesn't hold smells. The white can pick up color in the wash so be careful. This is a delicate top but if you wash with other lulu stuff on gentle it always comes out looking great. I have been wearing these tops for about 2 years and just bought a new color (pink). LOVE THIS TOP

column14: The best top for any type of workout
column16: Hands down my favorite and most versatile Lulu top. I have 4 of these and plan to buy more. I've worn it to OTF, yoga, bootcamp, running and cycle and they all perform well while providing coverage and still keeping me cool. They also hold up really well after several washes - I wash them only in Lingerie bags to keep them from being snagged and hang them to dry. More colors please!

column14: One of my fav LLL tanks
column16: Fits true to size, lightweight, and sweat dries quickly! I love the full coverage in the front. Sometimes with the higher neckline, the tank gets in my way during down dog, but with this tank, it's the perfect high neck without being too high and getting in my way.

Love this top! I really like that it's not super fitted like a lot of other Lululemon tops but it's not too loose. It's a flattering shape and the mesh makes it look really cool. The fabric is my favorite thing about this top! Super comfortable to workout in.

This is a nice tank, feels good on but it's on the roomier side. Which is nice for hiding the tummy but that also means pretty big armholes. I like the mesh/sheer panels - adds a nice style factor. Length is fine (I'm 5'2"). For reference, in the swiftly tanks (fitted) I'm a size 6 and I should have ordered a size 4 in this one.

I LOVED this tank when I got it - the fabric feels amazing and it is very breathable. I love all of the colours too and could see myself buying more. However, after wearing this tank only a few times I noticed the seams on the sides of the tanks are pilling and getting "fluffy" (if you know what I mean). I've never had this happen to any of my Lululemon clothes (have been shopping the brand for ~15 years) and definitely wouldn't expect it on this tank.

I'm 110lb 160cm I wear 2 in swiftly tech racerback. I bought this in 2. This tank is very roomy around my waist and covers my bum. For a petite person, this top looks like it is half my height. I really wish lulu made a shorter version of this tank because I really like the material.

This tank is great for lifting. Flattering but not tight. Not the most breathable fabric, but I don't mind. For reference, I am 5'2", 125lbs, wear a 6 in lulu jackets but a 4 in most tops, and got this tank in a 4.

I love these tanks! They fit in all the right places, but not too tight. I sized down. My only question is why the blazer blue sculpt tank is a different design than the others on here? I want every color.

I love this tank. It's simple yet flattering and it wicks sweat well. Please keep this one as an ongoing item and keep making more solid colors! it's a great basic piece that I'd gladly own multiple colors of.

column14: AVOID THE WHITE COLOR AT ALL COSTS!
column16: Do not buy the white color and size down! I repeat, SIZE DOWN! It fits weird if it's too large. The white color is awful. After just one wash, the white started turning into this awful white/beige/grey color... makes it look dirty and old. I'm going to try the other colors because it's not a bad workout tank, just a bad first purchase selection on my end.
column18:
Hey Oceans,
I really appreciate you taking the time to get in touch today and I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing for you. We stand behind the quality of our gear and I will be in touch via email to dig into this with you!
Chat soon.

column16: I am obsessed with this shirt! I am able to wear it to HIIT training And it is perfect. The mesh allows for extra breathing room!
Bummed b/c this shirt looks super boxy and oversized, but tight in my chest. Definitely not a flattering shirt, at least for me.

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column11: fabric style with the cut out back
column16: The sculpt tank has been my favourite tank for the past few years. I probably have one in almost every color and I have 3 in black. The fabric is amazing and you can dress it up or down. I wear them for runs, yoga and they are great when you travel to places with hot climates. Great for travel, they don't wrinkle and take up little space.I can also pull off wearing the older style to work either under a sweater or on their own in summer. However, I am not as fond of the newer style. I have many of the older style with the cut out in the back, that style was way better in fit and I am not sure why lulu has changed the style. The new version although longer which is nice, it fits a bit too loose in the body and the change to the armholes shows too much bra. Lulu, please bring back the style with the cut out in the back, maybe it would be good if both styles were available. Never ever change the fabric, it is awesome and I hope the sculpt tank is around for a very long time!

column14: Comes out of the laundry still dirty
column16: I have this in white and whenever I wear this to workout I never notice myself getting it dirty, however it always ends up with black marks on it a few hours after I'm finished my workout (I hang it up to dry once I'm done wearing it). I'm assuming the black marks are caused by dry sweat, not really sure though. When I launder the shirt it still comes out with the black marks on it.

I made the mistake of buying TWO of these in black. I purchased them about six months ago and I haven't worn them in about as long. I wore them each once. I thought that they would be great for Heated Yoga, but the shirt collects sweat and gets heavy. Sure, I stay cool, but my shirt is heavy. So, by the time you're ready for inversions, the heavy, sweat laden bottom of the shirt falls down (upside down) because that is what happens to heavy objects. Also, I'm not into tying up my shirts in practice, not to mention it stays wet forever... Oh, and if you put it in your bag to wear it later (clean) it comes out of the bag as wrinkly as a newborn. I'm not even trying to be funny, but I really dislike this shirt and I can't believe I have two of them sitting in my closet. I don't even like them enough to give them to a friend. So, I have nothing much nice to say about this one.

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column16: I have a few of these Sculpt tanks, both old and new, so I know what to expect from them. I’m 5.5, 128 lbs., chest 36B, and wear size 8 in this tank. What really made me disappointed when I received my WMTM order, is the colour of the starlight tank. On my screen the base colour looked cream, with a dainty black pattern. What I got was a greyish white base colour, with some black splotches. I guess I have to keep this tank, but the colour misrepresentation has been irking me for a while, and not just for this tank. I ordered a fair number since Christmas from WMTM, and a few items arrived in a different colour from what the pictures showed. I know I’m not the only one complaining of this, so the photographers should fix this aspect. If we order from the online store, the only thing we can rely on are the photos. If we get a different colour from what we expect, we should be able to return it.

I generally like my work out clothes to not be skin tight, so when I found this tank it was perfect. Cute design, sweat wicking material, not clingy, gives good upper body coverage, and it's perfectly loose without being overly baggy. I love it so much that I bought this in 3 different colors!

After purchasing this beautiful shirt in blue, I washed it before wearing it. I was so excited to wear it before going to workout with my friends. When I was going to put it on, it was so wrinkled I tried to cool iron it and immediately burned a hole into my shirt. I was devastated, I didn't even get to enjoy it once :( I will not purchase this item again.

column11: flattering, so many colors to choose from, loose, breathable
column16: First off, this shirt is incredibly flattering. I love that lululemon continues to bring new colors in the sculpt tank because it’s one of my favorite staple tanks for working out. I spin, run, lift weights, and do any other type of workout in this top and own it in multiple colors. It does run a little loose compared to some other lululemon tanks but that is one of the reasons why I like the top so much! It is not clingy and the quality has held up very well over multiple washes. It wicks sweat so well compared to any of my other tops.
I actually bought this shirt in a teal/black print to wear under a blazer to go from the gym to a coffee or meeting.

column14: weird stretchy spot on right side abdomen after 1 wash that looks like a stain
column16: After 1 wash with Woollite and hang to dry, there is a weird stretched out spot that looks like a stain right over my abs for which I never, ever want to draw attention. I teach spin classes and several participants asked me about this weird stain.."wow, you are really sweating today, even on your tummy" . I looked down and was horrified about how I looked in front of the class....my rating is 3/5 as I have 2 others of this style that are a 5/5 but this is a 0. I was embarrassed and it looks weird for sure...this is the blue colour.
column18:
Hey Bones78,
Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. I'd love to get a bit more information on your experience and look into some options. An email is headed your way, so keep an eye out.
Chat soon!

column16:
I bought the camo tank and it did not disappoint. I love it!! It is not too loose
for me but fits me just right. I like the see through back as it shows my sports
bra. The length is perfect!!

The fabric is soft and breathable, however again it's too loose especially on the upper part, I ordered size 2 and it seems to be too loose, hopefully lululemon can release more size options and think about the design of the tanks, I have bought several tanks they come with the same issue.

I ordered this top a few months ago hoping i would be able to rock it like the model in the picture. I understand that it is supposed to be a flowy top, but it way too flowy... Not worth spending the extra $ on something that looks like your ordinary pj shirt (but a little more breathable).
Love this tank. Fits to size (5'3", 34B, bought my usual size 6). Works well with any sports bra underneath. Great for cardio, X-training and weight training.

I wear this tank top in and out of the gym and I love it. The mesh at the back and looser fit make it super breathable when I'm running/training, and it's survived dozens of washes so far. Since I'm on the shorter side (5'2), it runs a tad long, but usually I'll just tie a knot in the front and it still looks great!
Perfect tank to wear over your favorite sports bra! True to size, Flattering cut, perfect length. For reference I am 5'10", wear a size 8 in tops and this hits just below my hips in the front.

column14: I thought I loved it but...
column16: I have two of these tanks. I have a blue one that I've had for almost a year and light beige/tan one that I've had for 3 months. I thought I loved them at first because they are super comfortable and I like the fit, but if you're planning on doing something very sweaty, be warned that the sweat will show! In fact, it'll almost be like the whole tank is a darker shade because it shows even the smallest amount of sweat very quickly. But it's perfect for if you want to do some activity that is not sweaty at all.

This is my favourite tank I've ever purchased. I use it for all types of physical activity - from running to crossfit, this is truly an amazing top. It's light weight and the perfect fitting. I am quite petite, but also muscle-y! I'm 5'2, 32C and wear a size 4 in almost all Lululemon tops and purchased a size 4 in this too. The length is perfect. I've worn it many times and have not seen any threads coming apart of pilling. Wish this came in more colours!

My husband bought me my first Sculpt tank a year ago and I have to say it is my absolute favorite Lulu tank! It feels like I"m wearing nothing when I run, it's so well ventilated and light. I"m an 8 and usually size up to a 10 in Swiftly tanks but the 8 is perfect for this shirt so it's TTS. The fit is fabulous - the arm holes are high enough without being constricting, and the loose fit hides tummy flaws without being baggy. Cute mesh back. I probably have way too much Lulu gear but I won't stop buying these tanks in every color, they're amazing.

I love the way this tank fits and feels - my problem is how easy it is to ruin! I wore it to hot yoga with a maroon Lululemon bra and the back of my white tank is now permanently dyed. I immediately washed it but it can't be fixed! I recommend getting a darker color that won't show stains as well.
column18:
Hi cjc213,
Oh dear, we're sorry to hear that. We stand by the quality of our gear and we’d like to make this right. Keep an eye on your inbox, as we’ll be reaching out shortly to get the ball rolling on a solution for you.

column14: Not the most well stitched tank
column16: I dont know if I got a defective piece, but this tank makes me look lopsided and the right shoulder falls over everytime I wear it. Not the best fitting lululemon tank.

Absolutely love this tank! The fit is quite flattering and allows for lots of movement during workouts. The fabric makes it really easy to dress up as well - I wear it to work under a jacket or blazer and then wear it to the gym right after. I'm usually between a 4 and 6 for lulu tanks and I went with the 4 for this one. Will definitely be buying more colors!

There have been a few tanks I love from Lulu ... in particular there is this one with the built in bra that they stopped making a few years ago so it has been hard to find one that i love and want to wear all the time. And now I've found one! Love this tank!! I recently had a baby and I was able to fit into this tank throughout my entire pregnancy and after (good at hiding certain areas). Super comfortable, breathable, good for working out and I also love putting it on after a good swim or water polo workout because I'm still warm after the pool and it helps me to keep cooling down.

column14: No good in the light color
column16: I have the scalp tank I, and love it so much. But this one is AWFUL. I bought it in the light grey color and after wearing it ONCE, my sweat stained it permanently. I can't get it out. I washed it like they recommended with no luck, then called lulu and asked what to do. They said soak it in warm water with baking soda. Did that overnight TWICE. IT STILL CAME OUT STAINED. I'm so mad. Maybe the black would be better but I am so disappointed.
column18:
Hey sunriserunners,
We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!
Chat soon.

column16: I am 4'10", 110lb, I wear size 6 for almost everything. I read the review and did size down to 4, it was perfect!! It looks very nice and cute.... I was so happy at my zumba class looking at myself in the mirror, lol.

I went into Lulu today to find a new work out top. I generally stick to strength training so I don't require much, just something that I can move around easily in. I tried on the sculpt tank after finding most of the other tops emphasized my rolls, particularly on my back. This tank is so flattering!! It doesn't hug you at all, but it sits nicely, particularly around my stomach. I would really recommend this to anyone who find their stomach and back to be problem areas.

This has become my go-to running tank, I almost forget I have it on -- it's so lightweight and it doesn't ride up or get in the way at all. It's also very quick drying. It does wrinkle easily after washing or folding it but the wrinkles come out quickly on their own. I buy 4s and 6s in Lulu tops depending on the style and what I'm wearing it for and I went with the 4 in this which fits perfectly and is super flattering. Definitely recommend for all hot weather runners!!

The Sculpt and Sculpt II tanks are my favourite Lulu tanks. They are perfect for the gym! I love the loose fit. The high neck is great for keeping cleavage in check, especially with pushups. I wear a 6 in this tank, whereas I normally wear size 8 in Lulu tanks. It is a bit pricey, for what it is. That said, more colours please!

I thought this tank top was amazing after my first run wearing it. It kept me cool even in the Houston, TX humidity! That is a major win. I even got a second tank top because I loved the feel so much, Originally, I purchased the white tank and noticed after my first wash that the white had dulled/greyed. It was almost like it absorbed the colors of the other workout clothes I washed it with. Now it looks like I have had it two years instead of two days. Fair warning to any lady wanting to buy it in white, wash it with pure whites only.
column18:
Hey Wyndz,
We're sorry to hear you're experiencing discolouration with yourSculpt Tank II. We would love to get a better understanding why you may be experiencing this. We have sent you an email to have a further chat.

column16: I already one of these tanks in a size 8 that I wear sometimes, but it isn't my go-to. However I just got a size 6 in the print of it as part of the exclusive Seawheeze gear and am very happy with it. It's not as silky soft as the solid one I already own, but this also means that it's a little more flattering on because it doesn't cling to rolls as much. I definitely prefer the 6 for the fit in the shoulders and arms, the 8 definitely looks oversized for me there, but it does mean it's a little less relaxed of a fit in the body for my shape. These are great easy tanks to throw on and wear with pretty much any shape of bottom (shorts/pants/loose/tight). Overall I like this tank a lot as a basic and am obsessed with the beautiful print for Seawheeze. Can't wait to see more at the showcase!

column14: Love the look and feel but disapointed in material
column16: I love the look and feel of this tank but on the first wash it created little snags all over the shirt. I always make sure to was my Lululemon's on gentle and hang dry. disappointing since I only wore it once.
column18:
Hey MandyCrossfitQueen,
Thank you for taking the time to connect with us. Snags are definitely not what we like to hear, and making things right for you is our priority. Keep an eye on your inbox so we can get this fixed as soon as possible.

column16: Granted I've only worn this tank a couple of times, but I am in loooove. I got this in black in a size 6, which is what I wear in pretty much everything else from here (5'3" ~125 lbs), and it's perfect. Loose and doesn't cling or constrict, so great for working out on a hot/humid day. The material is smooth to the touch, and the mesh detailing is fun. Fingers crossed it holds up bc I would definitely buy again!
This shirt has all amazing qualities, and I really wanted to love it! Unfortunately, Lululemon sent me the wrong size....have to return it. I wish the online exchange process was easier.

I find myself reaching for this tank over and over again. I wasn't a fan of the boxy, original Sculpt tank, but this version is beautiful - and so versatile. I wear it loose when running and lifting weights, but I like to tie the bottom in a knot for yoga. It looks cute either way! It also dries super quick, and doesn't absorb pit stains like some of the cotton/luon tops do. And the cut is much more flattering in the arm and shoulder area than the original, while the mesh back and larger armholes help keep you cool in the summer heat. It is a bit pricey for a tank so I won't be buying as many as I would like. Fingers crossed they hold-up well in the wash!

column11: length, flatters shoulders and upper back
column12: lulu ran out of the dark purple and black one, colour selection - more dark colours please
column16: Sculpt and sculpt II are my favourite work out tops. The hip length and the looseness of the fit are excellent for gently covering the business. I teach a lot of cardio and sculpt mixed m/f classes and like to remain somewhat modest in the bottom area while flattering the shoulders and upper back.

I love the galaxy grey color, but the first time I wore it, after my workout it had REALLY visible sweat marks. Once the top finally dried the marks were still noticeable. Fortunately I wasn't going anywhere afterward. Really disappointed with this top, none of my other lulu tops do this. What's the point in a workout top you can't sweat in?
column18:
Hey acd88,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!
Chat soon.

column16: This is my go to tank for everything outdoors and active - hiking, running, traveling (because it looks amazinggggg in pictures). I've worn this far so many 10+ miles long runs and it is great! Also dries rather quickly and super lightweight. Can't wait to purchase more (or all....) colors.

I loved the fit and feel of this tank top, right up until I started sweating. I do indoor cycling, and I sweat a lot. Halfway through class I notice the tank wasn't wicking sweat from my body (unlike my other lulu tank tops ), and it instead felt cold and clammy against my skin. I'll keep wearing it and it's not the end of the world -- but I'm not about to go run out and buy it in new colors, and I'd recommend you select a different tank top if you're going to be sweating a lot.

I had bought the original version of this tank in black and love it. I picked up the new one in "galaxy grey" and it looked great on. However, after sweating in it, the sweat definitely showed. I can live with that, however, after the sweat dried there was still a sweat stain. It's super gross to grab a coffee or brunch with a stain like that around my chest. I'll still wear it when I go to the gym but definitely not when I'm planning to run an errand before heading home.

column11: fabric, sweat-wicking, fast drying, loose fit but not sloppy, washes well, comfortable
column12: need to release in more solid colors
column16: I love the sculpt tank. I was hesitant when they "improved" it since many of Lulu's improvements have been horrible. However, I love the Sculpt Tank II so much more than the original. Both are great tanks! I find this top super sweat wicking and quick drying. I've used it for spin, bootcamp and running long, long miles - pretty much high sweat activities and it has never failed to disappoint.

column12: retained sweat, not wicking, not cool (temperature), slow drying
column16: This shirt did not wick away any moisture. When I went to the gym it absorbed all of my sweat and then it got heavy and started sticking very uncomfortably to my skin. I broke out all over my chest the next day where the tank top just stuck to my skin with sweat. This is also advertised as "quick drying" and it stayed wet for hours- even after I took it off.
column18:
Hey runner65454,
Sorry to hear that your Sculpt Tank II isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.

column14: Love it, but pilled on first wear :(
column16: I love this top, I find it very flattering. I'm pretty disappointed that after one wear to the gym it's completely pilled across the chest though. After paying almost $70 for a top, I expect better/longer lasting quality.
column18:
Hey Quart,
We appreciate you taking the time to follow up and share your thoughts and will be sending an email your way to lend a helping hand.
Speak soon.

column16: This is now my go-to tank for HIIT class. I got this in white, and it goes with every pair of leggings I own. The fabric is super soft, almost like Nulux. That and the back mesh help this tank stay dry and keeps me cool when I'm sweat soaked in the gym. I hate it when my tanks and tees stick to me when I'm sweaty, and this definitely does not do that. I have wider hips so the curved hem on this is a plus. My only tiny gripe is that it gaps a lot at the armpit holes, however I have a fairly large chest, so I don't know that there's much getting around that. Overall, I love this tank!!

I like some of the looser tanks I have from Lululemon. I tried this one one the store today in two colors. I think the mesh in the back is really flattering, but I felt like it was boxier for my personal taste. I couldn't think what to put it with for working out. A great tank, just not for me.

column12: felt cold and clammy during workout
column16: I love my lulu clothes, and I thought I would love this tank because it is so airy, light-weight, and loose-fitting. I thought it would be perfect for my bike classes, where I just drip with sweat each time. But it seems to me that the more sweaty and heated I get, the colder and clammier this top gets. It feels like wearing plastic or something because it get soaked and then just stays cold and wet on my skin-- a feeling I just can't stand. I called the store to see if I could return or exchange it, but they said no, since I had already worn it twice. It's weird to so completely disagree with the other reviews here, but I just can't bear to wear this top in a serious workout because of the way the fabric feels when it is sweaty. (Gross!) Wish I could exchange, for something else.
column18:
Hey LIFTgirl,
Thanks for sharing your thoughts. We definitely hear your disappointment with your Sculpt Tank II. Feel free to reach out to our Guest Education Centre so we can work towards a resolution together.

column14: Love it -- but beware of white
column16: I have three of these tanks. Great fit, loose, but not baggy and over sized. I wear this mostly for indoor cycling and running. Just have to caution about the white tank. First wear of my white tank was with a new pair of pace perfect crops I ordered in Navy. The navy bleed onto the tank at the waist line, and I can't get it out. Stick to dark colors.
column18:
Hey RunRideThrive,
Oh no! We're sorry to hear that your navy Pace Perfect Crops have bled onto your white Sculpt Tank II. We hear your disappointment and will be sending an email your way so we can follow up and lend a helping hand.
Chat with you soon.

column16: I own about 6 or 7 different style lulu tanks and this one is by far my favorite!! Perfect tank for running or training at the gym. I'm training for a marathon and have now purchased 3 because its the only top I want to run in! For reference, I am 5'1/121lbs and I wear a size 2.

Very flowy and light tank. I use this for running outside or the gym and am super careful with my lulu gear to prevent any "issues" such as pilling and running. I wash everything in warm water and hang dry and have had zero issues with this tank. I love the roomier fit that doesn't get in the way of any of the workouts and doesn't stretch across my butt but hangs nicely.

Purchased this top a couple days ago and wore it twice to work out. I can already start to see damage on the fabric around the underarm (i.e. fabric is wearing down/pilling). Wouldn't recommend this top for training.
column18:
Hey AEH14,
We hear your disappointment with the pilling you've noticed on your gear and will be sending an email your way to help.
Chat with you soon.

column12: a bit large in the armholes
column16: I bought this tank to wear to Core Power Yoga Sculpt class (hot) and it is perfect because it has a loose fit but is still flattering, covers the booty in the back, doesn't cling when it's soaked with sweat, and gives a cute peek of a strappy sports bra in the back mesh. I bought it in black, and just bought it in the grey/blue color too. Might also buy the coral/melon color for summer, I like it that much. I'm 5'1" 111 lbs and I wear the 4.

Love this tank! It's very flown so keeps you cool. The fit is good (but I would recommend trying on a smaller size as it is a little bigger than expected). I have it in two colors and love both of them!

I`ve bought this tank just a month ago in NYC. The colour is perfect, the tank is light and I thought it`ll be perfect for me. But after putting it on only once I saw that there are holes in the middle of the tank. It`s so dissapointing.
column18:
Hi HaPilates,
It's certainly frustrating to hear that your tank is developing holes in it, and we'd love to turn things around because we stand behind the quality of our gear. Keep an eye on your inbox and stay tuned—an email from us will be landing there soon.

column16: This tank is great for hot yoga and spin class. I love how many different colour options are available. I would definitely recommend this if you want a looser fitting workout top.
The fit is just as described and the fabric is so light. The shirt doesn't cling when you sweat. I will be getting other colors. I am 5'1" and 112 lbs. I got a 6 but a 4 would work as well.

column11: dries fast, comfortable, wicking, didn't show moisture
column16: I wore this to run Boston on Monday. It was incredibly hot but this tank did a great job with wicking and drying. I ran through multiple fire hydrants/mist tents/hoses and yet by the time I made it to the finish line the tank had dried out. I have the blue and it also didn't show the moisture/sweat marks and did not get bigger or stretch when soaked. I will definitely buy some more of these for the upcoming summer running season. Zero chafing, zero rub. It was perfect.

column14: Perfect tank for high intensity sweaty workouts
column16: I really love this tank top. It is so versatile and I don't feel like I have to be "gentle" with it during my workouts like some of my other lulu tops. I will be purchasing more in other colors.

this tank is perfect! not too tight, not too loose. it is breathable and sweat-wicking. i teach HIIT and this top provides cleavage coverage but doesn't feel hot. i am normally a sz 4 in tops, i sized down to a sz 2 and it is perfect! not too much fabric drooping down when i do planks. i am 5"1' and it falls at a perfect length on my hips. love it! going to get more. (the white didn't work for me, it is sheer and shows the tiniest rolls and flabs)
This tank is wonderful. It's light, its breathable, it's roomy. Great for weight workouts, cardio. I'm not sure what it might not be great for.
Love love love this tank! It has some nice breathing room and is ULTRA SWEAT WICKING. I'm definitely getting more colors!

I love this tank. I use it for running and training. Its comfortable, not too loose but yet enough to make you feel free. This is my favorite go-to for hot summer run days. I love the feeling of this tank and its super comfortable.

I tried this thank in my spinning class and mu kickboxing class. I prefer tank with silver fiber for my spin class, bit it's excellent for the kickboxing one. I love the fact that this shirt is loose, so i can move and i don't feel too tight.

I have the original sculpt tank and love it...this one, not so much. As a matter of fact, I returned it. As a previous person stated, it fits nicely except the arm holes are huge and gape open. Thank goodness I still had the tags attached and could return it.
Great fit and colors. I have the old sculpt tank which I love but actually prefer the sculpt II as the fit is more flattering. I think it is longer than sculpt I which is great.

After trying on a number of different style tops in the store, I found this one (size 8) to be the perfect fit for my 3 months postpartum body (5'4, 145lbs, 34C). It's roomy yet flattering. Material is ideal for running in warm weather. I love it so much I purchased it in 3 different colors.
Love love love this skort! It fits great, stays in place and is very flattering! I’m 5’5, 138lbs and I ordered a size 6.

column12: the lack of detail on the seams
column16: I love this skirt. I play tennis everyday and have this in at least 5 colors. We even had it for team uniforms one year. Washes nice and lasts a while. True to size. My only slight issue was that on the seams that run vertical on the front, they are no longer a ribbon material like on the original skirts. Bring that back please!!

O really like this skirt, you can totally move free. The only thing I would change is the interior short make it a little bit longer, when I have long trainings my inside thighs get rubbed and it hurts.

Love the fact that this run skirt comes in sizes. This prevents it from being too short on people also it has great interior pockets to hold your stuff. The elastic around the thighs prevents the shorts from creeping up. Highly recommend this product

column11: backside pleats, zipper pockets, no-slip grip on shorts, flat waistline, sits at actual waist
column16: I love all Lululemon skorts! I love these too...but they're REALLY short! I love the way Lululemon designs pleats in the back of the skorts, and designs with a kind of non-slip grip on the shorts, and all the features of these and all their skorts, but maybe add an inch to this skort?
The skirt was really short would’ve rather gotten the longer skirt

column11: rubber gripper on shorts is great! no creeping!
column16: LOVE LOVE LOVE this skirt/skort. Fit is great, and the shorts do not creep up while I am running!!!!! Went back and ordered more and already told my other running friends to buy them! Please offer them in other colors! Bright fun colors....the lime green sold out before I could get it!

I live in lulu bottoms. This was my first time purchasing a skirt and I love it! It's a little short on me in the back but kind of in a flirty-fun way. The lines across the front of the skirt really add to the shaping. Love the fit at the waist but it is a little loose compared to the thigh area (could just be my shaping though).

column14: OK, but the stickies ruin it for me.
column16: I have four Lulu skirts and this one is not my favorite. First, I really hate the stickies at the bottom of the shorts that are supposedly meant to keep the shorts in place. These do not keep the shorts in place and they are actually uncomfortable (especially in humid weather). I much prefer the shorts (without the stickies) from the Motionful skirt.
column18:
Dear KRSARUN,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: I love this skirt just wished Lulu would offer the same colors in tall as you do in the regular sizes. The tall selections are far and few to choose from

column14: Great for any type of cardio!
column16: This was my first lululemon purchase a couple years ago and I still love it! I've since purchased a couple other skirts (the circuit breaker is very similar). It's great for running, cardio classes, hiit, etc. I prefer to wear a skirt when working out, especially when it's hot out!

column7: TORONTO LIVING IN THE FRENCH RIVIERA...CANNES FRANCE
column11: the color, the fit and flow
column16: I have just rcvd my pace rival skirt in the post. This is the very first time, that I've decided to "try" wearing a skirt, rather than shorts/tights. Absolutely LOVE this product. Fits like a dream, is totally adorable, and will be AWESOME for teaching pilates!! It feels unreal, flows beautifully and is 100% feminine. Can't wait to see what my clients have to say. I LOVE IT, and will definitely be ordering the EXACT same in other colors.

column12: fit too much fabric, pleats did not lay well
column14: Fit is not like the old pace rival
column16: I have many of the old style pace rival skirts and they fit way better than this new version. This skirt has too much fabric and the back pleats do not lay as nice. I tried to size down and it improved the fabric excess but the shorts were too small to fit a tennis ball. Why are you always trying to change a good thing Lulu. So disappointed as I have not been able to wear any of your new skirts, the fit/style has not been appealing.

column14: Please lulu never change this amazing skirt!
column16: I love love this skirt. In my younger years I wore it for bartending and waitressing in different pubs and working in the pro shops at some golf courses. These days it is a staple in my summer wardrobe--SO comfortable but still girly (I always get compliments). I don't wear them as often as my other lulu bottoms to sweat hard in (for high intensity gym workouts, hot yoga, or running), but I do wear them for biking, walking, and hiking. Perfect to throw over a bathing suit bottom too!

I'm happy to see Lululemon has gone back to the pace rival skirts and have discontinued the more recent styles like Lost in Pace. The eucalyptus green color is gorgeous. My only complaint is that this color has not been released in a tall length, at least so far. Any chance it's going to come out in a tall? I bought the regular but am not so comfortable with the length - that is really my only issue with the skirt. Now, give us some colorful prints in the pace rivals (tall lengths!) and you will have a lot of happy Lululemon skirt fans.
I was skeptical of this skirt but decided to give it a try in store. It is so flattering and a nice change from the pace setter! Please add more colors!
This skirt is really nice for tennis. The built-in short liner is perfect for holding tennis balls. The cut is flattering. I'm glad that tennis players now have another option from Lululemon.

column14: Adorable & Fits like a dream BUT...
column16: the stripes on the short are really unfortunate! Not only are the stripes really unflattering in general, they are visible through the pleated material (particularly the aquamarine). A solid colour like cadet blue would have been MUCH better. I received this short a few days ago & I love it so much that I haven't yet returned it, but I also haven't removed the tags and worn it... So far I'm undecided: I LOVE the short, but can I get past the horrible stripes?

column12: shorts do not stay in place
column14: Cute style, but shorts ride up
column16: Very cute style. Not as "puffy" as the Pace Setter. I found the shorts to be too loose and ride up. I am 5'2 and 118 lbs. I don't like my skirts to be too short. Perhaps I should have ordered a tall (even though I am not, but like longer length) and a smaller size (4) in order to avoid the shorts not staying put.

I was looking for a bottom to wear with my lulu tops other than my wunder unders to wear to figure skating(sometimes pants are a little hot to skate in during the warmer months). I purchased this skirt in solid black about two months ago and love it so far. The skirt is not too full or fluffy, that was an issue for me with some of the skirts with pleats in the back. I am glad I tried this on before purchasing. I tend to be between a 4 and 6, often going with the 6 for my bottoms. However, I found the 4 fit comfortably with this skirt.
