For reference I am about 5'2 116 lbs. I wear this to and from as well as skating. It is a flattering fit and the shorts underneath stay in place. I would recommend this for a wide variety of activities, or just to wear for running errands, very stylish and functional!

column11: the color combination is great!, flexible, comfortable
column12: the strips on the under short shows though
column14: Very Cute, but the stripes are see though!
column16:
I have multiple lulu pace skirt. The aqua+purple+blue combination is the cutest one so far.
But who's idea was it to put a non solid color underneath this beautiful skirt?????? There are big stripes right on top of my my lady area...it looks like pubi* hair showing through. Whoever designed this need to think twice.
But if you can get over the strips showing all over your buttock and lady area..go for this skirt!
The construction of this skirt is great! Very comfortable! I normally wear small (5''4 and 120lb for reference) and reg 6 in LULU skirt always work for me.
I have run in these lulu skirts for many years and wash them carelessly in machine, so far all of them held up! Highly recommand!
column18:
Hi Linlincat,

Thank you for sharing your feedback on this particular pattern, it is something our designers will want to know. If the sheerness is preventing you from enjoying your gear, pop into your local store and let them know more about the issues you are experiencing. An educator will be happy to make this right for you.

column16: for reference I am 130lbs and 5'4" - i bought this in size 6 but I do wear a 4 in pacesetter. Watch the fabrics - the 4 way stretch is ultra swift fabric which results in the pleats laying flatter. The 2 way stretch is swift (not ultra) and it is stiffer, thicker which makes the pleats puff out a bit. I have this style in both 2way and 4 way and like them both - though I do find that tanks that are a bit longer tend to go over the skirt enough to help keep the pleats from puffing up as much (when I am wearing the 2 way stretch skirts). I have been waiting for over a month for more patterns! Maybe curious jungle will be released in this skirt?

column14: Why put striped lining under light colors?
column16: I love the fit and look of this skirt, but why-oh-why would you put a striped liner under such light colors like aquamarine and cool breeze? The aquamarine and cool breeze panels are totally see through so it looks like I'm wearing striped underwear for all to see! A solid cadet blue lining would have made more sense. Can't decide if I'm going to keep it due to the liner, but I would definitely purchase again in a different color. I thought it ran TTS.

Very Nice skirt although I could have bought the one for tall but it looks
really cute for tennis. I love the shorts they never ride up

Got this one from the store today not online and after reading the reviews on sizing I decided to take a few different sizes. I usually wear a 4 in the skirt so I tried both and sure enough the 6 fit like my 4's usually do. I really like that this skirt is somewhat different then the Pace Setter..I play a lot of tennis so the skirt selection gets really boring. Whenever I see something a little different, I'm always picking it up..Please Lulu, get a little more creative with the styles..I know you can do it :) And always include white for the Tennis White girls.

I bought this skirt in AQAM/COBR/CABU (navy, aqua, purple) and LOVE the fit! I am 5'9" 125 lbs but have the most weight in my hips/bottom and I feel this skirt is a flattering fit. I am normally a 6 in Lululemon bottoms and bought a 6 in this skirt. Make more colors Lululemon!!

normally wear a 4 in skirts, 4 was a little small. also the front doesnt lie flat where the band of the waist meets the skirt. you can actually tell in the pix. I have another skirt that does this. you cant wear something fitted and long on top... pace setter and another skirt Lulu made thats seamless and flat in front definitely works better. going to the store to try the 6 and see if that helps.. cute otherwise!

I love this skirt! I have a lot of different styles both old and new and this one is really adorable for any purpose. I love the way it fits. I am normally an 8 in lulu skirts and I ordered an 8 but I do think it is a little more snug than usual. It might be a1/2 size different but not enough for me to order a size up.

OK....I am a curvy size 4 in the pacesetter skirt. Meaning I like it to fit a tad tight. I LOVE the pace rival skirt IN THE 4-WAY STRETCH, SIZE 6! I did NOT like the 2-way stretch. If this helps anyone with sizing issues, then yay. These skirts are too cute AND practical. I also love that I can pull the shorts a bit longer DURING a run (chaffing issues much?) and then yank 'em back up for a flirtier look when done!

I finally found another Lulu skirt that I love. I don't really like the Pacesetter. I find it too similar to a mullet. It's all business (and boring) in the front, but a party in the back. This one has cute, yet understated pleats all over and is so flattering. I ordered a size up from my usual size and it fits perfectly. I ordered it in 2 more colors too! For reference, I have super long legs (I'm only 5'6", but a 34" inseam). I don't feel like I am showing too much leg. I can't wait to run in this one too!

column11: very light and airy, short length
column16: This is the best running skirt that I've found so far. It looks really cute (short!) and takes care of the cameltoe issues i have with just compression shorts alone. It feels very light, and I haven't noticed any chafing even after 5 or 6 miles. It does run a bit small, though; I usually wear a size 4 in lulu, but I also ordered a size 6 just in case and found it to be a better fit.
tried this on in store, but it's no where near as flattering to the thighs as the pace setter. It made my legs look much bigger than they actually are.
I normally wear a 4 in lulu running skirts but this definitely runs small. Very cute skirt in a larger than normal size.

column12: needs a slightly longer inseam for the shorts
column16: As other reviews have mentioned, this skirt runs slightly smaller than other Lulu skirts, which happens to work perfectly for me! I usually buy a size 8 and deal with them being a little on the loose side rather than a tad too tight in a size 6. The 8 in this skirt is the perfect solution for me. If you like the loose feeling of Lulu skirts (which is great for my workouts that don't involve high impact activities) then definitely size up.

column12: price: *ahem* make this thing cheaper please
column16: I finally tried and bought this skirt in the Petite Fleur print and it is super cute/sexy!

column12: sizing is different from other lulu bottoms
column16: I'm usually a 6 in all lulu bottoms and tops. I originally bought the Pace Setter skirt in a size 6 but when it arrived I found out it was too big. I went to exchange for a smaller size and I decided to also try on the Pace Rival skirt (in a 4) and liked it much more. I think the pleats all around the skirt are more flattering.

I wear size 4 in all lululemon tops and bottoms, but this one fit more snug around the waist and seemed shorter in length (the shorts underneath show more). I have so many pacesetter skirts that I was looking for something new, but I didn't love this skirt. The pleats also lay in an awkward way. Overall, I think I'll stick with the pacesetter skirt for now.

I really love the fit when I first wore it that I fell in love. Therefore, I bought the white and black one in crop. For some reason, the seams of the green and black started to come off. I was bummed that it happened. However, I love these pants so much that I want to buy them in other colors. I like how it tight and keeps everything in place and most off it make my bottom perky lol
Like them so much it’s my 2nd pair. Husband bought me a pair of these and the crop version for Mother’s Day. He benefits by me wearing them :)

column11: fit, they stay up, they breathe great
column16: These are my favorite favorite favorite tights - until this pair! I own 6 pairs of these pants and have never had issues with the patterns I purchased being see-through. Unfortunately this pair was :( hopefully this is not the case for other patterns. For reference I purchased the Shoreline multi-blue. Hopefully this isn't an issue with other patterns because these are my favorite!

column12: way too pricey, starts to expand after some time
column14: Best tights for any activity but beware expansion with long use
column16: I love these tights! The are great for mat classes and cardio alike. Beware using them too often and washing because they will expand with long term use despite costing usd 98.
This particular material seems to be extra stiff and I'd say that the waist runs a size small compared to every other item I own. Not my favorite pair of leggings.

Love that these 7/8 pants are zipper free and have mesh for ventilation! I have these in pants and crops and both versions look very flattering, even on those of us who are short. For reference, I’m 5’1” and wear a size 4.
Can’t complain about these. They stay up when I am running. Most pants I am constantly pulling up. And the burgundy/purple color is perfect
Super flattering.

These leggings are in the running for my favorite pair from lulu. I have them in the white pattern as well as black and love the mesh that adds an extra layer of style and airflow. They are excellent for hot yoga classes because they stay put and are breathable. I would highly recommend!
Love these leggings. I use them for crossfit and never have an issue with them! They stay in place, wick sweat, and go with me everywhere. Love love love them!

I own multiple pairs of the train times pants and they were my favorite until I bought the navy pair. I have had the navy pair for less than 5 months and have maybe washed them five times. I always followed the care instructions and hung them dry, but the last time I washed them a huge hole ripped in the crouch . I loved these pants, but now they are completely unwearable.
column18:
Dear liv4498,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear that your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" is not performing for you! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: Bought these as a summer workout pant, well I should have given them a test run before taking them on vacation because they were so uncomfortable. Had to cut my hikes short which was pretty disappointing. They double the fabric to make the white less transparent but it only makes them very thick and hard to wear.
column18:
Dear JennL29,

I'm sorry to hear your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" has malfunctioned, it should not be that uncomfortable. Please look out for a email from us soon! We want to help you out!

column16: I love these! Would buy again

These pants are fabulous. I have them in a capri version as well. As a Jazzercise instructor teaching intense cardio/strength classes, these do the best job at sweat wicking. The material is breathable (with the mesh) and they hold me in perfectly.

I love these pants! They are wonderful compress pants, don't stretch out, and are great for intense workouts! I had them in the black color at first and then I went out to buy two more. However, both the black and one of my new pairs are starting to go downhill. One pair is starting to almost unravel from the seams, and the other got snags on the front part of the thigh and making it unsightly. None of my luxtreme pants have ever gotten snags on the fabric so it is highly disappointing considering the price. I would love to recommend these to friends and coworkers but I'm so skeptical now.
column18:
Hey GymnastFeels,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect.

column16: I got the gravity color, which is like a dark blue grey color. These run a little small due to the Luxtreme material. They are also about 2 inches shorter than my In Movement Pants, which are also 25 inches. Not sure why these are so much shorter, but I still like them!

column14: I should have read the reviews
column16: I have several train time 7/8 pants and have not had an issue, so I bought them without reading the latest reviews. This was a mistake: this new color is see- through and not up to the standards of the previous versions.
column18:
Hi snowbird,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" isn’t up to the task. I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.

column16:
The train times are one of my favorite bottoms for training and running.
First, I like the fit. The rise is perfect and they “hold you in”.
I buy them in my TTS (4) and they fit on the tighter side so I never need to adjust them while working out. If you don’t like your pant to be tight, I recomend sizing up. They are not as tight as the “tight stuff” but they are not as “giving” as the “fast and free”.
Second, they have mesh, which I like. It adds to the look and to the function!
I also think that the length is great for training.
My only complain is that they don’t have side pockets....
I never liked the back pocket and I’m always reaching out to the pants with the side pockets first...
other than that, they are perfect!

column14: My favorite lululemon style by farrr!
column16:
These tights are honestly the best. Since I'm petite at 5'3" it's hard to find a good pair of full length leggings that aren't too long. I recommend these for those who are more on the athletic side with muscular legs and bum and a smaller waist like myself. They never slide off and they fit my legs like a glove.
I have them in three colors and they have all been wonderful even after continuous wash cycles!
These are great-fitting spectacular pants. A drenching sweat won't loosen the fit.

I had previously bought this style before with no issue. So I ordered another pair on line, needing some new colors to add to my collection. To my surprise these pants were straight up see through. You could see my underwear from the front and the back and I had ordered two different colors. Both colors were the same issue. I was extremely disappointed. Which begs the question, has the material changed? This has never been an issue in the past. If you have bought or are going to buy a pair in the near future, better check them out before you head to the gym.
column18:
Hey NikMarie23,

Thanks for taking the time to pass along some feedback on the Train Times 7/8 Pant. I'm sorry to hear that the material is appearing as translucent. Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

column16: These are by far my favorite lulu pants. Perfect for any sweat session at the gym! Not to mention they make you look great and feel fabulous! A+ all the way on these! I have several pairs and all look and hold up great after washing and hang dry.

I am honestly surprised by all the negative reviews about this product. I have not experienced any pilling or wear in the seams after owning 2 pairs for over 3 months. I wear and wash mine every week after a heated yoga sculpt class. They are compressive enough where they don't fall down during squats or cardio, but stretchy enough where I can still find my deepest lunge with comfort. Overall, I love everything about these pants! I am 5' 2" and 105lbs with a petite build and the size 4 is PERFECT. I am always a size 4 in "Full on Luxtreme/Luon" pants at lulu, whereas for "Luxtreme/Luon" I am a 2. I am seriously amazed at the fact that I never have to pull my pants up during my workout! These leggings are pricey but worth it!

Bought these pants and have always loved them but recently they have started to peel on the sides and have stretched out from my body. Upset because they used to work so well for me and now they do not preform.
column18:
Dear Ejoan,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear that your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" is not performing for you! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: I wanted to love these leggings. They had compression and were a good length...then I started to work out. I did a jump squat and had someone tell me they could see my underwear. Then, close up, you could see the sweat on my leggings. Enough said.
column18:
Hi CN93,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.

We stand behind the quality of our gear, and we’d like to work with you towards a fix.

To carry on this conversation, we've sent you a follow up email.

Kind Regards,
Daniel

column16: I bought a pair of these in green a little over a week ago, and immediately went back and bought them in navy a few days later. Even after a workout, I don't want to take them off. They are a great pair of crop leggings for me, since I'm 5'11'' and too tall for the actual cropped leggings. The high rise feature is awesome, and I love the thickness of the leggings. Not too thick, but still enough coverage and support to feel comfortable. Highly recommend!
I LOVE the look and fit of these pants, but they are VERY see through. The only undies you can wear with these are nude - which is fine, but obviously not ideal. Buyer beware!
column18:
Hey GOALGETTER,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.

We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further.

We'll be following up via email to discuss this further. Speak soon!

column12: loosened too much too fast, too pricy for quality
column16: My boyfriend got me these in a size 8 and I'm normally a 6 or an 8. I normally go for black and he got me a bluish teal color, which was very pretty. I loved them at first until the ankle started to loosen and is now very baggy around my leg. I didn't think these leggings would lose their structure so easily since they were so expensive. I wanted to love them but I'm just left disappointed.
column18:
Dear aRNandaRunner,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that the Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" is not performing for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!

column16: I have absolutely no complaints about these leggings. Never had a problem with the mesh ripping or any seams coming undone. These are lightweight and versatile for any activity. They never sag and I love the cool, smooth feel of the Luxtreme fabric. The best part is nothing sticks to these-- no cat hair, lint, dust, etc! Highly recommended and will be purchasing more!

First time wearing these pants and I already had a bad experience with the material, it gets stuck on things and the stitching comes undone on the sides. I also had to keep pulling them up witch was very frustrating, I am sadly disappointed.
column18:
Hi Coribear,

Thanks for taking the time to pass along some feedback on the Train Times 7/8 Pant 25". I'm sorry to hear the material is not giving you a great experience. Keep an eye out for an email headed your way. Chat soon!

column16: I've had these for a few months but never wear them because the waistband doesn't lay flat and I find myself pulling them up constantly. The material is also pretty sheer.
column18:
Hi a713,
Thanks for taking the time to connect with us. It sounds like your gear isn't performing for you, so I've sent an email your way with some solutions. Chat soon!

column11: high rise, support, compression, comfort, fit
column16: These are my go-to training tights and are soooo comfortable I forget I have them on. I love the higher rise and compression which is very flattering. Full on luxtreme is my favorite compression fabric. I own 5 pairs and so far they are all 100% squat-proof. The drawcord waistband is definitely a plus and keeps it from sliding down. They do get a bit hot but I think that's what you get for full on luxtreme, which I believe is 2 layers of luxtreme for that compressed feel and coverage. For really hot days I just wear shorts.

Finally found a pair of lululemons that don't slide down and give saggy crotch! They are super-compressive. Which is great for me, but I mean they are tight. So you've been warned. I was a little surprised with how hot I was in them, though. They're think, which make them flattering, but some of my other leggings are the same thickness but don't quite make me sweat so much! Only drawback for now. Hopefully they don't stretch out over time. I've been using them for lifting, movement training, and coaching my athletes. So far so good.

Loves these pants. The high rise stays in place during runs and keeps me cool. Originally bought the black pair and went back for a second pair in a color. 5'7 and 150 pounds - true to size and doesn't change shape. I've worn lululemon for years and these are my new fave pants.
These are a leave-behind item - despite the sale price! These are completely see-through! Tried even with light colored undies and these are a total no-go!
column18:
We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us.
I'm sorry to hear of the coverage issues that you're experiencing with your pants and can understand why you're not pleased. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.

column12: lining of white, not as comfortable or wearable as train time short
column14: WHITE NEEDED FOR SUN PROTECTION BUT UNFORTUNATELY WERE LINED AND WAY TO HEAVY AND HOT TO WEAR
column16: DISAPPOINTED! Needed a long white pant for tennis (would have much preferred fast and free nulux pants as they are lightweight with pockets and stay up, however, no white yet ). As I wear the train times shorts nearly daily, thought I would try the train times 7/8 pant when I saw the white. I also ordered in Jasmine White Multi/White. The white is lined and so very thick, heavy, uncomfortable and hot. They are very heavy just holding. I am not worried about "see thru". Just needed white for some additional coverup as in Florida, in the sun all the time. Returning. The fabric weight of the Jasmine White Multi/White is similar to the shorts, but not as comfortable as the shorts, feel like they are pulling down. Also, the netting is not comfortable as larger area than the shorts, and netting area so large will not help protect from the sun. Returning.
column18:
Hey Watersport,
We're sorry to read of your recent experience with the Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

column16: The material and color of the leggings did not disappoint, however the seams definetly did. Before I got a chance to try them on I noticed that the seams on the inside of the waistband were already unraveling in two different spots. This normally wouldn't phase me because I could have returned them but this is a final sale item so it is a bit upsetting.
column18:
Hey sixteen16,
Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. I'm sorry to hear you're having such trouble with your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25"! I'd love to chat with you further about this and find a resolution. Talk soon!

column14: Loved these leggings until I bought my last pair which were destroyed by one wash
column16: I love this pants they are comfortable and flattering, I have 4 pairs. But with the latest pair I bought after 1 wash (per directions and how I have washed all my other leggings) the dye is uneven/miscolored and the seams are unraveling and pilling. Super disappointing because I have only washed them once and I loved the color.
column18:
Dear runnershelby,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear that have multiple concerns regarding your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25". We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: These were/are my first ever purchase from Lululemon so I really wanted to love them especially because of the mesh detail. They fit great in store but I noticed that the leggings would start to lose their shape - especially around the ankles and waist band - after one wear or throughout the day if I am wearing them for long hours. The only reason I would recommend to a friend is because the style is super cute!
column18:
Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us.
I'm sorry to hear of the retention loss that you're experiencing on your pants and can understand why you're not pleased. Watch out for an email coming your way soon.

column14: Love the leggings, not the stitching
column16: Bought these leggings today and loved the compressive fit of them when I tried them on in the store. I got home and was taking the tag off when I realized that the seam on the inside of the waistband was already unraveling. Was super excited to try these out, but now I'm stuck with a pair of leggings that are busted before I even got to wear them.
column18:
Hey Mariahl22,

I'm sorry to hear you are having issues with the Train Times 7/8 Pant. Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

column16: Yoga pants that flatter! I did grab the black pair, which undoubtedly helps. Yet, it fits to my body, but not too much. I love every aspect of these pants-- EXCEPT they seem to absorb unpleasant odors. This has never been a problem in the past, or with any of my other clothes or leggings. Even after a day of wear, of which I showered that morning, seems to grab all the scent of my sweat. I can't wear these for more than one day without having to soak them in fabric softener before wash. Great product, unfortunate aspect.
column18:
Dear Chaya,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: I bought these pants in store a week ago and after trying them on at home, I noticed the seams were undone, and sadly there are no more items in the size and color I want in the stores near me or online. I hate to have to just return them as I would love to exchange but I can't drive out of state for a pair of pants unfortunately. Such a disappointment as I love the fit and style of the pants.
column18:
Hey rogershk,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column14: so cute, but not very functional
column16: I wore these twice, washed them once and the side seam is already fringing. Also the fabric has stretched out from only two workouts and the color has faded in the knees. I wanted to love these because the design is so cute but not impressed with the durability.
column18:
Hey Kd00,

Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on the Train Times 7/8 Pant *25". I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. I'm going to follow this up with an email that outlines how to move towards a resolution.

column16: I really wanted to love these leggings, and branch out from my addiction to the align leggings BUT they were completely see through when I bent down. I have never had a problem with any of my other lulu leggings in that department. The style, fit, and color of the leggings were so perfect but I cannot have leggings this expensive be see through. Maybe I got a bad pair but it made me so sad because I cant even wear them to the gym.
column18:
Dear lululoverandcoach,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that your Train Times 7/8 Pant 25" is see through. I would hate it if that were the case with mine. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat Soon!

column16: These pants are nice, similar to all the right places, compression-wise. The drawcord doesn't give you much of a muffin-top, like I thought it might. These pants are great for the gym, which is always a plus. Would recommend!

I recently bought these in the celadon color. The fit and color are great. I'm a runner and had no issues with them staying in place, however, after the first wear, I noticed the side seam is already coming undone. For the price, I would not expect that to happen. I have a number of other Lulu pants some years old and have not had the same issue.
column18:
Hey runlulus,
Oh dear, that's definitely not meant to happen. I'd love to chat with you further about this and find a resolution -- keep your eyes out for an email coming your way, shortly!

column16: When I first got these pants I absolutely loved them - super flattering and sucked everything in. Right away when I got them, I noticed a few seams popping on the ankles but I just ignored it because I loved the pants so much. Sadly, this continues to happen no matter how delicate you care for them. The entire seem in between the legs has come unraveled and I am afraid to wear them in fear that it will rip open while I am at the gym. Would not buy again.
column18:
Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts on Train Times 7/8 Pant *25".
I completely understand why you're disappointed with this and I'd love to help turn this around. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect.

column16: Wore these for many activities including yoga, jogging, burpees and they stay where they are supposed to. I really like the mesh stripe on the side which makes them stylish too. I have washed and dried them a few times with no piling or shrinkage problems.

These pants are described as good for training/boot camp but after four wears at the most-- I have a BIG, NOTICEABLE hole in the thigh. I am so sad about this as I love the fit and feel of these pants. I am a dedicated lululemon customer and this is the first time I have branched out from my aligns. Obviously this fabric is not durable and that is really disappointing. I have never had this type of issue so maybe it was just this certain pair. I would expect a training pant to hold up better than this pair did. I would still recommend this pant to anyone and continue to buy lulu but I am very sad about the hole in my pants.
column18:
Hi magicalstretchypants,
We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We hear what a frustrating experience this must be and have sent an email your way so we can do some digging into this.

column16: I love these leggings so much! The fabric is soft and comfortable. I mainly run in them and the hugged sensation make them my favorite to run in. The fabric is thick enough that they aren't see through, which is very important. Overall, they are just the best leggings! I've had them for about a year and they are still are my favorite leggings. They are durable, comfortable, and soft all while looking great!

I have this pair in black-true to size. I love them for running or strength training. I also bought them in jasmine-multi. This pair is hard to pull up over my thighs bc even in the same size the waistband is way to tight and also bending over there is transparency in the back. Once I get them on they feel really nice so I kept the second pair.
Tonight I ordered a couple more pairs to see if I can find more that fit like my black pair. I have high hopes but if they are too tight in the waist they will be returned.

I love my Train Times pants...all though they have the mesh the ventilation isn't the best,they are still very nice pants. They are super cute and can be worn casually or to the gym, and I love how the waist band stays on unlike some of their other leggings...However, when a small hole appeared in mine the patching job totally ruined the look of these pants! But, a new pair is on the way! These are definitely my favorite pair of leggings from Lulu I own!

column11: high waist, compression, style, flattering fit
column16: I've been shopping with Lulu for years, and these are by far my favorite, go to pants. I have several pairs, long and cropped, and have never had one single problem. The high waist and tighter compression keep everything lifted and in place for high intensity workouts and running, and they're flattering on the bootie! The material isn't too thin so I've had no problem with sheerness (although I admittedly don't ever buy white workout pants). Some of my Train Times are over a year old and still look and perform beautifully. I've never had a single issue with stitching or mesh falling apart, and I wash them in the regular cycle with all my other clothes. I'm highly skeptical of the reviews stating their Train Times pants fell apart!! If I could give these pants 10 stars I would!

I really like these leggings! I got them in the light green seafoamy color BUT...I've only worn them 3 times and there are these huge runs in them coming from the crotch area down to the ankle or calf :( I'm super bummed because yes the leggings are not see through....but you can see the runs in them. The same thing happened with my dark green Nulux leggings too :( Why are there so many runs?!
column18:
Dear Kapowfitness,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to hear that your Train Times 7/8 Pant *25" has experienced some runs in the fabric. We would love to discuss your concerns further. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column16: I bought these pants in the Wee Are From Space Ice Grey Alpine White color and the fit is great, but the color and material is so sheer that I can't wear them out of the house. I am very disappointed.
column18:
Hi MereScott,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution.To carry on this conversation, we've sent you a follow up email.

column16: If I could give these pants a zero I would. They are not even remotely worth the price. Within one wear the mesh ripped and left a large hole. They also lost their shape and fit within the first wear! I love Lululemon but the price is just not worth the quality (or lack thereof.) I'm tired of purchasing items that don't hold up!
column18:
Hi Boston730,
Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback. It's not good to hear that your gear has a hole. I'd love to help make this right, so I've sent an email your way with some solutions. Chat soon!

column16: I loved these pants when I first received them, but it didn't take long for them to start to fall apart. Pilling and strings hanging out, this made me disappointed.
column18:
Hi ASKD1254,
Thanks for taking the time to connect with us. It sounds like your gear isn't performing as intended. I've sent an email your way so we can chat further.

column11: high rise, fabric, seams, mesh detail
column16: Got these pants a few months ago and have to keep myself from wearing them every time I workout! Love the high rise to hold me in and the simple mesh on the side. Seams are flattering as well. Luxtreme is always great!

I have tried tons of leggings in all sorts of fabrics and fits. These are easily the most versatile leggings. They stay up during bootcamps, metcons, runs, and cycle classes. The material is thick so you are secure, but they are not hot nor trap sweat and moisture. Quick drying and flattering always. I own five pairs. Definitely recommended especially for high intensity workouts that require more structure and support for fast movements.

I ordered these online and when I tried them on I loved the way they hugged my body but was so disappointed when I bent over you could see right through them. The lettering on the tag was visible through the fabric. I'm not sure if sizing up would've made a difference but I exchanged them in store for some Aligns. I would love to try these again in another color but if it's got white in it the fabric needs to be opaque. I expect more out of a $100 pair of leggings.

The train times collection is my absolute favorite for powerlifting. Thank you for creating durable, form fitting and reliable pants! I've had otherwise good experiences with the wunder under and aligns, as my training style does not accommodate with the type of material, but train times keeps me a happy and loyal customer. Can't wait for the next set of colors to come out!

I love these pants. They stay up when running, they don't show sweat, and they are very flattering. I got my usual Lulu size (4), and they fit perfectly. I have worn these 20+ times for Barry's Bootcamp and haven't experienced any pilling, stretching, or discoloration. I love them and will be buying more.

I am so sad to write this review but I don't want anyone else to waste their hard-earned money on the pants. I only wore them a few times and the stitching in the knee started to tear and now there is a hole in the knee. I am so disappointed especially because I washed them exactly as directed and ran in them a few times.
column18:
Hey HJohnson2785,

This definitely doesn't sound right. Please give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 to chat through some options.

column16: I have two pairs of these and love them! i reecently went down a size in leggings so my 6's are starting to become too big. I ordered a size 4 in the Jasmine White Multi/White and they were sooooo see through. I love this pattern but not impressed with how see through they are. Taking back the 4's. Im not sure if i just need a bigger size or it is the pattern.

I have 4 pairs of these pants now in royal blue, persian blue, navy, and I just bought them in the pattered white pair with the grey stripes. I give these pants 4 stars instead of 5 because the fabric is inconsistent. The solid colors are more silky and thicker than the new patterned pair I just bought which almost feel like the nulu fabric. I still love them either way (I almost prefer the nulu fabric anyways) but it just wasn't what I was expecting.

column14: Amazing, some of my favorite lululemons
column16: I got these in the dusty dawn color and fell in LOVE. They're squat proof, stay up, and don't budge throughout any type of workout. The only issue I have is that the material will show almost every sort of panties - you have to wear a thong or one of those no show seam ones. Any sort of lace material will be visible.

At first I was in love with them, the fit is very flattering and overall they have held up well. The biggest downside is they pill very quickly, after about a month of having them areas that you wouldn't even expect to have pilling are very pilled. I have followed all of the washing instructions because they are pricy and I wanted to make sure they would hold up well, unfortunately they have not. There also seems to be some loose strings coming out from the fabric, which has not been able to be remedied. I love the pants, but for the price that they are I would expect better quality especially because they are meant for exercise.
column18:
Dear lyssa2018,

Thanks for making time to leave a review.

We hear where you're coming from and I'm sorry to hear your pants haven't held up for you as expected. We're eager to work out a resolution, so I'm sending you an email to chat more.

column16: I honestly wasn't expecting to purchase these pants. Long time lulu fan here since 2002 so I've tried and own a lot. I really wanted something in this dusty dawn color and when I turned around and blinked the high waisted wunder unders sold out so I saw these and purchased them in dusty dawn and white. I'm not quite sure where the whole pilling thing is coming from other reviewers but I've never had pilling on anything lulu that was made of luxtreme. Luon well, that's another story but that is the nature of the beast of that fabric no matter what brand. Alo Yoga I'm talking to you. What may pill is the threading but not the fabric and that has happened very rarely. Pretty much only during the whole sheer rear debacle many years ago. I luckily haven't seen a problem since. With that said these appealed to me because at 5' tall I've grown to accept that leggings were never made with us short legged gals in mind. The petite people that can get away with it are size 0 and that I am not. I'm a size 6 in lululemon and everything with long sleeves and full length leggings tend to be too long. These were actually the perfect length and went straight to my ankles. No bunching. I have killer massive calves so they actually fit pretty nice. No open spaces really. I love where these fit on my waist too. High waisted and they hold my stomach in. I like the pocket in the back waist because with a little manipulating I can fit my iphone 7plus in. I like the mesh detail but truth be told I don't LOVE it. I kinda got sick of the whole mesh thing last year. Over all these are freaking amazing. I have to disagree with the negative reviews. I've worn and washed these and I'm lazy people I don't hang dry my stuff. I wash in cold inside out and low air dry in my dryer and they show no wear and tear. I was worried about ordering my true to size in these which is a 6 because the 6 in the speed crop made of the same material is a sausage tight fit. On a good note they hold all of me in on a bad note despite how tight those are I find myself constantly pulling them up. I didn't have that problem with these. Give them a try people. No really give it a try.

I am and always have been a huge fan of all things lululemon until I bought these pants in the mineralize/multi black pattern recently. I didn't realize until my husband pointed it out when we went to the gym together that the print is on top of a white background and anytime i was lunging or stretching, the fabric would stretch out to a white color. At first we thought they were see through but either way it is absolutely unflattering! I am disappointed because they're so cute when they're unstretched but I will definitely think twice before my next purchase of patterned pants. I don't want folks thinking my pants are see through!
column18:
Hi pharmfitgal,
I'm sorry to hear you're having such trouble with your pants! I'd love to chat with you further about this and find a resolution. I’ve sent you an email to follow up and help further.

column16: Ordered these on sale and I'm very happy with them. I think they are very true to size. I like them especially for extra sweaty gym sessions like running or cycling, but I wear them for anything. Thin enough for all of that, but thick enough that they certainly aren't see-through.

column14: Best weight training pant Lulu makes
column16: These are hands down the absolute best pants lulu makes, and I've tried a lot of fabrics and styles over the years. I currently own 7 pairs of train times, and will continue to add them to my collection. The first pair that I bought a year ago still look new, and have not changed their shape or fit one bit, and I train hard lifting weights in train times every day. Great for leg day, back day, cardio, anything. I don't understand others having issues, because every pair I own is perfect. Also, none are see through, and I own a couple that have white backing. I also have larger, muscular legs. The prints always look perfect. The material is durable and compressive, not thin or cheap at all. No problems with the mesh or seams, which I have experienced with other styles. These are the only pants I've purchased from lulu where I didn't have to use the drawstring cord. Other styles seem to stretch out in the waist, but not these. I recommend them very highly. For reference, I'm 5'3 138 pounds and wear a size 4.

I've worn my pair about 4-5 times now and have followed care instructions, but the seams are starting to fray and there is some slight pilling already. It's a really cute design and the fabric feels durable, but just a few wears to the gym and I have stray strings hanging off of the seams. I still really like them, I just wish they would hold up better for the price.
column18:
Hey etodd2016,

Thanks for reaching out and providing this feedback for us. Oh dear, I’m sorry to see you’re having some trouble with your gear—that's definitely disappointing. We’d like to get to the bottom of this and work towards a resolution, so I've sent you an email to follow up.

column16: I initially loved how my train times fit. Snug and comfortable but not too tight. Worn and washed them twice while following care instructions (delicate, cold, air dry) and then pants are now stretched out and big. Found them to be falling down and constantly had to be pulling them back up during workout (third time wearing). I also sized down in hopes to avoid this as I am usually an 8 and ordered a 6.

column11: perfect fit for my imperfect body., the length is the right length., they stay where they need to be, absorb sweat, colorful and tops no matter what year they were ma, long lasting
column12: love the dark prints more please
column16: I look for the perfect pair of pant to teach in. I have used several different versions but that I try on the these and once again I remember why I love them. For me they are perfect for what I teach. I’m on the deck in a pool area of high humidity. We keep it at 86 degrees and water tempts of 86 degree Leadinsweat is truly what I do.

I love the color and design on these pants but they don’t fit me like I feel they should. The fabric feels weird on my skin nothing like the other pants I have gotten from lulu. I feel like the material is see through so that makes me self conscious.
column18:
Dear Chanlou,

Thanks for making time to review the Train Times Pants. We're sorry to hear that the leggings aren't performing as intended.

We stand behind the quality of our product, and we want to ensure that you're in gear that is performing well for you. I hear that this is not the case and would like to work with you to create a resolution.

Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect.

column16: Pants fit perfectly at first and then stretched out after two washings (followed care instructions). Pants won't stay up during work out! Will be brining into store and returning. Not the quality I expect from Lululemon.
column18:
Dear ZRNM,

Thanks for making time to review the Train Times Pants. We're sorry to hear that the pants aren't holding up as intended.

We'd love to chat with you further to gather more information from you and work towards a resolution. We'll be reaching out via email, so keep your eyes peeled on your inbox.

column16: I have several different kinds of lulus but these are by far my FAVORITE. My training is mostly running and strength work with some hot yoga mixed in. I've worn these pants for all of these workouts and they are excellent for all of those, but they are also great for lounging around or running errands. They are tight but not restricting and they keep you dry and sweat free. They are also very flattering! BONUS: y'all I have two dogs and two cats and pet hair just doesn't stick to these. It's amazing. Some of my other lulus get covered in hair if I just look at my dog from the corner of my eye. I have napped on our fur-covered couch and woke up with no fur anywhere on my pants. Pet owners know how big of a deal this is. I have 3 pairs and will definitely buy more. Also, my oldest pair is a year and a half old (or so) and I wear them all the time and they still look brand new!

column14: great at first but stretched out
column16: These were my favorite leggings when I first got them, they fit great, looked nice and felt amazing. However, after wearing them I noticed they started to stretch out. I made sure to wash them as directed because they were expensive and I didn't want to ruin them, yet they still stretched out. Now they fit a little weird and dont feel supportive or flattering. At first they were perfect and I loved everything about them but just wearing them, as you are supposed to do with clothes, caused them to stretch out and it's no longer worth the price tag.
column18:
Hi eli345,
Thanks for taking the time to connect. I'm sorry to hear that your gear stretched out, that doesn't sound right. I've sent an email your way so we can turn this experience around for you.

column12: easily stretched out, pilling between legs
column16: I absolutely adored these pants at first! They hugged me just enough to hide my insecurities but also showed off my curves. After a few wears, they've started pilling between the legs and have DEFINITELY stretched. I find myself pulling them up non-stop when working out (I wish I could say it was due to losing weight!)
column18:
Hi Allie015,
Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts. It sounds like your gear isn't performing for you, so I've sent an email your way so we can find a fix. Keep an eye on your inbox.

column16: I love these pants they are perfect for crossfit, running, or general training. They fit true to size.
Best fitting leggings ever

I love these leggings! The waist is flattering and stays put when I am jumping/running in a class. The mesh is a nice detail. They fit snug, so that they aren't moving around or bunching while you are exercising. Good support for HIIT style classes.

Bought these crops because I was tired of always wearing black crops. Did not disappoint. Fit TTS and do not show embarrassing sweat stains! Love the higher waist and the fabric is light and holds up to several washings.

column14: Nothing special, arrived with a hole
column16: This is the first time I've actually bought anything from lululemon and I was super excited to try the leggings. The leggings fit and look great but honestly there are comparable leggings out there in terms of quality for a much better price point. In fact, when my leggings arrived they had a hole in them above the knee. I contemplated returning them but since I really only wear leggings while running I figured I'd just keep them. I recently purchased a pair of Yogalicious leggings on Amazon for a fraction of the cost and find I wear them far more frequently. I'm sure I'll give lulu another try but overall I was disappointed.

Pantalon qu'il faut éviter avec du velcro car celui ci s'effiloche et se magane, moi sur les côtés avec mes gants de vélo, â vérifier aussi dans la laveuse quand on retrouve sur d'autres vêtements.
J'aurais aimer une pochette sur le côté comme d'autres pantacour.

column12: waistband does not lay flat, rolling hems
column16:
I was looking for crops to train in and was recommended the Train Times Crop. They looked and fitted great on, but once I was in movement, the waist band began rolling constantly and the bottom hems kept riding up to my knees. I felt the crops were very wrinkly once in action and did not like that. I am not sure if others have this experience as well, but when I wear crops that end up bunching behind my knees, my skin would get wrinkle marks and get extremely itching so that why I am hesitant about crops.
Maybe this would not happen for passive activity, but it is quite bothersome during training.

column16: I purchased the multi twine /white crops in my regular size 8. I wore them around the house for about 30 mins and couldn’t wait to take them off. They were just too compressive. I have other train times crops, same size and did not have the same problem. I also found the mid rise strange on these crops. Again, was not the same as my other TT crops. Ultimately I exchanged them for WU.

column12: slight bit see through on a squat test.
column16: These crops are amazing! Awesome Fit! I bought them in the white with gray floral pattern. They are gorgeous. True to size. These are my new go to crop. Especially with the slight detail and perfect price!!

column11: the print on the fabric is very beautiful
column14: The most amazing tights ever! love love
column16:
I'm 1.73 meters and usually wears 6 size.
The print on the fabric is very beautiful and interesting.
The tights are not transparent at all, I have a tattoo on the hip, and I
Very happy that I can finally wear white tights
Which covers the tattoo and can not be seen.
The color of the tights is beautiful. And can fit nicely with other shirt colors.
Highly recommended for summer.
I highly recommend.
And thanks to Lululemon great designers.

Got these in one of the white print designs, loved everything about them. They fit right, looked good. Unfortunately paper thin. Even with the right underwear I wouldn't be comfortable wearing them. Recommend going for the darker colours.

For pants that feel like they should be moisture wicking, I can't wear these pants to the gym any more because they IMMEDIATELY and very visibly show patches of sweat. It's incredibly embarrassing, and extremely annoying to have such an expensive product under perform like this.
column18:

column16: These are my first lulu bottoms, love the color and fit, however they roll down at the top non-stop. It tried using the drawstring to tighten the waste and they still roll down, I was constantly pulling them up during my workout. So disappointed!!

column16: I like the design and fit. Pants passed several washes successfully. I would recommend.

Loved the Jasmine/white pattern- I took a huge risk on the white as I often wear my tights commando... these are like a second skin! fabulous for the gym, super attractive fit, love the higher waist and mesh panels. All my clients complimented me on them today. SO glad I got out of my comfort zone on the colour!

My favorite crops! I wear them mostly for spin and bootcamp classes. They stay in place, and the mesh panels on the sides are great for ventilation when exercising in a warm studio. I wear my usual size 4 (5'3", 120 lbs).

column11: fit, pattern, stayed in place, material
column16: I was hesitant to order these crops at first based on reading several negative reviews. The only negative thing I have to say is that the light grey/white colour can be a little see through if you're wearing darker underwear while squatting but fine with lighter underwear. Otherwise, I absolutely love these. The seams did not roll up my calf at all during my workout and the waistband barely moved and didn't fold over. I love that these are high-waisted and would definitely say they're among the better high-waisted crops compared to other athletic brands, where the waistbands creep down more. I ordered my usual size (2 - I'm 110 lbs and 5'2") and didn't find that they ran small at all (whereas some other lulus I do find too snug). They felt like they were going to be snug while getting them over my hips but I think that's just because they're high waisted and the waistband is less stretchy than other lulus. I actually really like this though because once they were on, they fit perfectly and weren't restricting at all (I've found some other brands to be), and the waistband laid flat and didn't creep down for my workouts.
These are my favorite bottoms from Lululemon. They stay in place all throughout my [yoga] practice. I wear these every where

This is my by far favorite ever Lulu crops!!!! they are perfect for my barre classes and I love the most that they are super flattering and don't loose their "look" after multiple washes. Just I wish they were available in more colors (Dusty Dawn for example...)
I highly recommend this product!!!! ( I am 5.5 and 120 lb and size 4 fits the best)

I really wanted to like these leggings, especially since I bit the bullet and paid full price for them. Since I bought them, I've only worn them a handful of times because when I squat down, they are totally see through! I bought a grey pair. I always thought that I didn't need to worry about this quality issue from Lululemon. Super disappointed because I did pay full price and I can't wear them to workout in when I do crossfit, or anywhere else for that matter (except the dark movie theater). I have other Lulu leggings and these are definitely not up to par for the thickness and quality of my other leggings.

column14: another ut oh found another thing of Lululemon I like
column16: I originally was attracted to the color of these in the store, brilliant blue, which looks like almost purple. It was in the wunder under in the store, but long tight only. I really wanted a capri so the sales person found the same color in this train time line, much more compressive which is good for me (45-55). and the cool side vents looks flashy. So far so good, have worked out in them for about 15 times. the only bagginess is when were doing stomach exercises on my back (we all thin out for those) in the hip flexor muscles area. I fit in a size 6 for the wunder under but opted for a 8 in this train time cause a 6 was super hard to get on. A great thing about these, the crotch sweat does not show or disappears very fast in this brilliant blue color. I'm 5'8" and weigh 140-145,depending on how much I endulge

These leggings are amazing for everything.
Great for a run, yoga, or just every day. They are extremely flattering in the stomach area and look great with all my tops.
I've bought 6 pairs now so I never don't have a pair to wear. (I have lots in black, gray, white pattern and the darker red)
I love them all.

column11: fit, length prefer 17" but has 21" too, colors, design, no side pocket makes people look wider optically
column12: lighter colours show sweat, would like to see more 17" length
column14: Best crops for weight lifting does not move stays in place
column16: These are my best crops for training i love them I owe 4 of them.Tried other styles but I always stick with these .It fits nice I would recommend to size down it will feel super tight in the store but after one wear and wash it will break in and fit perfect.I am very fit and toned and love them I am not sure if it work on a curvy body because the waist might dig in like others stated,but for me the waist just sits perfect.

column14: They look nice on the hanger but not once they are on you
column16: I received these pants as a birthday gift. I am normally a size 4 in all the lulu pants I own, but these pants in a size 4 are very very tight. Not only are the tight, when running the hem of the legs roll up with every step I take. I was really really looking forward to wearing them as I have never had any problem with other lulu products. You would need to get ATLEAST one size larger for them to fit normally and comfortably. Would not buy this style ever again.

Train times are my go to Lulu pants, they are so flatteringly and hold up under intense work outs. I'm a spin instructor and am super picky --- I highly recommend these. Love that the waist stays up too.

I bought three of these because loved them in store and when trying on but once you actually move in them...they ride up in the calf and the waist rolls...I am a cyclist and a runner so this gets to be super annoying. Be cautious if you wish to purchase these. The fabric I love but the fit isn't worth it.
column18:
Hi LFIT27,

column12: wish there were more pockets to stash stuff on run, wish the crops were shorter as in previous version
column16: I have several pairs of both the full length and the crops in these pants. I have had some of the pairs for almost a year. They're by far the best pants I've ever had from Lulu. I love the high waist (they never fall down), the fit is snug but not so tight they're uncomfortable. They're highly functional as well as flattering (especially in the bootie). Not one pair of these pants has ever unraveled or fallen apart (and I wash them in the regular cycle with all my other clothes). The lighter colors will show sweat. I find that the dark colors and patterns work best to hide sweat stains. I'd highly recommend them! Please keep making these Lulu - my one gripe is that the crops are longer than they used to be. I preferred when they were just over knee length.

Love this crop! I have noticed the train times are a little snug, but once I get working out, they feel fine and stay in place. Love the length and the design. I am 5'6'', 130 lbs, and stayed with my usual size 4 legging. I sometimes size up for the train times, but took a chance sticking with size 4. I wear them for gym workouts (lifting, cardio, spin) as well as yoga. Cute pattern, flattering, and holds everything in. For the most part, the waist stays up and I absolutely love the high waist!

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column11: the detail and quality are great!
column14: Wish I had passed on these
column16: These are such pretty and flattering crops, but I wished I hadn't bought these. They are super tight and I had to size up as I am usually a size 6 in the align pant and once I finally squeeze into them...the cuff starts to climb up my leg! Id say these are good for a thin calf, not a muscular calf. Maybe the pants are better.

Read the reviews and wished I had stayed away, normally a size 2 but I sized up as many women were complaining about the tight fit. Went with a size 4, I've worn these a handful of times to various activities such as weight training, high intensity bootcamp classes etc and they all have one common theme. The waist band keeps rolling down and I found that even with minimal wears the waistband is now stretching out. Bought these last year in Forrest Green, the colour is beautiful but the product is not functional. Guess these will sit in my closest and collect dust...

column12: everything else, waist rolling down, uncomfortable when you sit, i can't return it or exchange it anymore.
column16: I came to the store today with every intension to purchase a green Fast and Free crop. The nice associate at the store was listening to my dilemma about how I love the fabric of the Wunder Under Crop but it rolls down too much so I told her I'm searching for something in between a Fast and Free sturdiness but with a Wonder Under fabric. She talked me into trying on the Train Times crop. At first, ABSOLUTELY loved it. Bought it. Wore it out of the store. However, when I sat down ... it started to roll down, I sat in a 3 hours class having to constantly unroll my leggings because it gotten to the point of uncomfortableness. I went to the gym after and couldn't go past 1 squat without it rolling down again. Absolutely annoying. I should've went with the Fast and Free and now I am so unhappy with this purchase.

column16: I thought these leggings would be so much better than what they actually are. I am typically a size four in everything i've bought from lululemon, but these seem to be tight everywhere. I also hate that while I am walking around running errands or exercising they are constantly riding up at or above my knees which drive me crazy. Super disappointed with these and not sure if it will be worth the risk ordering a different crop legging style from here.

I have purchased three pairs of crop pants from LuLulemon ~ one of which were this style. I love the fit, best one ever (in my opinion). However two of the three pairs frayed (or the threading frayed) at the bottom cuffs.

I love these crops so so much. They are perfect for running or lifting. But the seams at the waistbands are fraying and I have only worn them once! I stand by my lululemon and own many many pairs, but I don't know how I feel about it anymore. The quality has gone down.

I really like these pants, but when I got them and put them on, I noticed that the stitching at the bottom of one of the pant legs was already coming undone. I was a little disappointed because I hadn't even washed them yet and it was the first time I'd worn them. I really like the light white/grey color that I got though.
column18:
Hi TheOriginalLuluLover,

We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be on the lookout for an email headed your way. It'll detail the next steps to take to resolve this.

column16: These high rise crops are perfect. They are snug fitting. I wear a size 4, 5’ 4” 124 lbs. I love how the compression at the top is snug but not like the fast and free where they have a tight seem at the top. These have a few seems going across the high rise to help hold everything in nice and tight. The fast and free make you feel like you have a pooch when you really don’t. These crops will feel snug as you pull them on but they don’t slide down as you are working out. I have not noticed them roll down on me. I teach bootcamp and Insanity so I am moving in all different directions. I do wish these pants had pockets on the side. Then they would be more then perfect. (Just like the Pace Perfect without the high price) I also like the added length of these crops the previous ones were a few inches shorter so they would always crep up to my knees. These don’t do that. I would love to see more colors. And side pockets.

I bought these a while back and have been using them for barre, very comfortable and they hold everything in nicely. I've taken great care in washing them and never put them in the dryer. But this last time I pulled them on, I noticed that the hem on both legs is completely frayed and it looks awful - bad enough that I'm kind of embarrassed to wear them. The majority of the unraveling is on the mesh part, and with all those tiny strings sticking out all over, it looks like big fuzzballs coming off the sides of my calves. I know mesh is fragile, but I still expect more from Lululemon.
column18:

column12: top of waist band rolled over
column14: No perfect, but pretty darn good
column16: I was compelled to write a review, after reading all of the negative ones that almost kept me from purchasing these crops. While not perfect, these are really great crops! They are fairly tight when putting on, but they are a compression pant and fit exactly as I would expect. I ordered my normal size 4 (I'm 5'3" and 116lbs for reference) and they fit like a glove. The mesh is not itchy or rough, and the luxtreme fabric is very nice. The only issue I found was that I did experience some rolling over of the very top of the waist band during my workout, which I hope does not continue to get worse. But, overall these are really great crops and not worthy of all of the negative reviews. For the current WMTM price they are a steal, and I would snatch up every pair in my size if they had more colors available!

column14: So sad after 1 wash they are fraying.
column16: I loved these until I washed them for the first time. I wore these one time, washed them on cold / delicate and hung them to dry and the seam is already fraying right in the front, I'm so sad because I really love the fit and color. For something this expensive they should definitely last more than 1 wear and 1 wash. As far as sizing went I actually wore the same size I always wear in Lulu and they fit perfect!
column18:
Hey lululover67,
Thank you for taking the time to review the Train Times Crop 17". I'm sorry to read your disappointment. We'd love to find a resolution for you and hear more of your experience. An email has been sent with additional information.

column16: I read the reviews and hesitated on ordering these, but went ahead anyways because of the price and I love them! I bought my normal size 8 and while they're definitely tighter than my pace rivals, I dig it. My favorite lulus are my speed up crops and these fit exactly the same way in my opinion, so if you prefer a tighter crop then these are great! I've worn these to spin, HIIT, and barre with no problems!

I was so excited to try these tights but after a few wears, they did not live up to expectations. The mesh is directly behind your knees and scratches your skin anytime you move. The waist band continuously folds over. You spend the entire time trying to readjust them. I have to say I'm surprised because I generally love all my lulu products.

I have had this pair about a month now and they still fit and feel great after having been through the wash a few times. I did get a size up because of the reviews and they fit perfectly. I usually get high-rise styles and I have been impressed with how well these stay up during HIIT classes and runs. Would definitely recommend!
Great crops! Defiantly order a size up, I am a regular size 8 but I ordered a size 10 and they fit like a 8. Fit smaller, but overall a nice crop!

column11: smooth material doesn't pill up, wide waistband, high rise, perfect back pocket
column14: Gorgeous but delicate seams & stretched out
column16: PROS: These pants are gorgeous, won't pill up, and have a back pocket that is perfectly positioned for minimum bounce when I store my phone there on hard runs or HIIT workouts. They have a silky, flattering finish and I love the wide waistband that holds everything in but doesn't feel too tight or constricting as others can.

column16: First of all, these leggings are about 2 size made too small, 2nd the mesh panel on the side of the legs are super itchy with every movement and 3rd after a few washes the mesh panels comes apart. Very pretty looking crops but not worth the $$.
column18:
Hi isme,
