column14: These are great! Why so many haters?
column16: I ordered these pants fully expecting to hate them due to all the reviews, but they were such a good price I figured I'd give it a shot. I don't know what everyone is talking about - these pants fit great! They are tight, but they don't squeeze. I'm 5'2' - 130 lbs, I ordered my normal size 4. If all these reviews are to be believed I'm thicker than a lot of these girls saying they are 110 lbs and not able to get a size 4 up... I taught 2 barre classes in them, they stayed in place and looked and felt great the entire time. I left and took a soul cycle class in them - they did not ride up my calves, they stayed put and stayed high on my waist so that I felt great in just a sports bra + the leggings. I also have sensitive skin and the fabric didn't bother me at all. These are a great find esp for the sale price. buy them - don't let the reviews scare you! I'm getting the other colors now.

Bought these in store with mom. Got them in a size 4--105 pounds, 5', athletic thighs. Honestly should just stick to align pants. Have tried these and the All the Right Places crop. They fit great when you first try them on but as soon as you wear them once, the next time you try them, it becomes a terrible bunchy mess--even with Lululemon thongs! Ridiculous and not worth it to have pants I can only wear commando. Lululemon leggings are becoming more and more sheer and have insane VPL--compared to other brands with similar price points it's starting to look pretty bad for LLL.

Ordered these crop with a bit of hesitation given some of the mixed reviews but so far, they've been great! The fit is definitely more snug than usual as they are compression pants so it may be necessary to size up if you want a less tight fit. The crops hit right at my calf and are lightweight and comfortable. Totally would order another pair - especially at this price on WMTM.

column11: stayed in place, do what they're supposed to do
column16: I went in store with the reviews in mind thinking I'd have to size up, but when I went to check out with a size 6 (I'm usually a size 4), the cashier told me these are actually one of Lululemon's tightest compression crops and recommended a size 2 and maybe a 4 for me. I ended up purchasing a size 4 (size 2 was sold out) and they stayed in place the whole time I was running. Granted they are a snug fit, but they do what they're supposed to do.

I got these full priced in store a few months ago and the mesh is already starting to wear out and the fabric is super uncomfortable and itchy. Not good quality for the amount I paid. Quite disappointing.
column18:
Hey trainergirl1111111,
Thanks so much for taking the time to get in touch today and share your thoughts. I definitely hear your disappointment and would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions!
Chat soon.

column16: First time I got myself a lululemon brand product, I really love this crop so I decided to get 3 more. Never again waste my money buying another brand unless its one of my fave brand.
I did order up a size as others recommended. I am 5'5" and they still hit me mid calf. They are a great length. Squat and sweat proof. I love these pants!
I always wear a size 4, so I ordered these as a 4- I could not even get them over my thighs. They were exactly what I wanted, just wish they would have fit.

I love these crops!! I would order another pair in black if they had them in my size. I definitely recommend sizing up. I am normally a size 6 but got an 8 in these- they fit perfect. I took them for a run the day they came in the mail and they passed the test- no sliding or bunching! I also did not have the problem with them folding at the knees like I had read on other reviews. They have washed nicely too!

column14: Great fit in the waist, not so much in the calves
column16: I originally tried these crops on in store because I saw that they were on sale. They fit really snug when I tried them on, which was great because I was looking for a pair of crop leggings that made me feel "hugged" (I went with my usual size 4). When I went online to look at the reviews, I saw that many people had complained about the bottom of the crops riding up while working out, so I decided to test out these leggings by jumping around, jogging in place, and doing squats in store -- the bottom of crops stayed put so I figured as someone with a more petite build, the crops landed lower on my legs than most people. I ended up purchasing them as a final sale. The first time I wore these crops to workout, I was really excited about the compression of them; however, after warming up on the rower at the gym, the bottom of the crops began to ride up!! I had to keep pulling them down during the rest of my workout!!

I have been shopping here for a number of years and have always worn a size 6 for tights. They fit perfectly and never ever had a problem with them. My mom bought me these in store in a size 6 as a gift and when I tried them at home I COULD NOT BREATHE IN THEM. They are WAYYY to tight like a second pair of skin. They dug into my stomach and feel way to uncomfortable to even wear casually around :( what a disappointment. I wish I can return them, but as they were bought on sale sadly I cant... Lulu please fix your return policy so I can return these and get a size up!

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column16: Well, I'm a pretty small person and sized up to a 4. These are definitely tight, but still fit. Not see through, thick, good feeling fabric, definitely worth the 39$ sale price from 88! Definitely size up a size or two, but I love! Will have to see how they hold up though. Also, when you submit a review, it says it is made of Nulux, but Luxtreme when you view on the website? Not sure which one.

Perfect running crops I've been looking for. Hold in place but not constricting. Good length and mesh detail for just enough breath on a toasty day. If you are looking for compression for workout, don't look away. At this sale price, I'd snatch it in a heartbeat. DO size UP.

column14: Very cute, pretty tight, tiny bit itchy
column16: I have several pairs of these. They are often on sale and so they are becoming my go to pant so I don't need to do laundry so often. KNOW that they are tight. When I tried them on I didn't actually think they would fit a real adult person because they look tiny, but they are stretchy enough yet tight enough to fit and look great. The high rise helps. If they were low I probably wouldn't go for it. But that sale price is SO right and they look great on.

These are super cute, but when I tried them on, they were sooooo tight on me. I usually wear a size 0-2 (depending on the brand), and I even sized up to a size 4 because of the reviews, and they were still SO tight!!! They also ride up my knees, which is so annoying!! I would return them, but I got them on final sale :(

column14: Best pair of capris I own!
column16: I love these! I was afraid they might ride up my knees based off of the other reveiws, but these were amazing! Light, comfy, the mesh kind of bothered me. Otherwise these make my legs look gorgeous and I feel great in them. A size 2 fit me just perfectly I am 5'5 and 115lbs

I am usually a size 2 but these are WAY too tight! I can barely get them on. I ordered them in black as a final sale so I was unable to return them but they are impossible to get on or off. Sadly, a waste of money because they are really cute.
column18:
Hello Kate12345,
Thanks for sharing your feedback on the sizing of the Train Times Crop *17". I want you to be able to crush some serious goals in the gear you buy so I won't leave you hanging. Please look out for an email coming your way shortly so we can work on a resolution together.

column16: I'm 5'3" and 118lbs, usually wear a sz 4 in Lululemon. The size 4 are very tight on me. I can get them on, and they look nice but I don't think I can wear them for more than 30 minutes.
column18:
Hello Kieb,
Thanks for sharing your experience about the sizing of the Train Times Crop 17". I'm sure you'd love to be able to wear them for more than 30 minutes at a time so I'm sending an email your way in case you need help finding a resolution. Let's get you in some gear that will help you crush some serious goals.

column16: I'm a 2 in every Lulu pant I've tried - Wunder Under + Fast & Free for reference - and my mom bought these for me on sale in the store. I tried them on later and they are SO DANG TIGHT. Yes, I can get my body into them, but I feel like a sausage stuck in a too tight casing. Unfortunately can't return them, so I guess I'll give them to my 12 year old cousin, maybe she'll actually fit them. Do NOT buy these without trying them on first, as you'll need to size up by a size or two!

Horrible!!!!!!! I have never bought crops before. Lots of other styles but for the price thought would be great to start with these.
I wear a 10 or 12 in the pants. I ordered a 10. I cant get them up past mid thigh.
My 12 year old wears a girls 14/16 and they fit her perfectly.
Lululemon- this is not ok!!! I get wanting to provide good coverage c, but keep The sizing on par.
This is ridiculous and disappointing.
My 12 year old is happy, I am not.
These were my first lululemon crops and they're amazing! so lightweight and after a session of Orange Theory Fitness, they were still tight and i didn't have to keep tugging on them mid-run.

I wear a size 4 in every pant from lululemon. I bought these as final sale in a size 4 and they are so tight I feel like my organs are being squished. It was really disappointing because they were final sale and I usually never need to size up in any pant from here. I love the look and style of these pants, but I don't think I should have to get a different size in all of the pants I own, especially from the same store.

I've just ordered this crop pants online and when i tried them I couldn't put them on (they didn't go up passed my knees). I am a petite frame, 5.2", 115 pounds with thin thighs. Not sure if it's this particular pair or the style in general...I am usually size 0-2 and order size 4 the Lululemon pants. I love the brand and product in general but this crops are way too small and I can't return or exchange them. Very disappointing...

Besides it being extremely tight, I thought the leggings were fantastic! I wore them to cycling and they were wonderful. Maybe I haven't experienced different (or better?) leggings from lululemon, but I thought these were great for my first pair!

I have owned a pair of Lulu capris for several years. Even after hundreds of washes they have shown very little wear, so I felt it would be a good purchase to buy another pair. I was very excited when I found a pair of cute cropped leggings that were actually on sale. When I tried them on in the store they fit nicely and were soft and comfy. However when I actually wore them around they rise up almost above my knees which is especially irritating while working out. Then after one wash (using proper wash instructions) I feel that they pants stretch less then they did before. Now I can barely put them on without feeling like I'm going to rip them. I have only wore them a couple of times and am already disappointed. If you are even considering purchasing these please size up.

column14: Loved them until the third wear
column16: I got these capris for Christmas and absolutely fell in love with them! I found the sizing to be fine. I am a size 4 according to the size chart. These pants are a little snug to put on, but after they are on they feel great! I am very active and wanted to wear these pants for gym class. This would be my third time wearing them with one wash. During gym, I fell down on my knees, not very hard either. When I stood up there was a hole just above the seam on the leg. In my opinion, I would assume that a brand with a high-quality reputation would create all clothing to be able to stand up to the wear and tear of life. These pants are also designed for running and training which is exactly what I was doing. I am also a competitive figure skater and wear both Lululemon and Ivivva leggings on the ice. Those leggings are able to stand up to over 2 years of constant sliding and falling on the ice, I only just got a hole in my 3-year old Ivivva ones from slicing my blade through them. I am pretty sure if I were to put these capris under the same amount of force all of my other pants went through they would be ripped everywhere and unwearable. I don't want that to happen because I love these pants so much. Could you please help me?
column18:
Hey sk8tergrl1,
Oh dear. Thanks for taking the time to share this feedback with us- we always want to ensure that our gear is performing for you as intended, and will be sending you an email so we can chat further.

column16: Read the reviews to size up one, so instead of purchasing my normal size 4, I purchased the size 6, and they fit perfectly. I'm 5'1", 110 lbs., waist 24", and hips 32". Used it for both cardio and for weight lifting, and they hugged my body with every movement.

I was so disappointed when these came in the mail. They run a size too small. According to the sizing online a size 6 should give me extra space. I tried to order a size up but there weren't any in stock. I think Lululemon needs to list accurate sizing or honor a refund on online items that are not sized according to the listed sizing chart.

I'm normally between an 8 and 10, and the 10 fit like a glove. I loved how they felt so much that I bought two pairs since they were on sale, but after my first workout in them, I found that the seam where the mesh meets the pants rubbed the back of my knee raw. This problem hasn't improved, and I've found myself avoiding wearing them.
column18:
Hi Sunny198,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I'll be reaching out shortly to work on a solution with you—keep an eye on your inbox!

column14: Sizing is way off on these
column16: I have always purchased size 4's at Lululemon, sometimes even a size 2...love the style of these, but when I tried them on they are super tight for me and uncomfortable...and since Lululemon doesn't allow returns on sale items, I am stuck with pants I can't use! Went back online to see if they have the next size up and they are sold out....I agree, their sizing is so inconsistent and this is not noted in their product description. Should have read they reviews before purchasing.

I thought I loved these leggings when I first tried them on! The top part is very comfortable and I love the high waist. However, just like many other reviews have warned, the bottom part of the pants do ride up behind the knee after a just few minutes of non-intense workouts and it makes it nearly impossible to wear since it rubs against the back of my knee and is so uncomfortable and itchy! Disappointed as this is a final sale product. :(
column18:
Hey Kaylie,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. I'm so sorry to hear of your disappointment. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.

column16: All my workout pants are from lululemon as I’m pleased with the style, cut and quality. I was so excited to see the crop on sales for $39, after reading the review that this crop has a tight fit, I decided to go for two sizes up, ( usually a 2 and ordered 6), I was so disappointed when I opened the package, it’s smaller than all the size twos that I own. It is not true to size at all. As this is final sale, I can’t exchange, such a waste of money.

I am a lululemon lover who purchases mostly in stores. However, this item disappoints. I sized up after reading reviews, but the crops are still sheer on the knee caps and thighs. Also the ventilation patches seem to have frayed and I have yet to work out in them (only have tried them on). While a good price, I would wait for the 2018 model.
column18:
Hey seas4,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.

column11: high rise and large back pocket
column16: I'm a 4 in all of their bottoms but had I tried these on in a store before buying (I buy online because their sizes are usually pretty consistent) I would have sized up to a 6. They are much more snug than I prefer.....feels almost like I might snap a stitch if I stretch too far in them. They do have a weird chemical odor to them too that I'm sure will wash out after a few washes.

Ordered a size 8 and can barely pull them up bc they are so tight. I’ve ordered 10’s in other styles and they were too big so opted to order an 8 in these. Stuck with a pair of crops that are non-returnable.
I read the reviews and size up and once I was able to wear them are so sheer can't believe how thin is the material. so disappointed.
column18:
Hey inspiration,
I've sent the email over to you again—chat soon.

column16: Bought my first pair because I liked the color. Came back for more because my legs are short and the length is perfect for me. I teach HIIT and Bodypump, I run and I am a trainer. These are my favorite fitting tights from Lulu and all other brands. Great deal on sale. I am 5'2" with a long torso and shorter legs. These do not ride up behind my knees.

I recently purchased these crop pants when they were on sale for 50$ or 60$. I thought it was such a great deal at the time. Soon after my purchase the fabric around the mesh started fraying, clumping, and it looked really tacky. I don't even wear them very often so there is no reason they should look like this. I even follow the washing and drying instructions. When I first bought these pants I would have never questioned the quality of lululemon pants, but seeing how these turned out i'm hesitant to buy more. Very disappointed in these specific pants and the worst part is I cant get my money back.
column18:
Hi BRedd,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long-lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.

column16: I loved these crops so much I bought one pair and ordered a second when the price dropped again. I convinced my mom to get a pair and bought them for her. She is a size 12 and has other lulus that size but can't get into these :-(

I'm 5'11, and ended up ordering a size 6, and haven't had any issues with them. I've only run in them, but had no issued with the band or the legs rolling or riding up. They are super snug, so that may be why mine don't have that issue. Will be ordering another pair at this price!

I was super excited to buy these at my local store. I tried on my regular size 2, but had to size up to a 4 for a more comfortable fit. Excited I wore them right away on and in the middle of my hike I broke out into an allergy attack which left my legs scabby and red for a few days. It might have been the material that I was sensitive to, but be aware. Still an amazing fit and style.
column18:
Hey XOtree,
I'm really sorry to hear that you've experienced an allergic reaction to the fabric of your Train Times Crop. Please know we take your health very seriously and have sent an email your way so we can continue this conversation.
Chat soon.

column16: I'm not sure where all the negative reviews are coming from but they are awesome capris especially given the sale price! I wear a size 4 in all Lululemon pants except I ordered a size 6 based on the reviews of this particular pair being more fitted. The 6 fit great, I love them! Highly recommend!

I should have paid more attention to the reviews for these crops. I am 5 feet and the leggings ride just below my knees and the waist band curls down when I work out. I have only worn these once and doubt I will wear them again. I am wondering if I had sized up if that would have made a difference. I am a size 4 and have never had to size up yet so I went with the 4. I have been looking for a pair of navy crops and loved the color. I won't be buying again on-line. Will stick to the store next time. What I thought would be an amazing purchase turned out to be a not so good one after all. It's great that they were on sale, but what sucks is I can't return them now since they're final sale. I'm disappointed since I know I won't be wearing them much since that aspect is quite uncomfortable.

I was super excited about these pants and read reviews before ordering these, so I ordered a size up. Unfortunately, they were still so tight I could barely get them on. I usually wear a size 4 in lulu lemon pants, but I ordered a 6 and probably should have ordered an 8 in these.

These crops are super cute and can be worn for anything. The fabric is nice, and they are flattering. I just wish I had ordered one or two sizes larger. I wear an 8 in almost everything and the size 8 in this crop is way too tight. Unfortunately, it's a final sale so I was not able to size up. Buy at least 1 size up.

Working out in these feel great. They fit true to size and are super comfortable. I have never had them ride up behind the knees like some of these reviews. However, I have been experiencing extreme pulling at the seams in between the thighs. I have gotten them fixed twice already at my local lulu store. I was them as directed and hang dry. Super disappointing for such a great fitting legging.
column18:
Hey vvul,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be in touch shortly via email to follow up and help!
Chat soon.

column14: Despite reviews, ordered and love them!
column16: I love these pants! This was my first time trying Lulu so I had no idea what to expect size wise other than I knew they ran small. I went with a size 6, normally a size 4 in most clothing, and they fit awesome! They are definitely snug, but in a good way. I can still move really well and I am a crossfit trainer so I'm constantly going. The knee does ride up some, but I feel like that's pretty expected with most crops. Definitely recommend!

column14: Yes, these crops do ride up behind the knees
column16: I am 5'2" 117 lbs and I usually don't like my waistband to be too tight on my workout clothes. I tried on the 4 (my normal size) and 6 in store and the 4 ran smaller than other lulu products. The design is cute, the length is perfect for petite ladies, and the fabric is amazingly smooth and thin without being see through. However, when I put these crops to the test in spin class and yoga class, like other reviews said it did ride up behind the knee, which was annoying to keep on adjusting throughout my workouts. The waistband isn't as high as the wunder unders, which I appreciated because the waistband on those are too high and fold over when I sit.

I ordered a size 2 as this is what I have in most of my crops from Lulu. I was disappointed in the fit as they were so small I couldn't get them on. I have since ordered a size 4.
I am 5'4", 118lbs, petite.

Bought these in store, and im happy I did, the sizing of these are quite fitted in comparison to other lulu tights like the wunder unders. No issues during high intensity workouts and no need to readjust.

column14: Love the material, hate how they ride-up at the knee
column16: I had never bought a pair of Lululemon leggings before, so of course I had to try something that was on sale. I tried them in store and instantly loved the material and the way they felt on my body. Of course I didn't try walking around in them or doing anything more than just look at myself in the mirror, so I had no idea that they would ride-up below the knee almost instantly when worn. I guess I should purchase longer leggings in the future, but I'm about 5'3" so I figured these crops would be perfect. Guess I thought wrong. They were a great deal for Lulu leggings, and I got them in this pretty mauve color, but I don't think I can wear them other than cycling because they ride-up so awkwardly and uncomfortably.

I'm 4' 11" so I have to get cropped pants, a good inseam for me is about 24" and these 17" fit like real crops on my short frame. I have two pairs of them because they are so flattering. I ordered the black ones before they were on sale and the size 2 was too small, I went up to a size 4 and they work much better. I'm 113 lbs for reference. I'm taking off a star because my usual size 2 was much too tight. I could get them on, but they were not comfortable.

column11: no surprises fits like all my other compression, price!
column14: I am glad I ignored (sort of) negative reviews!
column16:
This will be long.. So I read reviews saying that these are too tight so I went against my better judgement and ordered one pair in size 8 ( above my regular size) and to be safe I bought one pair of size 6 ( my normal size). I am 5'3 and 127 lbs .The 6's fit amazing! snug and do not move when dancing! The 8's ( as expected with normal lulu's) were too loose .. But I will gift them no issues there..
These are a steal at $39 on WMTM! If you want a pair of lulus and not break the bank, these are your guys! From experience: If your LULU's are snug and ride in any direction, your pants are too small! Go a size up. These Lululemon's are made to stay put and they do for me!

column11: material, snug fit, color, great price on sale
column16: I have a few friends who love lululemon, but they're just a little too pricey for me...until they go on sale! My New Year's resolution this year is to be healthier and get in better shape. And what better way than to treat myself to a pair of lululemon leggings, plus I love wearing athletic leggings to my college classes. When I tried it on in store, they fit amazingly, I loved the texture of the pants, loved how they didn't move and were super excited to purchase them! However, when I brought it home and wore them out for the day, they started sliding up to my knees after about an hour. Now, I'm only 5'2 and I have slightly bigger legs, so I hate leggings that hit right under my knee cause it makes me look even bigger! I had to continuously pull them down throughout the day, and what I thought would be an amazing purchase turned out to be a not so good one after all. It's great that they were on sale, but what sucks is I can't return them now since they're final sale. I'm disappointed since I know I won't be wearing them much since that aspect is quite uncomfortable. Wish I went for something 21' or 23' instead, they seem like the better fit for me! Not sure if I'll go back a second time though since they are quite pricey.
column18:
Hey GLAMOURISTA,
Sorry to hear that your Train Times Crop *17" isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.

column12: it will ride up to your knee (i am only 5'2)
column14: comfortable material but NOT WHAT I EXPECTED
column16: I recently was crazy about lululemon collections and my friend told me how their leggings are amazing, so I went to the store and found these on sale. Of course I was so excited to purchase it. When I tried it on at the store, it fitted very well, but after that, the longer i wear, the shorter it gets (It sounds funny). The thing is the pants kept going up to my knee, and it literally looks so horrible. I am only 5'2, and after an hour, the length of the legging just went up to my knee. so I would pull it down, and it does the same thing. Honestly, I am so disappointed. I wish I could have spent more money and buy something else. This was also a final sale item, so I am pretty bummed out.
column18:
Hey heybettyhey,
Sorry to hear that your Train Times Crop *17" isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.

column16:
I was so excited to be ordering this item. I have bought many items over the years for my dancing and soccer daughters (leggings, scuba hoodies, bras, tanks, bootie shorts etc.) and have just started buying for myself. When I tried the item on I was so disappointed to find that they were see through (a Lulu problem that I thought was in the past) so I now need to be contacting customer support for return details. I am a 128 pound Half marathoner and normally wear a size 6, but with Lululemon I always purchase a size 8 bottom to prevent the see through issue (especially when ordering online because of not trying on) and even with going to the bigger size they are see through. Ugh! I would like to think this known issue would be resolved - like back to the beginning of Lululemon good old days. Where quality and functionality was the number one factor.
Thank you kindly.
column18:
Hey 21kmlittlerunninggirl,
This definitely doesn't sound right. We stand behind the quality of our gear and would love to know more about your experience with this. Keep your eye out, an email is on its way.

column16: Love love the train times crop! Fits nice and snug and secure and looks cute to boot! I'm between sizes 4 and 6 and found the 6 to fit perfect! Bought these in two colors and find the fit the same in both (though the black is just a tad stretchier than the foiled) if you're between sizes I recommend going to the size up!

column14: OK leggings if they didn't turn into bike shorts.
column16: Leggings feel and fit decent but they ride up to my knee after about 5 minutes. I have super short legs so I can't imagine someone who's taller. I wish they would make a crop that actually stayed in place. Unfortunately I bought them on final sale and am stuck with them now.
column18:

Sorry to hear that your Train Times Crop *17" isn't holding up as expected. We stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent an email your way to discuss this further, and look into our options.

column14: Super Soft, But Waistband is Snug
column16: Tried these on at the store and decided to buy them since they were on a good clearence price. I'm 5'6 and 110 and normally wear a 2-4. I got these in a four, but even so, the band was still snug, but the legs are tight and don't bother me. Fabric and mesh feel nice.

column14: My go to for the gym
column16:
Purchased these a few months ago as my first pair of lulus. Tried them on in store and went with a size 8 (150 lb, 5'6, athletic build). When using them at the gym, the waist seemed to be loose, even with the band to tighten it. For $39, I decided to order a size 6 to see if that fit was better. They are snug and quite tight to get on, but once they are on they are perfect! Unlike other reviews, I prefer this tight feeling because they hold you in and don't get in the way. Definitely consider what type of activity you are using these for. I use them for weight training, HIIT, and even for short runs and they are great.. for climbing/yoga and more mellow activities, I would go a different route.
The pair I've had for a few months has held up in quality.

column12: creasing at the knees, slid down
column16: I was so excited when I found these in store, and when I tried them on they felt true to size (8). In practice, I found that they bunched up behind the knee which is pretty uncomfortable with the mesh and I had to adjust it quite a bit. They also did not stay up (had to keep pulling them up during class). Other than that, I think these would be good pants for other athletic activities; not yoga.
column18:
Hey cameforsavasana,
I'm so sorry to hear that your pant isn’t performing as expected. Please give our Guest Education Centre a call at 1.877.263.9300 to chat through some options. Chat soon!

column14: Wish I would have read the reviews sooner
column16: I am really bummed. I have 3 other pairs of Lululemon pants, and when I saw these went to $39 I was excited! Ordered my typical size and can barely get them over my thighs and they and they just seem not the same quality. Really wish I could exchange for a larger size. Don't get why there is such a size difference-makes you feel bigger than you really are! :(

I am a size 0 in every pant I own so I felt safe purchasing a size 2 in Lulu. Guys, I could not get these on... I had to jump up and down with my husband wrenching them up over my hips LOL it was hilarious seeing my tiny rear-end squeezing out of these things during the hoist and then my non-existent belly being suctioned in like I tried on a doll's pair of pants. All kidding aside, I went back to the store and tried on a 4, then 6, then 8 just for kicks. These are just uncomfortable. If you like everything sucked in, these are for you, but certainly not for me. Quality seemed great though. Unfortunately these were my first purchase of Lulu... not sure I'd purchase again.

I purchased the foil print black/ silver on sale in size 4 - fits perfectly. I'm 5'3", 111lb. Nice and form fitting, not tight, moves with me, waist does not roll down, bottom of the crop stays put below my knee. Very well made and super comfortable during my high intensity workout at the gym. The only negative I noticed was when I opened the plastic bag it was shipped in there was a chemical odor which I have to say I've had with a few items I've ordered on line recently. In this case it seemed to disappear once I worked out but will see if it reappears.

I wanted to get these pants in a size 6, which is my normal size, but it was sold out. I got the size 8 and boy am I happy I did! They definitely fit tighter seeing as the 8 fits me like my normal size does. I really like the cool blue design and find they are cropped to a good length.

column14: I'm pretty sure I can't breathe....
column16: These run INSANELY tight. I have at least 12 pairs of LuLuLemon pants all in a size 2 but I got these, put them on, and wow am I uncomfortable. I did get them on sale so not a total loss but I feel like I might rip the crotch out in my first down dog in yoga tomorrow and probably will pass out from lack of breathing.
I did not find that these ride up my knees but very nice in quality. Really sucks you in and is tight but awesome for workouts and you cannot beat the price for the quality.

column14: Awesome crops at a great price!
column16: I got two pairs from WMTM. The luminosity foil are my favorite! I love the snug fit and I grabbed my normal size.

Very comfortable and great for working out in! I bought a size 4 and they fit perfectly. They allow for a wide range of motion and unlike some of the reviews said they did not ride up on the knee area.

column12: the mesh at the knee area.
column16: So so bummed! I was really hoping that the reviews were untrue. But they are right, they do bunch up at the knee and makes it very uncomfortable. Cant wear them very long. material is good but thats about it. Disappointing.
column18:
Hey Bren16,
Thanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Train Times Crops aren't holding up for you. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions.

column16: tried the pelt colour on in the store and fit was great, not see through. swapped colours last min to black (was worried about sweat marks), so see through you can see the tag through them
column18:
Hey Jessisninja,
Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. I'm sorry to hear your gear is sheer—I can understand your disappointment. Please keep an eye out for an email with some solutions coming your way.

column16: So I got these in a teal color when they went into WMTM at $59, then got them in black when they dropped to $49. I've now ordered them in every color available now that they're at $39 because honestly, they're really comfy and have that amazing lulu quality. I've only been purchasing in the last few months, so I don't have past years' to compare to but they are on par with all other pairs I've ordered from lulu.

I bought these because it was $49 at the time, and now it went down to $39. Seems so tempting to order more because of the price but honestly, save the money for different leggings. These run sooooo small and so tight and don't hold up at all. I thought all lululemon leggings were amazing quality until I got these! It's nice that it holds me in place.. but super uncomfortable most of the time :/

I love and mostly only wear lululemon but I really don't like these crops. The material is great but they rid up at the knee and bunch up behind the knee, which makes it very very uncomfortable to do any activity in them. I'm constantly pulling them down. I really wanted to love them but barely wear them because they are extremely uncomfortable. I do not recommend them to anyone. Sorry....

I received these crops as a gift & they are wayyy to small! I have 6 pairs of lulu pants & they are all size 2s and fit great but these are definitely way smaller than any other size 2s. Since they're final sale I can't return or exchange & I'm really disappointed since I'd really love them if they fit correctly.I wish they'd have a gift policy or something for situations like this especially when I've never had issues with sizing previously!

column11: breathable, cute, stylish, perfect for everyday use, great for gym workouts!
column16: I was just given these cropped tights for christmas and I absolutely love them. With only being 5'3 they hug me in all the right places, and are the perfect cropped length. One thing missing is that they don't have pockets.. Other then that, I think that these pants are fantastic! I can't wait to purchase more!!

These leggings are not true to their size. The waist is especially way too tight...They feel like they are at least two sizes smaller than other leggings! I'm also disappointed that the stitching near the hems are already unraveling after trying it on once. Since I received this as a gift, I can't find a way to exchange for a different size... I would definitely recommend for those who are interested in purchasing this to get a size larger than they usually are.
column18:
Hey justdance20,
Thanks for connecting with us. I'm so sorry to hear your Train Times Crop is not holding up for you. We stand by the quality of our gear and want to make sure it's performing well for you. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way with some solutions

column12: quality, durableness of the material, poor stitching
column16: After wearing these pants a few times, I realized that the upper back part of the lining is beginning to become undone and is fraying rapidly. I really loved the style and functionality of these pants, but they are not lasting as long as I had hoped, even after washing them as directed. Disappointed in the quality of these pants as I thought they would be like my other pairs of lulu pants and last years.
column18:

column16: I own about 4 pairs of these leggings and I just cannot get enough! they fit very well, the crop is not too short and you never need to pull them up. My oldest pair had a hole in the seam of the crotch but I just took it to a Lululemon store near me and they fixed it for free. Overall, if you are on the fence about these pants, I say go for it because the fit is very flattering and if you don't love them, you can return them.

Got the black and love the very flattering fit and comfort and material of this crop. A must have for any work out. Plan to wear for spin, bootcamp, run, yoga or just around town Love the side pockets! ......5' 8", 134 lbs size 4

I got the Pace Rival Crops in size 6 - I'm 5'6, 155lbs, 28" waist 38" hips. They fit snugly and comfortably and look very good on. The material is interesting - the front and back is full-on luxtreme and not see through, but the side panels are kind of sheer so I wore nude underwear and it looked great (just note, black underwear was visible from the sides. If I wear a thong it's not an issue). I have full calves the and the bottoms hugged them perfectly. Since they're mid-rise and I'm used to hi-rise, I was nervous to wear these yesterday to play kickball - was worried they'd fall down etc while I was running the bases or stooping to grab the ball, throw it, etc. They performed AMAZINGLY. As soon as I started sweating the waist stayed put and didn't budge, and they performed well, sweat-wicking as I played kickball literally for hours in the 90 degree sun. I was very impressed with the durability and fit. I've only worn them once but will update my review if anything bad happens.

I love these crops! They are my absolute favorite for running, yoga, and every day wear. The fit is tight, but not constricting. They never roll down on me during exercise. Pretty please make more colors! I would love these in bright blues.

I absolutely love these crops, I bought my pair a year ago and cannot get enough of them. The way they fit is amazing, not too tight or too loose - just perfect. But today i noticed a small tear in the lining on the back. I am so heartbroken because i live them so much but now I cannot wear them anymore. They always seemed so strong to me but now they are fragile.

i have an arsenal of Lulu bottoms, Luon, Luxtreme, Everlux. These are my favorite luxtreme bottoms and i've had mine (black, size 2, true to my Lulu size) for about a year now. Main use is bike commuting in the spring before it i switch to shorts in serious heat. They are so comfortable, simple, good looking, and versatile for anything i do at the gym (conditioning, weights, spin). Never a quality issue for me honestly. I'll be picking up a second pair.

These fit like a dream and were perfect for the first several months I wore them (over a year ago?). I noticed some peeling on the sides by the pockets, and was disappointed though still able to wear. This morning I found that an entire panel of fabric, only secured by some sort of fabric tape, completely peeled away from the rest of the pant leg. I wore these frequently, but would not expect this from lululemon. I have not had this issue with other leggings that I've purchased but I would recommend choosing a different pant, rather than these. column16: These are my favorite leggings ever. They fit perfectly and I love the shape on the back- hate the new square like shape.

When I bought my first pair the sales girl told me to size down for more compression and I did, the waistband was a little tight at first but it stretched just a touch and now they are perfect, they do not budge while I am working out, I never have to worry about adjusting them during class. It’s not as noticeable in the black, but so noticeable on the heathered gray that I won’t wear them to classes anymore. The fabric also seems to stretch out faster than any of my other lulu, though there is a tie at the waist that will keep them up while running. column14: Quality makes for completely different crops
column16: I bought these in black and was immediately obsessed with the fit and fabric, specifically the way it moved with body when I ran. The first pair has surprisingly lasted the longest, despite being worn the most. I bought these in heathered slate, and that pair literally started falling apart at the seams after the first wear. After one run, the seam that goes above the butt is splitting and there are holes along the back vertical seams similar to those that form where your thighs meet. I have never had Lululemon’s literally fall apart like this. The second black pair didn’t have the issue on my backside, but did split where my thighs meet. For the record, these were only used for running. I didn’t spin in them or use them for any activity where my butt touched the another surface. I expected so much more not just for the price but from Lululemon. Such a shame because I really loved the first pair purchased.

column14: Love the crops, but I wish they were better quality
column16: As far as Lululemon crops go, these are by far my favourite style because of the versatility they offer. They stay up on those long runs on the trails, and are stylish enough that I can pair them with a cute sweater and run errands. I am, however, disappointed with the quality. This is the second pair that I have bought and they barely last six months before the seams start to unravel. I am diligent about only washing Lulu items with Lulu items, and where the seams are starting to unravel (i.e. the outer thigh) are not in a ‘chaffing location’ that would explain why the thread is coming apart and leaving visible holes. And I don’t think correct sizing is an issue because both pairs I have bought in-store, and have had an educator help me decide on the correct size. I love all my Lululemon products, but it is definitely frustrating that I pay $100 for a pair of crops that I can’t even get a full year out of...whereas other Lulu products, or different clothing brands’ crops, that I wear equally as much, don’t seem to be an issue.

column14: Used to LOVE, new version is different
column16: These pants have been my favorite hands down since I purchased them 3ish years ago. Then, when i finally went back for more, they had stopped making them except in a long length and with a zipper. I waited SO LONG for these to come back, always telling the ladies in my store that they needed to make a return. I was so stoked to see they were back that I told all the girls at my gym and bought 4 pair immediately!! I am sad to report that they do not fit the same at all. I thought maybe after a wash or two they would relax a little, but they are too tight around the waist and cut me off. Its a bummer, because I bought exactly the same size and am actually a bit smaller now than I was then. Now I cannot return them because I've washed and worn them. So, 4 pairs of ill fitting lulu and I am one sad customer.

These were my absolute favorite HOLY GRAIL leggings. I recommended these to any of my non-lulu friends to try to convert them. Last week I noticed some pulls in the mesh, and the seams unraveling. There are clear quality issues with lulu leggings. I may reconsider my next buy at lulu :(

column16: At first I loved these pants, they were my go to sweaty work out leggings. When I first got them, I did notice they were a tad bit shear but it didn't bother me too much. Im a huge lulu lover and i'm extremely disappointed with these pants.

Hey runnergirl536,
No one likes a hole in their pants. That's definitely a thumbs down from us. We've sent through an email so we can learn more about your experience and look into some options.

column16: These were my absolute favorite pair of Lulus. I wore them to all sorts of workouts (weightlifting, yoga, running) and loved how comfortable they felt. These leggings are extremely versatile and its sleek design looks great for day-to-day wear, where I’ll pair them with sneakers and a comfy sweater. However, I noticed that the inseam on my right inner thigh started unraveling. A week later, there was a hole. I’m devastated that my favorite leggings fell apart, especially because they cost a pretty penny! I follow the recommended washing instructions, too, so this must be a quality issue. This isn’t my first pair of Lulus that I’ve had a less-than-ideal experience with. Many people have been addressing these same quality complaints for yeeeears now, and at this rate, I’ll consider re-purchasing when LLL switches to a more durable material for all their products.
column18:
Hey uclabrewin,
Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts with us today. We stand behind the quality of our gear and will be following up with some solutions via email.

column16: I purchased a pair of these a few years back and loved them (my go to pant for long and sweaty workouts). I recently purchased these in black but the fabric/quality seems to be different than my previous pair and the sizing seems off as well. I own these pants in a 4, and wanting a second pair figured they would fit the same. The 4 was incredibly tight in the quad/glute region and see-through upon squatting. I therefore purchased in a 6 and was pulling them up throughout the entire workout. The size discrepancy between the 4 and 6 is disappointing. Wish these pants didn't change!
column18:
Hey mags1022,

column16: I've had about three pairs of these pants. I love working out in them because they are extremely versatile. My workout regime includes a variety of exercise types, from weight-lifting, to pilates, to long running. I really enjoy these pants for their ability to fit all of my workout types. However, the inseam of the thigh always tends to rip after about 6 months or so. In addition, I've noticed that they are slightly see-through since the material is so thin. I have to be cautious at the gym when wearing these tights because of possible hole increase or flashing everyone around. I do exercise often, but I rotate my three pairs of tights, thus attempting to minimize overuse. In addition, I always follow the appropriate washing recommendations. Overall, I like these tights, but the quality of the tights is not the best, from either holes in the inseam or too thin material. Wish I could say I would buy more or return to Lulu for future purchases, but it is not likely.
column18:
Hi MercDeMartini,

column14: Feels Nice but rips incredibly easy

column12: deferent material than before, sizing wasn't the same
column14: Not the same fabric material as my last pair
column16: I own a pair already, they are older, can't remember when I purchased but I love them! So soft and comfortable, no tearing issues at all and I wear them often. I just purchased a pair online and was disappointed with a few things...these newer rivals are not the same material as mine, neither is the mesh part and although the exact same size as my other pace rivals, the new ones were way too tight and did not fit the same at all. The packaging was also very disappointing for such an extensive line. The plastic bag the pants arrived in was way too large and offered no support or protection to the pants. They had deep creases, were twisted a bit and it appears the package was crammed in-between other boxes. It would be a much better presentation to have shipping materials that match size of package so item stays tight and neatly folded. I order from other vendors often and items come nicely packaged. I don't think I would order from Lulu online again and I will probably return pants. So bummed because I LOVE the ones I already have, really wanted another pair.

This is my second pair of these leggings and I love them and the material. However, the first pair I bought last year started tearing and a hole appeared in the inner thigh after only 6 months. column14: Great skirt - wish it came in LONG!
column16: I love this skirt. The side pleat gives character & practical range of motion. As a tennis player, it's hard to find a balance between a skirt that won't flare up in the wind but isn't restricting either. This is the perfect combo. Not to mention --- tons of fun colors now!! I wish it came in *LONG* like some of the other skirts. I'm 5'11 and it barely covers my booty. I got it when it was on sale to try it out. If it were longer, I'd absolutely buy more.
The fit was very small compared to other skirts in same size. The waist has no give so hard to get over hips.

Love how cute this is with the pleats. Maybe I just ordered one size too small (I’m a small in Athleta and a medium I’m Nike), but the 6 is tight to get on. I don’t like how tight the shorts are around my legs under the skirt. But I wore it once so I’m keeping it and wearing it.

column11: the style, the fabric, the fit
column16: I love this skirt! The shorts are just the right weight to stay in place and offer breathability. The pleats on the sides allow unrestricted movement on the court, while the seams along the back are super flattering.

LOVE the look of this skirt. Bought in my usual size 4 and the waist was so tight I could not get the skirt over my thighs, Returned the 4. Ordered the 6. Received that skirt but that was too large in the waist. Thought it would not bother me to cinch the draw cord so I kept the skirt -- mistake. It is annoying. I have to cinch it really tight and it still looks too big. Really unfortunate because the look of the skirt is great. Honestly the only thing I have ever bought from Lulu that was a mistake. I have four daughters so that is saying a lot.

My local store didn't have the skirt in white in my size (4), so I tried on the 6 and it was too big. I ordered the white skirt in a size 4 and packed it for the beach, taking the tag off because I was confident it was my size. THE WAIST BAND HAS NO STRETCH. Once this is on, it fits me around the waist, but it is a comical (and infuriating) process to wiggle these one without ripping a seam. The white skirt and washed marsh skirt fit completely differently despite being the same size. I enjoyed how consistent the sizing was with Lululemon before this, but now I'm just disappointed, and I have no idea how I'll ever wear this skirt.

column11: built in shorts and phone pocket

column16: I was hesitant about buying this skirt due to the reviews stating the waist band was terrible and that it ran too small. I ended up ordering my regular size 2 and hoped for the best. I have no hips so that could also be why I'm not having as much of an issue. Overall I love the fit, it's comfortable, cute and stays in place. Want to buy it in more colors now!

I loved the look of this skirt online so I ordered my usual size. I own about 20 lulu skirts in size 8 (mostly the pace rival) and have always had consistent sizing. The waistband on this style has absolutely no elasticity at all. It was definitely a struggle to wriggle my bottom into it. Once I got it over my bum the waistband was the right fit for my waist but struggling to get in and out of the skirt because of a lack of give in the fabric is so disappointing since I ordered from the "we made too much" - like I have with a lot of my skirts - and have never had a sizing issue like this. I don't think sizing up will help as I'm worried about the waist band being too loose and big with a bigger size. It's such a shame because I absolutely love the look of this skirt

I read the reviews and went ahead and ordered two of these skirts in a size 6 (one in white and black) because I was so excited for them!! Once I received my skirts, I tried them on and I have to say that I am very disappointed with how this skirt fit. The waistband has no give whatsoever and if you size up, it ends up being to big in the waist once you get the skirt over your butt. I own a numerous amount of Lulu items and I will say I have never been as disappointed as I am with these skirts.
