column16: I agree that the sizing is a littttttle wonky. I was planning to order online but after reading reviews just decided to go into the store. I grabbed a size 4 (my usual) and a size 6. The waistband is definitely not forgiving and it takes a little extra to get it over my bum, but once I do the skirt fits like a dream. I tried the 6 and while easier to get on, it was way too big around my waist. I'm soo happy with this purchase though and hope to get more colors in the future, I never wanna take it off!

column14: regular size too tight in waist
column16: I always wear a 6 in bottoms and this is too tight in a 6. The 8 was falling down my waist. Also the length was a bit short and going up to an 8 still did not help the length. This is a miss. You'd need to be short and have a super tiny waist for the rest of your body. The other skirts do not fit like this one at all.
I tried this skirt on in the store today and the waistband has little to no stretch at all! I tried on my normal size and couldn't get the skirt past my knees.

Typically a 4 in lulu bottoms.Tried to get the 4 on in our local store and was way too tight. Ordered the 6. When it arrived the skirt was way too loose in the waist. Returned the 6. Thought that maybe this was an aberration because I have such good luck with all lululemon sizing. Bought the 6 again. Have no idea why I kept the skirt... I have to tighten the drawstring sooo much to keep the skirt on. Really too bad because the design is great. Stuck with a skirt that does not fit well.

After reading some of the reviews regarding how this skirt fit, I was pleasantly surprised it fit very well. I am rather curvy, okay very curvy but it still was forgiving! The only thing I wish is the designers would make the cute colors available in tall too (please lululemon merchandising team)!

I was leery of fit from all the reviews. I ordered my usual size 6 and it fits perfectly. The waist does have a little stretch and I had no issue getting them on. Very cute pleats and quite comfy with no digging into the thighs or waist. Don’t let the reviews put you off this one!
Fortunately, I was in a store when I bought this skirt because my usual size 6 was WAY TOO SMALL. I fit into an 8, but even it is a bit tight getting on. cute details without being overly girly.

Love this skirt and was true to size
The 10 fit just like all my other Lulu skirts
Just wish it had not gone on sale the day after I ordered it

my children bought me this skirt for my birthday in my normal size. I could barely get this skirt past my knees!! My 11 year old daughter barely got it on, They had already taken the tags off because I have so much Lulu and it is all the same, consistent size!! The waist band does not give or stretch, not even a little bit, it is stiff as as board! DO NOT BUY THIS SKIRT unless you want to go 2-3 sizes up and who on earth wants to do that!!!!!
shame on you, Lulu!!

I first bought this skirt in the Hinshu Alpine White Multi/Black pattern in my usual size. (For reference I am 5'4", 105#, LLL size 2) I really liked that they brought the grippers back on this skirt - no riding up! At first I thought the pleats might make it look juvenile, but I found it to be really flattering and a nice change from the Pace Rival. I love the pockets on the waist band and back for energy gels, etc. and appreciate the added pocket on the thigh since I carry a lot of stuff during long runs. I would have given this skirt 5 stars; however, after liking it so much, I went back to the store to get the same skirt in white but the waist was unbelievably tight (same size) so I left without it. I'm not emotionally tied to a specific size but I do expect the consistency within a brand and that the exact same item within a brand should be identical - where is the quality control??
I switched back to running in skirts since they don't make the speed shorts anymore. Tried this one and it fits great. I'm usually between a 4 and 6 and the 6 fit best.

I am a sucker for a good skort, I own a ton of them. When this skort came out I immediately ran to get some, Lulu in my opinion has been slaking in the skort department lately. I grabbed my usual size (4) and went to try it on... I almost cried in the fitting room.... it would not budge. This is when someone mentioned the mannequins even had to size up not once, but TWICE. So, I grabbed an 8 and it fit like a dream. Only issue is that when I get in the grove the waist band doesn't stay put as much as I would like it to, I will tie the band but that is uncomfortable some times. My advice, try it... such a cute skort but sizing is significantly off on this one.

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column12: no stretch, runs small, thighs tight
column16: The waist has no stretch and runs small. I gave it to my 12 year old daughter who still has a girls figure, slim, no hips and she was shocked how hard it was to wear. She normally wears a size 0/2 and could barely squeeze into the 4

column14: Disappointed in fit and design of product
column16: I was very excited to receive this product however I was very disappointed with the fit and design. There is absolutely no stretch in the waist band and is hard to get past your hips. Even if I went up a size once I got it on the waist band was too large for my waist. This skirt is made for people with a very slim figure not athletic like mine. I think it is best for people with no hips as that is how the design looks to be made. Whether I went up or down in size it didn't matter. Either way it was too big for my waist or too small for my hips. Also the way the fabric is stitched always makes the skirt looks like it is wrinkled in the back. Very disappointed in the design and product.

I was nervous after ordering and reading reviews about the waist. Yes, it is a little tighter than other lulu skirts but I did not think it was a deal breaker. It pulled up just fine over my hips. I think the skirt runs TTS. I ordered this along with a pace rival, both in black, and I'm still choosing between the two. The fit is similar between the two options, just a slightly different shape. Play off the pleats is a little more of a trumpet shape flare whereas the pace rival is more a-line. I like that lulu is adding other skirt options. It seems the same ones have been in rotation for a while!

column12: waist band, inconsistent sizing, zero stretch
column16: I purchased this skirt in a size 4 in pearl pink and as others said the waist band didn't stretch, I could barely wiggle it over my hips. Also, when I did the little flap under the waist band flipped up. I thought it was a glitch, so I then ordered another 4 and also a 6. This time the 4 only went to my mid-thigh! The 6 although a bit tight going over my hips once on the waist was too big! I am not at all hippy or curvy! I am 5'5 and 122 lbs. The sizing is just awful. I will have to return all of them.

I am a curvy size 6 and I couldn't pull this up over my hips. Why, Lulu? Every other Lulu skirt fits me well in a size 6! I don't think this would be comfortable even sized up! Big mistake and I am sad to have to pass on this cute new style.

I am usually a size 4 in Lulu in both tops and bottoms and purchased this in a 4. I would say it runs TTS but as other reviewers mentioned, there is no stretch in the waist. Pretty strange if I must say so myself... I bought the pink color and it's actually to die for and I definitely feel pretty in the skirt. I will keep, but would definitely hope that in newer designs and colors the no stretch in the band is banned lol.

column12: tight waist, price, shorts too long
column16: I was very excited to see this skirt come out - finally some colour! I love the pace rival and this looked similar to it. I'm a 6 in leggings and an 8 in skirts/shorts and the 8 in this was a struggle to get over my thighs/hip (I've never ever worn a 10 in lulu in anything). Once I got it on it fit ok but I hate how the shorts stuck out longer than the actual skirt - why cant you make the shorts shorter like boogie shorts so that it looks like a skirt? Wouldnt buy this for $30. Such a shame...
Comfortable fit, the pleats are adorable and the longer length in backside is great! No problem with waistband, flattering fit. Very cute skirt.

column12: material too thin, material of waistband, lack of quality of spandex shorts
column14: STAY AWAY FROM THE PEARL PINK SKIRT!!!!!
column16:
Our tennis team picked this skirt & I was excited about the pink color! The reviewers are right about the waist band having little to no give but surprisingly I had no trouble pulling it on/up. BUT!!!! The pink spandex short is SEE THROUGH!! THIN & SHEER!! & the skirt was so thin that any hail damage on your back side shows right through. This skirt is going back!!! Disappointed in the lack of quality/thickness of the spandex for the expensive price. I am 5'6" at 145 lbs and size 8 in skirts is my go to.
The cut and design of this skirt is so cute!! A thumbs up on the black/mulit colored version of this. I bought it just because and it fits like what you expect when you pay for Lululemon quality.
column18:
Hey shanajet,

We stand behind the quality of our product and want to ensure that your gear is performing well for you. We'd love to learn more and make things right for you, so keep an eye out for an email coming your way.

column16: Thanks you for FINALLY making a cute skirt in COLORS!!!! I did not notice the issue with the waistband some people mentioned. I still think the price is too high... $10 increase is a big jump.

column12: waistband had no stretch, don't buy, made way too small, sized inaccurately
column16: I was disappointed in this skirt. I bought two of them and I could barely get it over my hips. The other skirts from here fit me so well and look really cute. This skirt was just made poorly.
column18:
Hey LTucci,
I really appreciate you taking the time to get in touch today and I'm sorry to hear your gear isn't performing for you. We stand behind the quality of our gear and I will be in touch via email to dig into this with you!
Chat soon.

column16: I was so excited to finally see a new skirt from LULU...I ordered right away a size 4 and a 6. (I am a 4 in everything LULU). I literally couldn't get the 4 up my legs and the 6 was so tight it pulled across the front and didn't help the small muffin tops at the waist. Really? You need to make things smaller so we have to size up 2 sizes now? SO ridiculous. I am a tennis player and have really been waiting for some new and fun skirts and then this...I sent both back and I am so disappointed. I am 5'4" and 120# -I should not have to buy a size 8 in something. Why do they keep changing styles and sizes when they worked the way they were before? Just beware and order a lot bigger so you are not exchanging for something bigger. RIDICULOUS

column11: no seam at front of shorts, shorts tape isn't too tight, length is ideal
column12: waist is not super stretchy but not a problem
column16:
This is the best skirt Lululemon has made in years!
I am usually between a 4-6 in lulu skirts. The 4 is always a bit tight and the 6 feels like too much fabric for both the shorts and skirt. I've often wished there was a size 5; with this skirt I went with a 6 and it's perfect! The length is short and great and it's flouncy without being cumbersome.
Big win with this skirt: there is no seam down the middle of the shorts. I often find the seam shows through on some lulu skirts so this is a big improvement. I also find the tape at the bottom of the shorts feels smoother and less "grabby" in a good way.
The waistband is not super stretchy, making it a little tight to pull on but I've already found the waist has stretched slightly. Either way, once it's on, the fit is absolutely perfect.
Way to go, lulu! I've already bought 3 of these and will look out for any other colors!

column12: way too tight, way too short, cheap material
column14: Another terrible skirt destined for the outlets
column16: I ordered two of these skirts - the light blue and the multicolored. As a former Lulu skirt freak, I want to like the new skirts they've put out but nothing has ever compared to the Pace Setter or Hit Your Stride. Wanted to give these a chance but again, a big NO.

I thought something was wrong with this skirt when I tried it on. The waistband does not stretch at all! Once I got it on it fit, but I do not think I want to deal with the hassle of the waistband. Wish I could love this skirt!
column18:
Dear Emelly,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'm sorry to hear the waistband is not working for you. We'd like to help you on this one! Give us a call at our Guest Education Centre (1.877.263.9300) or jump on Live Chat to speak directly with an educator. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

Thanks,
Mark

column14: You are on the right track, lulu
column16:
Unlike some latest running skirts that all end up on WMTM due to lack of details and cheaper production, this skirt is finally a step in the right direction.....
And yes, the waist band and the entire skirt runs small, similar to two way stretch fabric in pacesetters (please bring them back!), so, i recommend sizing up.....the good news is that the silicone grips are back and they even have lululemon on them.....the combo of flare at the back and pleated fabric on the sides is adorable and the pink color is so lovely and feminine....the problem is that with lighter Colors fabric is so thin, it is see thru in undershorts and shell, too....now if you choose a pattern, then the pleated part is visually unnoticeable, taking away from sophisticated design.....now if the undershorts came in floral nulux kind fabric and the outer shell was thicker as it is used to be....it would solve the problem....

column14: Hope it will be released in a tall
column16: I ordered this even though I had heard the reviews of it running small in the waist, mainly because I love the Hinshu print. This is the first non black and white print skirt that Lululemon has made in quite some time. I was pleasantly surprised that the fit was much better than expected - I did not notice the waistband not having any give. My only issue is that I really would prefer a tall length. Any chance these skirts are going to be released in a tall?

column12: wish the pleats were solid color
column16: The print version I have does have their usual stretchy waistband (and also love that its not another black and white print too!) Noticed a few comments saying the waistband is made out of the skirt material that has no stretch but my printed skirt is made with their black stretchy fabric and I don't have to size up to get it on.

I thought I got a defective one .... that's how little stretch was in the waistband. But apparently this is how the skirt is. I was BARELY able to pull it on in my regular size, but in a size up the main part of the skirt would be too big. Oh well, hopefully the pretty pink will come out in a different skirt style.

column11: grippers, new colors and prints finally
column16: I bought this skirt in the Cool Breeze color. It is cute if you can get it on. The waistband has no stretch. It was made with the skirt material (very little stretch) on the outside instead of the stretchy material that the shorts are made of. I like the drop in pocket on the shorts and the grippers and I'm glad to see some new colors and a print that isn't black and white, but no one likes sizing up one or two sizes to get the skirt over the thighs. Hopefully the new colors can get a stretchy waistband and then I might consider buying another one.
column18:
Hey Tennisinlex,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. That doesn't sound like a good experience at all! Give us a call at the Guest Education Centre (GEC) at 1.877.263.9300, or start a chat with us on our website. We look forward to speaking with you soon!

column16: I saw this headband on a friend and just had to purchase it for myself!!! I absolutely love it but the only problem is that it does get too tight after a while and can hurt your ears if you put the headband over your ears. So just stretch it before you put it on. Over all it’s a great and super stylish headband and would 100% recommend.

I was reluctant to buy this head band reading the reviews. I have long pretty thin strait hair so I didn't know if it would work not having the rubber grips on it. But I ordered it and tried it out and I absolutely love this headband. I got it in black and ended up buying a white one as well. I work in a cafe and wear them daily to keep the hair out of my eyes. I will be buying more of these in the future. I also plan on purchasing a scuba hoodie as well. I just love all lululemon products! I recommend these headbands to everyone!
I use this headband every time I go for a run or workout and it keeps the flyaways in my hair out of my face, totally recommend this product!

I'm a die hard fan of Lululemon and always love their well made products, from the align leggings, backpacks, to the baller hat. I purchased this hoping it would be a high quality nonslip headband. Within 20 minutes of wearing my hair in a ponytail not doing any strenuous activity.....it's halfway off my head. I don't even want to bother using it for workouts because I already know it's going to be a pain in my butt. Since that's what I purchased it for, I'm very disappointed. I have thick hair and a regular sized head. The velvety parts on the headband don't grip much. I would not recommend this headband to any one looking to wear it during strenuous exercise. It might hold up okay enough to not be a pain to readjust during lounging or yoga.
column18:
Hey Kellyanne3096,

We’re writing to follow up on your recent review. We want your gear to support your sweatiest pursuits and it sounds like your Fly Away Tamer Headband II isn’t up to the task. We’d love to turn this around and get you into gear that works for you. Look out for an email from us soon!

column14: The only headband that works for me
column16: I can’t rave enough about this headband! I’ve told everyone I know about it in person so here I am. I have thick but very fine straight hair so headbands are not naturally my friend. Every run I put this headband on and it has never failed. It doesn’t budge and it hasn’t stretched out... yet. I plan on buying many many more of these!

column11: stayed put, kept all hairs out of my face, soft, didn’t pull on my hair
column16: I typically don’t write reviews but this headband just surprised me a couple hours ago in my yoga class. My hair is pretty sleek and slippery, combine that with sweat and headbands usually slip off within a few minutes. I bought this headband today, wore it to my class tonight and it didn’t budge. I was shocked!! I didn’t have to adjust it or put it back on once throughout the class which was great! My annoying baby hairs and fly always weren’t a distraction in my practice tonight. I would definitely recommend this!

I LOVE this headband. I've wanted it for a while but was hesitant to spend $12 on a headband. I think it was worth the money because it's SUPER soft and extremely comfortable. It also has a great grip and stays in place. Other headbands I have had start to hurt my head or the grip irritates my hair and almost pulls on it as I move around. I barely notice this headband is on my head. It's a perfect width (not too skinny and not too thick), and super cute. I got the headband in black and I would definitely pay $12 again for a different color.
I really like the way this headband looks but the grip is really poor quality and constantly wants to slide off.
column18:
Hey dgpe222,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. Oh no, that definitely wasn't our intention when designing the Fly Away Tamer Headband II. Please keep an eye on your inbox as I'll be reaching out shortly to connect. Chat soon!

column11: everything is perfect good for all head sizes
column14: Say yes to the dress (actually to the headband but it rhymes and what ever)
column16: Overall this headband is really nice. It’s firm on the head, and comfortable at the same time! Lululemons can be very pricey, and seriously $12 for a headband? Is it worth it? Yes! I love it so much. It has a stenchy material, and it is sooo comfortable, I forget it’s on my head. I did read that the headband has fallen off of people’s head and that jass, and to be quite honest that can happen, but if you wear your headband the right way it will stay ❤️

column12: i loved everything not one dislike! :))
column16: this is a great headband and holds back all my little hairs that usually come out! its super light and thin and super comfortable and so cute!! I would buy this is more colors, and I definitely recommend this! Im a runner my self and I hate when headbands fall of but this one doesn't! I LOVE THIS:))))
The old one had better grip, and it would actually stay on my head. These new ones fall and slip off my head. Please Please Please bring back the old ones!
I love this headband! I have thick, curly hair and it really keeps my fly aways in place. I use this for cycle and it works like a charm.
Just way to thick, so tight it hurts your head. I would do anything to have those old headbands back! they were perfect.

When I first saw this headband I fell in love with it. It looked like the perfect shape and size.I tried it on and it fit perfect! I got it and I was going out for a run. I had just stepped into the car when I realized that the headband that was supposed to be on my head had now fallen off from walking out of my door and into the car. I thought that maybe I had bumped into something, causing it to slide off, but as soon as I rolled the window down it blew right off my head! I got out of the car and started to run and all the headband did was annoy me and fall off my head. I ended up just taking it off and tying it around my wrist. I wish I had never wasted my money on this headband, and also lululemon should go back to the old style!!!!!!!!!!!!

I spin regularly and although I wear my hair in a bun, my baby hairs tend slip out and get in my face. I was a bit nervous about getting this headband as the reviews say it's not as good as the previous version, but I took a chance. When I wore this to spin last night I wore it right behind my hair line and thought I felt it slightly slipping (even though it wasn't) during the course of the class which was super distracting. (For reference I have super straight, slick hair, I'm Asian if that gives you a better picture) I ended up moving it so it sat right where my hairline met my forehead, and that little grip of my forehead seemed to help it shift less. It seemed to lick sweat pretty well. I have a smallish head and it didn't seem too loose or too tight, so hopefully this holds up after I wash it.
This is a great, soft headband that stays in place and wicks up sweat!

column14: Bring back the old head band!
column16: This headband does not stay in place at all. I literally had to throw it out mid spin class because it kept falling off of my head and also making me sweat way moreee. PLEASE BRING BACK THE OLD HEADBAND with the rubber grippers! I worked at Lululemon in Boston a few years ago for a year and those headbands with the grippers would sell like crazy. I am holding on to my old ones with dear life and I have yet to find a good enough one to replace that quality. PLEASE bring them back!!!!! The felt does not stick and makes the headband just fall out during any type of workout that involves movement. The felt also is SO hot it makes me sweat more when I am trying to wear a headband to zap that sweat.

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column16: This headband was awesome! This headband was the first purchase I made from Lululemon and it surely didn't disappoint. It's super cute especially with the reflective logo. The only thing that was a bother to me was how tight it was. It made the headband kind of uncomfortable, but overall, it was great.

column11: it stayed in place, quality is great
column16: My sister bought this headband for me back in March 2017 when she came to visit me. I wore the headband for my spinning class last Saturday, and had it on the whole day and it stayed in place. I also like the quality and the grip....Well done Lulu :)...

column14: Wish this came in more colors!
column16: I love this headband! It fits my head well and I can wear it to lacrosse practice or for workouts. I can throw it in the wash without it losing its shape. All in all, it's my favorite headband, but I wish that Lululemon would come out with more colors in this style. There's only two colors, come on! I also wished that Lululemon would bring back the Skinny Fly Away Tamer Headband because that was another one of my favorites as well :(

column14: Does not stay in place . . . even while sitting doing nothing!
column16: I really wanted to love this as I love buying Lulu running pants. I wanted to buy something that would help keep the hair out of my eyes when I run, hike, or even go out for a casual meal. This headband didn't stay put after 5 minutes of just sitting in a car. I was looking into other headbands that they have, but now I'm hesitant with just even considering their other headbands.

column14: Great headband until I washed it
column16: This headband was great initially. I bought it while training for a half marathon and liked that it kept the hair out of my face and helped to prevent sweat dripping down my forehead. However, after I washed it once, it expanded a little, and though it still fits when I first put it on, by the end of the workout, it has slid back on my head. I am disappointed because it did such a great job before, but now I feel that I wasted my money.
column18:
Hey Newrunner20,
We’re sorry to hear that your headband isn't holding up as expected. Please give our GEC a call at 1.877.263.9300 to chat through some options.

column16: I've tried them all, every brand you can think of and every headband slips right off my head the second I look down or turn it. This one stays put and looks great!

These headbands are what I've been looking for forever! I have ridiculously thick hair, and these headbands keep all my hairs in place and away from my face when I'm working out. They are also comfy, and I wear them with my hair down sometimes too. I love the variety of patterns and colors. A perfect 10!

Not sure why you had to change a great thing. Loved these headbands, but mine were wearing out and losing their grip, so I went in and purchased 4 more. The new style is smaller in circumference, and seems to have a lot more spandex to it, to the point that it compresses itself right off my head, constantly. Not something I want to be messing with on a long run. I've had this problem with so many other elastic headbands, which is why I loved the lululemon ones, and now these are just like all the others. Two will be going back, only because I tried out the other two.

I won't lie to you, yes I do need to readjust every now and then. However, i am a nurse and wear these on my 12 hour shifts often because they keep my hair in place. I believe yesterday I readjusted 2x throughout the 12 hours. I also wear these while I am running. I ran a half marathon (2.5 hours...) in this headband and did not adjust it at all. They do seem a little tight, but that is better than the alternative. After time, they can fit your head a little better. But overall, they are a great headband and I keep going back for more...

This headband will capture your sweat, keep your hairs out of your face, WILL NOT MOVE, and is a cute accessory. I love this headband for running especially. If you use headphone that just won't stay on, this headband can cover them up just so they don't move. It captures all my dripping sweat and is truly amazing and comfy! 10/10, no questions asked. Also, it is machine washable so it is never gross!

My favorite part of these headbands is the velvet inside instead of the usual weird tacky stuff I see on headbands that yanks my hair. out I've worn these for bootcamp classes and for yoga and they do the job. I think you have to wear them a few times for them to fit right, the first time was too tight around my head but then I washed it and now it seems more stretchy. They sometimes slip off, so they're not perfect, but I see that as the trade-off in using velvet as the lining. Also, they're really cute design-wise and I think the width of the headband is perfect!
I LOVE this headband!!! During yoga class it stays right on my head without moving at all.
I have yet to find a headband that stays in place when I exercise until now. So very cute and keeps my hair back. Has been great for all types of exercise including running and barre.

I'm a lacrosse goalie at my high school- that means I spend a lot of my time wearing a helmet. I've tried prewrap, rubber headbands, and those tie-back Nike headbands that seem to be so trendy. Unfortunately all of these would eventually slide down my face and block my vision. I was reluctant to try another headband in an attempt to tame my mane until I borrowed this one from a girl on my team and it stayed in place on my head during the entire practice! It was a miracle! Bless Lululemon for creating a headband that finally stays where I need it to be.

This new version of the flyaway tamer does not stay on my head from the walk from the car to my spin bike, let alone stay put for the ride. The fabric strip pales in comparison to the gripp-y dots of the previous versions. Really disappointed in the new design!

Bought two of these handbands a while back, the grip inside them is not strong anymore. The back part is not as thick as the front part -- hair doesn't hold that well on the back and will pop out of the band. I wish they would bring back the original fly away tamer headband...seems like they've been sold out for ages. Overall love the style but disappointed by what I received for what I payed :/
column18:
Hi ILUVLULULEMON6970,
A headband that doesn't stay put definitely won't do the trick, and I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with your Fly Away Tamer Headband II. We'd love to learn more and find a solve, so give us a ring at 1.877.263.9300.

column16: I've tried SO many different headbands, but they all pale in comparison to this one. It stays on my head no matter what I'm doing - yoga, lifting, running - and fits perfectly. I love it so much I've purchased a bunch in different colors to replace my old ones.

column14: I miss the older version of this product!
column16: I really miss the older version of this headband, the one made with the small clear dots on the inside instead of the fabric strips. Not only did those work better for me, but the shape of the product fit my head better. With this new design, I feel as though I constantly have to reposition the headband while wearing it, and the shape of the new one makes it feel too tight.

column14: Great at first, then began to delaminate
column16: I loved this headband for the first several uses. Then the inside portion of the headband that adds the gripiness to the headband began to delaminate, as in, it started to peel right off. I'm very disappointed because lulu quality is usually on point. Now my headband is too damaged to wear at all.
column18:
Hi MountainMermaid,
I appreciate you touching base and sharing this experience with us. I'm so sorry to hear of the peeling going on, and would love to turn things around for you. Keep an eye on your inbox—I'm sending you an email to chat more.

column11: fit well, cute colors, stains come out easy
column16: I thought this product was SO nice and well fit! I liked how it held onto my had with the strap under the black felt, it gave it a nice grip. I also like all the different options to choose from. For this quality, I don't mind spending the $12 for each one!

I picked up this headband in store. I planned to wear it to Pilates but walking the 2 blocks from my office to the studio, the headband kept sliding up. I didn't bother trying to work out in it. I have straight, relatively thin hair so this may work better for those with thicker or courser hair. It will be going back.

column11: super fast shipping - i got it literally the next, cute color - as pictured
column16: This was my first lulu purchase and I was really excited because I had heard so many great things... but I was pretty displeased when I used this the first time and it kept slipping off my head. I tried it running, spinning, and with yoga and it didn't stay straight for all of them - fell off within the first 15 min. I tried pulling it a little further forward and it still slid. I have a pretty average head and my hair is not too crazy (straight, medium thickness, no bangs). I'm sad that it wasn't what I expected. :(
column18:
Hey sunshinedaisy,
We hear that disappointment and know that we stand behind the quality of our gear and have sent some solutions your way. Chat soon.

column16: First headband from lulu and I am happy to report it exceeded my expectation, went for 6 mi run today and i did not need to fix due to falling. I am not looking for more colors to match some outfits going forward.

I am a HUGE headband wearer I wear a headband when I work out everyday I own 33 (not joking) Lululemon headbands and the Fly Away Tamer II are my favorite! I have naturally VERY curly hair and I do straighten my hair as well. I have had issues with other headbands that will stretch and then I can only wear certain bands when my hair is curly and certain bands when my hair is straight, but not with these. Also, for the most part they stay on my head when I work out. I love love these headbands and I look forward to adding more into my collection!

column11: everything, velvet, says put, high- quality, way affordable
column16: These are AMAZING headbands overall. I prefer these ones over brands like Nike, because they don't have the weird rubber thing on the inside. Its velvet instead, so it doesn't rip out your hair lol. They stay put no matter what and I don't have to adjust it every two seconds. (Shoutout to Nike for the horrible years of headband experience) Anyway, thanks lulu. You guys are the bomb. Not to mention these are super duper affordable. So good luck sports brands out there, you're not gonna beat lulu at their headband game.

column11: matches all of my lulu outfits., thinner than the other headbands i have.
column12: does not hold to my head like other lulu headbands
column16: Struggling to say whether I would recommend this headband or not. I am a huge Lululemon headband wearer. I have eleven (no typo) Fringe Fighter Headbands that I wear almost every day to work-out. I was very excited to receive my first Fly Away Tamer Headband as a gift in December by my friend who knows how much I love my Lulu headbands.

column14: Love the lulu 2 inch headbands (this new version and the former version)
column16: I own two of this new version of 2 inch lulu flyaway tamer headbands. I LOVE them. I have 7 of the former version and I love those, too. (maybe even a little more, but I'm just so glad that a 2 inch version is back that the new version still gets 5 stars from me) The 1 or 1.5 inch headbands don't work for me, so please keep making these! These hold up well. Normally all other headbands give me a headache - however, I can wear the Lulu 2 inch flyaway tamer headbands.

I buy one of these every time I'm in a lulu store. At this point, I probably own 40+ of them. They stay put for all of my crossfit workouts. It's so nice to not have to spend time taking a headband out and putting it back in. Please continue making these in beautiful colors and prints! I love them!

I have one of the original fly away tamers and I love it. It's a little weathered and started loosening this is why I picked up another one. It's not the same, I feel like this version is looser because during my workouts I have to stop and fix. I think it being wider than the original makes this happen.

column14: Don't Buy If You Have A Small Head
column16: I am very disappointed that Lululemon changed the design of this headband. I have a small head and this headband did not stay in place at all during my spin class. I have several of the older design and I love them. This band is way too thick and slides very easily off my head. I wish they would have left the old design alone.

column9: I KEEP MY AGE ON THE D.L.
column16: I bought this product originally for the pattern. Even though, Lululemon is a luxury store I feel my choice to buy my blue polka dot headband was a good choice. The quality is awesome and Lulu has truly out done themselves from their prior and thinner headbands. Very rarely do I feel the headband slip off my head and the velvet in the product is phenomenal! I have lots of extra baby hairs, but this hairband totally covers all of them and it is the ultimate anti-frizz fighter! I have about 4 of these hairband and will never buy any other brand of headband besides Lulu. My only problem with the headband is not quality, but the variety I had to chose from in the store. I simply wish I had more options to pair with more styles i.e. casual, work, sporty, etc.

column11: tames baby hairs, does not slip, retains elasticity, feel held in, comfortable
column16: For all my life I could never wear any headbands and I am not exaggerating. All the headbands I bought would slip off my head, become too lose, were too tight, were too thick or too thin, did not hold my hair (I have very thick hair), or gave me a headache. When I wore this headband, however, it was the first one I was comfortable in. I could wear it for a few hours and it would not slip and during exercise, my baby hairs remained in place. I would definitely recommend this headband, as it is very effective.

I have never had the hair type that requires a headband until now, so I was very excited to finally have a reason to purchase one. I decided to splurge and go for lulu and unfortunately it was a pure waste of money. The headband did not stay on my head at all and slipped off at least 5-6 times in my hour long work out. What is worse is that I'm the instructor, so it was pretty embarrassing to be fumbling around with my headband so many times during the class. So disappointed.
column18:
Hi XxRinxX,
Thanks so much for checking in. I'm sorry to hear that your Fly Away Tamer Headband II isn't staying put, and would like to find a fix for you. Keep an eye out for an email so we can move forward together.

column16: My hair is quite thick but it still sticks well and keep my hair out of my face. I would recommend it to many of my friends, maybe not all of them with thick hair though. Good quality, love'in that lulu.

column14: Bring back the old Fly Away Tamers
column16: I have tried just about every lululemon headband style that has ever been made. Lululemon had finally gotten it right with the thinner (about 1in thick) version of this that had a thicker velvet band on the inside. But then things changed. First the thinner headbands were made with a thinner velvet strip, which did not have the same holding power. Now in this latest version the thinner velvet strip has been put on a thicker headband. Making the headband wider while making the velvet strip thinner takes away even more from the the anti-slip grip. While the styling of the wider band is nice, it does not stay on the way the thinner version with a thicker velvet strip does.
Loved the headband when I first got it. After awhile, it started to fall off all of the time. Instead of hang drying it, I put in dryer to get tight shape back. Worked as good as new again.

When I tried it on in the store I loved it and thought it actually gripped my head very well. However I wouldn't recommend doing any high intensity work outs with these in as they slip quite a bit. I still love to wear them though. I have both solid black and white so they are easy to wear with any of my outfits.

Even though it is a very nice headband, it is still slippery in spite of the mentioning that it isn't. I cant play tennis with it ever, I end up removing it after 30 min because it slips so much towards the back of my head

This headband is super cute, but it doesn't stay put during cardio without bobby pins, and even then it still slips. I've stopped trying to wear it during my workouts, so now I just wear it when going to school. I love the look though, and since my hair is so thick, it might work better for people with thinner hair.

I have one of these headbands (in a light grey) and I really like that the Luon fabric absorbs a lot of sweat and keeps it out of my eyes. However, on my thick, wavy hair the headband does have a tendency to slip. When I go running (on a treadmill), I usually have to readjust the headband every 5-8 minutes. This is a lot better for me than other headbands, which fall of my head within seconds, but this is still not ideal. I haven't worn it for running outside yet, but I assume it'd be more prone to slip out with an outdoor breeze. When I wear this for yoga, since I don't want to be distracted by a falling headband, I use a couple of bobby pins to secure it so it doesn't slip off and it lasts the entire class. Just a little inconvenient but it's a workaround! Compared to the skinny fly away tamer, this works a little bit better due to the thicker band. The skinny fly away tamer had two lines velvet though, so I wonder if this one would work even better if it had two also.

Let me start by saying I own two of these headbands. I've spent the past two summers as a tour guide at my university where I'm spending my days giving tours in 90 degree heat. These headbands are good for that, however they definitely lose their shape. I still like them and wear them, but it is annoying to have to keep adjusting a headband as you're trying to work. I like the width of them because you can wear your hair down with them and you don't get that awkward bump, but they do definitely need some work. As someone else mentioned, the under part of the headband constantly peaks out which is really frustrating because it looks sloppy. These should be adjusted because other than these few things they do work very well

These headbands absorb sweat really well, however it definitely does NOT stay on my head during my workout. Needs to be tighter or have elastic. I love all the designs and they are really cute, just wish they were also functional!!

Don't get me wrong, I like these headbands, I own three. They're the perfect width however I wouldn't recommend them for working out. The first few times they were great, but they didn't hold their shape and I found myself readjusting them every few minutes. Eventually I decided that they weren't meant for working out, so I just wear them when I'm out. One more thing, the exterior bands(I guess to hold them in?) pop out after a while and I'm not a fan of how that looks, if that makes sense!
If you want one as an accessory, go for it. For working out, not so much.

column11: thickness, sweat-wicking, good for someone with thick hair
column12: loose after a couple workouts, doesn't hold shape, falls off head after a couple workouts
column16: Okay so these headbands were one of the first things I've ever bought from Lululemon and at first I was so impressed. I have thick, naturally wavy hair and being honest during my workouts I sweat a lot and these do a great job of absorbing the sweat and keeping my awkward, weird little hairs tamed. Hence the clever "fly away tamer" title these little numbers have. But after a couple workouts I noticed these headbands don't stay as tight on my head. Like I stated earlier I have thick, wavy hair so I can't imagine how these would stay on someone who has thin hair. I love how thick the headband is, they're good, but not great. Please don't get rid of them, some minor adjustments to somehow make the headband tighter and hold it's shape would be greatly appreciated.
column18:
Hey BeaLovesLulu,
Thank you for sharing your experiences with the Fly Away Tamer Headband II. I'd love to chat further with you and have sent a follow up email your way.

column16: I absolutely love this headband. It does not budge. I work in a hospital as a nurse's aide and I can go an entire 8 hour shift and then some without having to adjust it. It doesn't even give me a headache after wearing it so long. I have this headband in Black, Bali Breeze, Tidal Trip Boom Juice, and another color that is no longer available. I plan on buying more!

I was really disappointed in the function of this headband. I practice yoga 6 days a week and I was looking for a headband that would stay in place through intense classes. Unfortunately, I found myself constantly adjusting and pulling the headband down, which was very frustrating and distracting, especially when trying to balance. I was really looking forward to using this headband as it claimed that it would not slip or pull your hair and it came in a nice sleek looking black that I could wear with almost any outfit. I love all of my other lulu products, but this headband was really just a waste of money.

column11: different colors, kept hair back without pulling pieces of my hair, fashionable
column16: im a gymnast and do very intense training and i dont have time to worry about my hair and with this head bad i didn't have to touch or redo my headband once during a four hour work out
Good size and color.

The printed hats from LuLum are awesome...I wish the solids were the same softer construction
T

column12: adjustable strap too short, strap hanging out looks messy
column16: I first bought this hat in a store, loved it. Got home and it had stain on visor part. Took back to store and they ordered new one online as none in store. Got new hat, loved it. However, when I adjust the back piece for fit, the piece will not fit into the space for it to fit my head. Very frustrating and looks bad! This is poor for a baseball cap that is $40.00. And not what I would expect at this price point.Tags off and I have tried to wear and a lot of trouble for a hat!

column16: I think it sits to high on my head. Also I like the other closure in the back which I thought that’s what this had.. I would rather have had a different style for sure..

column11: lightweight, good fit for ponytail, adjustable
column16: This hat is fantastic. I bought it for myself, and then was gifted another one shortly after. It stays on great while jogging, and the ponytail spot is not super-duper low like an old Lulu hat I have - which is great, because I want my hair off my neck! I have been using them both for 3 months or more and they hold up great. My only issue is that they are a lighter colour and they are getting salty from all the use. I'm not 100% sure on the care instructions for this, but I'm nervous to give them a thorough wash in case I damage them.

column14: Not getting the bad reviews - this hat is PERFECT
column16: I have a few lulu hats that are so big, I can tuck my ears into them (fail). This one is perfect. I'm not sure where the "cone" issue is happening to others. The hat fits smoothly and perfectly on my head. I have thick hair, but an average (smaller?) head, and hats are often too big. Not this one. I ordered the mesh and this one and they're both PERFECT.

column14: Finally! A hat that fits my small head!
column16: I have never been able to wear many of the hats that Lululemon has come out with due to the fact I have a really small head and they are huge. The last run hat I tried, the body of it was so deep that the bill of the had hit mid-eye. My current run hat is no longer made and getting threadbare and I was worried I was not going to ever find a great replacement. Enter the Baller Hat Run...

column14: Awful fit... please save your money!
column16: This hat is constantly sliding up, it doesn't stay put one bit. It slides up and then does what other reviewers have said - gives you a cone head. I don't understand how I ended up buying it..big mistake! Save your money!
column18:
Hi Rosalinda,
We're sorry to read of your recent experience and would love to discuss this further. Please be sure to give us a call at our Guest Education Centre on 1.877.263.9300 or you can always start a Live Chat with us on our website. We look forward to hearing from you.

column16:
I bought this white baller cap at the store.
I was looking for a simple cap for summer, and this fitted me perfectly.
I have to admit, I usually struggled to find a perfect hat for my head. Most hats fold my ears and slightly loose or look bigger on my head. So, I guess this hat isn't for everyone. I'm so glad to find the one. I like the material and overall shape as well.

This hat is really cute in theory and the pictures really depict it being more more flattering fit that it really is. This was given to me as a gift (sadly without a gift receipt) and I took the tags off before i realized how weird this looked on my head. The fabric of the hat gathers at the top of your head -- much like other reviewers have mentioned. Generally this is just a bad fit and I'm very disappointed in this product.
I wear this hat all the time: on walks, to the park, hiking, running, to the beach! I just love the fit, how lightweight it is, and the fabric is high quality. Thanks lulu!
The hat is cute, until you put it on. There's extra fabric at the top that doesn't sit flush with your head. I looked like a cone head. Definitely wouldn't recommend this hat unfortunately.

column14: the WORST hat I've ever seen DON'T BUY THIS
column16: I bought this hat despite reading reviews saying it wasn't great. I totally regret that decision and am so glad I can return this hat. The fit is horrible (how does a circular hat give your head a cone shape?!) and it's impossible to adjust. Definitely not worth the $40 price tag or any amount of money for that matter.The color is cute and that's about all it has going for it. I wish Lululemon would've put way better thought and design into this hat. I wanted to like it, I really did. I'm just amazed by how poorly it is made.
column18:

column16: Love the fabric, fit but black faded way too fast

column16: I was thrilled to see this simple hat with a nice fabric and (what I thought was) a great shape in store. When I started wearing this, I couldn't help but notice the prominent cone shape head the hat gave me that no amount of adjusting could fix. The online photos are misleading and do not accurately show the shape of this hat as well. For a hat being nearly $40, I expected lululemon to have perfected it and ensured that it was a flattering shape. I am disappointed in this hat and am disappointed to have nearly $40 down the drain.

column14: Didn't stand the Test of Time
column16: I like the shape of the hat and the adjustable back. I got to wear my hat a total of four times and washed it each time. When I took it out of the dryer and the material at the back of the hat has shred. The material came apart. Unwearable.

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We'd like to turn this around and ensure your gear is providing long lasting performance for you. Since it sounds like this isn't the case, please keep an eye on your inbox so we can get to work on a solution for you.

column16: I have purchased the Baller Hat for myself and as a gift for my mom and best friend so I wanted to try out the Baller Hat Run version. I wear my hat for hikes with my very active Husky dog (Minimum of 5-7 walks a day at least 45mins-1hour) and the Run version works much better for sweating and heat because it is thinner and allows for more air to circulate. Where as the Baller Hat gets very hot and makes lots of sweat drip down my face. So though the Baller Run Hat is functional it has the weirdest cone head shape. I find myself constantly adjusting the strap to see if a tighter or looser fit will make the top cone shape less noticeable. During my work outs outdoors and at the gym I see my reflection and think "I need to fix that before anyone sees!" I also got Beats over ear headphones to push down on the cone top and it still looks weird. I love Lulu and will continue to purchase their head gear (hats, headbands, and scarves) but I would not recommend this hat. I feel since I paid $38 for it I must use it and rotate it with my other Baller Hats. I just think the constant anxiety of "Do I look like a conehead?" is too much for me lol

column14: PLEASE, GIVE US A HAT WITH VELCRO TIGHTENING STRAP!!!
column16: If anyone is like me, I need a hat to tighten or loosen on the fly! Get with the times, Velcro is the away to go and even stays on your head boating at 40 miles per hour!!. Take a page from Nike's playbook! Also, TEST your product before manufacturing, you seem to be loosing in the quality control department.

I bought this hat and actually got some embroidery done on it. It looks great, but unfortunately, it runs a bit too small for my head. By the time I adjust the fit, it is hardly blocking the sun. I tend to wear my lulu visor more often as a result. Also, the hat is quite thick which may be a plus or a minus depending on what you are looking for. I will be looking out for a lighter weight, better fitting hat from lulu.

column11: lightweight, holds shape, stays put when wearing, no chafing
column16: I bought this hat early this summer for training and racing. It does cone a little at the top but I don't mind that. It's the function that matters for me.

Let me start out by telling you that I purchased the white baller run hat and absolutely loved it. So when I came back to get the black one I didn't notice that the back adjustable strap was different. Putting the hat on I had to make the strap bigger and it caused the 'tail' end of the strap to hang out. (It does not do this on the white hat). I thought it would be a small feature that I could live with since I loved running in the white hat. I was wrong. It was very uncomfortable and looked even worse. Thinking it was just a batch that was manufactured different I just purchased another one. It is a little better but the strap barely tucks into the hat. I just wish there were some more similarities as the black hat pictured above has the strap that is perfect... however not the ones I found in store.

column12: the fit, water stains can't be removed
column14: Cone head and water mark stains
column16: I was so pumped to get this hat. The pink color is super flattering with a summer tan but that's where my positive review ends. The hat is shaped funny at the top and gives you a cone head look. Also, I wore it outside and it got wet from pool water and has left horrible water marks that do not go away. So disappointed in this purchase. I expected much better quality for a $38 hat.

column16: This hat is apparently made for very small heads. It looks so ridiculous on - the top of it pops up to a point (picture a frozen yogurt cone. On your head.). Also, I adjusted the strap and it slides/slips up my head repeatedly. I'm so annoyed I purchased this full price.
This is a high-quality hat, however, it is definitely not made for big heads, even though I adjusted the strap. It fits shallow, and sits way above my ears.

I purchased the Baller Hat Run in the magnum color and I love it! The hat is a greyish, purple and it is a great addition to any neutral outfit. After I purchased it, I found a matching outfit in another store and wore everything the next day. I haven't run in the hat but plan on it!

column11: fashionable -simple and versatile, glove-like fit and security

column11: the cute lulu emblem, great for putting on my wrist as they aren't tight
column14: Spendy Hair ties that don't work
column16: I wanted something fun for my hair, but these do not make the cut. they do not stay in my hair unless I wrap them several times and it is a super tight pony. they are not worth the cost.

column16: I'm swear by these hair ties. I wear my hair back all the time, and constantly have these guys on me. I just got my fifth pack of them for Christmas, and don't see my usage of them slowing down anytime soon.

I love these! I have purchased 4 or 5 sets and use them every day. I have medium thick, waist-length hair and they do a great job for exercise or casual. I am a professional in an office setting and I much prefer to wear these on my wrist as they appear to be more of a bracelet. I like both the black ones and the colors and hope they continue to make a variety of choices.

I really LOVED these hair ties! They work really well on me and my daughters hair types (curly/fuzzy) and they stay on. The only problem is they have stretched out a large amount which makes them too big to wear as a bracelet. Overall though these are a really great purchase and worth the money!
They are adorable and fun to wear for a week or two but stretch out TREMENDOUSLY and need replacing :(

I felt a little silly buying Lululemon hair ties. My friends always tease me because I wear so much lulu, but these are GREAT! I have very long, thick, straight hair and getting a pony tail to stay up is really hard! I don't have any elastics that will keep it up for more than 30 minutes walking or 5 minutes running. Until now! I just did a 14 mile run and only had to tighten my hair once! I'm so happy with these, I will definitely get more.

column16: So I ordered the hair bands that lulu came out with last (I can't remember the name, but they were braided with the dangling lulu charm and came in highlighter yellow) and they were useless...not stretchy and wouldn't hold my hair no matter what I did. When I saw these I was hopeful but a little skeptical. I took the plunge and ordered them (only $14 so I might as well try) and I am so glad I ordered them. They hold my hair in place, I like that they are thin, good colors, just overall a great hair band (which is what I would expect from lululemon). The one downside, they are too big to wear around my wrist, but I do have small wrists. Overall, awesome hair bands that are practical and worth the $14!
These elastics are amazing! Just like the good 'ol times. They keep your ponytail nice and tight, no need for triple loop around it! They also double as zipper pullers if you've lost them. #love

column14: Order a size-- or two-- up!
column16:
I love these leggings! On days where I want to wear more skin-tight leggings, this pair is my new go to. It has excellent shape retention and really molds to your body.
That being said, they are very, very tight. I am 190lbs, 5"6 and usually am a size 8. I had to size up to the 10 because the 8 wouldn't go over my hips. My younger sister is very petite-- she is 100lbs and usually wears a size 2-- but she sized up a size too. Definitely not a very stretchy pair, but I feel totally secured when on, which I love a lot.
I totally recommend for gals who like a more fitted and extra tight pair of leggings.
I love these tights!!!! I have three pairs of these and I love that they stay tight and are not see through. I use them to run and lift weights or for everyday use. They are my favorite
Love these!! Great fit, love the pockets on the side!

I’ve started buying these pants instead of the All the Right Places Pant, I like the more snug waistband and the zipper pocket In the back. They hold their shape very well and can often be reworn at least twice before feeling loose.

I am a huge fan of Lulu lemon I always buy here everything and have never been disappointed.
I am 5.2 and weight 110 lb this fits perfect and I run and workout at the gym and this looks perfect !

column14: The best and last tight you will ever need for intense workouts
column16: I have been meaning to post a review of these tights for a long time. To state that I'm obsessed and in love is an understatement. I own five pairs of these tights. The variegated knit black heathered black one is my absolute favorite. The fabric seems higher quality than the others, but I love them all. The pockets are amazing and easily allow you to work out with your phone or run with doggy bags in the pockets. I have purchased other tights that are meant for compression and recovery and feel that these tights have better compression features than anything I've ever tried, all while being incredibly comfortable. Also nothing makes my butt look better than these tights. And lululemon's customer service really cannot be beat. Love these tights and will continue to buy them. I highly recommend for people who do intense workouts. These are one of the only tights I can run hard in and not have to continue pulling up throughout my run. For reference with sizing, I have a very athletic build, and wear a size 26 in jeans and 4 or 6 in suits and dresses. I purchase this tight in size 4 and it's perfect.

I bought two pairs of these and both of them are very see through on me after only a few washes. They look good which is the worst part because I do love how they look, I just wish I could workout in them without worrying that someone behind me is getting a show.

I'm 6'0 so it is hard for me to find full length tights and these are a perfect fit. They feel fabulous and the color is spot on. The Evergreen is beautiful but the quality makes me want them in every color now!!

They fit tight, but I stuck with my normal size and that was the right decision. If the quality would hold up I would buy them in every color. However, on the pair I own the stitching is coming out in the seams and there is some pretty bad pilling. I own a lot of lululemon and always wash everything according to their instructions and I rarely have pilling problems with my lululemon gear. I am disappointed by the seams and pilling, but I was even more disappointed by the customer service in my local store. I took the pants there to see if I could return them, since they are not living up to expectation and they just told me that there was nothing they could do for me. I love lululemon, but I left feeling disappointed and frustrated! I always buy lululemon for the quality and customer service and neither lived up to the expectations in this case!

column16: This roller is amazing. I wasn’t sure if I liked the color schemes but the function out performed its colors. Definitely a must have. Lulu, would you offer more colors for this roller?

It hurts like a you know what but the results are what I need after training. Props to lulu for making this product a 2 in 1. I really like that there are two types of rollers available depending on my self-torture needs. I love the design. It doesn't have any odor and it's easy to store. I hope lulu continues making these types of products. Can you please make elastic some exercise bands with motivational messages? Also, if this is painful for you, maybe lulu should consider making a smoother roller too.

I have a love/hate relationship with this thing! I love it because it does it's job and helps roll out sore muscles and I hate it because those same sore muscles are screaming while I do it! This is a great roller because the outer layer gets deep and the inner roller gets even deeper. I do wish you could use the outer portion without the inner portion in it, but it's very easy to slide in and out! The grooves get a deeper stretch into the muscle much better than a flat roller does. Overall, I would recommend this and I've even gotten other people in my gym to use who have really liked it as well!

This roller is a fairly decent one. Its a sweet deal, you get two for the price of one! The outer roller is softer and can't be used without the inner roller inside. The inner roller is firm and works wonders on the back. The outer roller is ridged and works wonderfully as well. All in all its a decent roller. I only have given it a lower rating because the outer portion can't be used without the inside part.

column11: the color, how light it was
column16: The scrunchie is amazing. The colors are like a white cameo.

When I first got this scrunchie, I absolutely loved it. It was probably the best scrunchie I've ever used, it held my thick hair really well, and looked super cute. Unfortunately, after two weeks or so, it started to stretch a lot. After a few more weeks, it is now even more stretched. I really really loved this product, but it obviously is not made to last a long time which is unfortunate for such a pricey product.
column18:
Hi ec1256,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are sorry to hear that your scrunchie is not performing for you, and we would love to help. Keep an eye out for an email coming your way. Chat soon!

column14: You need this scrunchie in your life ASAP!
column16: As I stated in the title you need his scrunchie ASAP! I was a little hesitant to purchase this scrunchie at first because I have thick and long hair.. But I am totally glad I did! I now own 4.. haha. Love the color, the added reflective touch, and how well it holds my hair in place. Little pricy but worth it.
I bought one of these when they first came out. Soon after I wore it a couple of times it began stretching out and now doesn't hold my hair well :(

I bought one of the light locks scrunchies about a month ago, and I fell in love, so I bought two more! The colours are vibrant, and the reflective detail is so clever. They are a necessity for every run of mine as they keep my hair securely in place and sometimes I will even use them when I'm lounging around the house. They are a bit on the higher end when it comes to scrunchie prices, but the quality makes it worth it! I highly recommend!

I love this scrunchie so much that I have it in four different colors. They hold up better than a normal hair tie, and are a lot easier on my hair. They hold my hair up through lifting, running, and even higher intensity workouts. I like the reflective logo on the ones that I have, but I did notice that they replaced the logo with a tag, which I don't like as much. Overall, I highly recommend them for working out.

column12: strings coming out of my scrunchie, doesn't hold thick hair well
column16: I ordered this scrunchie in petals, and I was so excited! When I received it, I opened it, and I loved it as well. But as I looked at it better, I saw there was a pretty significant hole in my scrunchie. Also, there were threads and strings coming out of it.
column18:

column16: It's hard to find good scrunchies nowadays. This one is perfect for me because most scrunchies are super small and whimpy. I need wide or thick substantial scrunchies because I have a lot of thick hair that I pile into a messy bun. These scrunchies do the job and it's such a nice fabric. I'm glad to see you added new colors, especially the pink one, and I hope you'll add solid black and solid grey. The one I wear all the time is burgundy and it's a great color, but I see you don't have that color anymore. I know I bought it at a time when you only had a few colors. I'm just so glad you kept making this scrunchie because it's so memorable I had to come back for more!

column14: theyre okay, but not the best
column16: Although this is a very cute scrunchie, it does not hold up my hair alot. i would have to use another hairtie to hold it up. It its only good for daily walks and errand but when it comes to working out, my hair just falls and it is annoying.

So, I NEVER wore or thinked about wearing scrunchies before. But like most of my friends were wearing velvet ones and they were cute. But, I don't really like copying people and like being basic. So I walked into Lululemon and I was looking through the hair accessories and I was like OMG THEY ARE SOO NICE! I prefer this specific one cause I have thick hair but the smaller one is so cute as well.

Until I bought this, I lived in cheap scrunchies from CVS but always had to throw on a real hair tie for my runs because they couldn't hold my hair up. No longer! I'm astounded that people have been having quality issues; mine has held up through all types of wear, even at the beach and pool. All I can say is more colors?

At first when I got this, I was very excited since I already own a lot of lululemon apparel, but after even 2 weeks, my scrunchie had stretched out so much that it barely stayed on my wrist. For the first weeks it held up fine but as it stretched out more, it was harder to use, and was honestly disappointing for its price. I got the smaller one, which lasted me much longer, but also ended up breaking, quite disappointingly. If it had stayed like it did the first few weeks, it would be much better.

column14: Not as great as the other scrunchie
column16: Currently lulu has two different scrunchies out. The other one is WAY better. This one constantly slips and doesn't stay. It's also super bulky on my wrist. I don't like this one. I actually bought two of them and I don't like either one. Buy the other one, not this one.

column14: Slightly Below-Average Scrunchie/Not Worth The Price
column16: The fabric is nice, but they're your average scrunchies. Extremely overpriced for the quality. This is not some life-changing scrunchie. The first one I bought stretched out within a week and a half so I bought another one and it still stretched out in a couple weeks. I have pretty thick hair so wrapping around my hair twice was initially a little tight. I can now wrap it around my hair 3 times and my hair still falls down! I run and train and they do not hold up my hair anymore so I have to put up my hair at least 5 times each time I work out which is very inconvenient.

column16: When I saw that lululemon was selling scrunchies, I dismissed them as a cash grab. However, when I had to rip a soggy cotton scrunchie out of my hair after a run, I decided to give it a try. It has excellent sweat-wicking ability. Once it was in place of my BSL kinky hair, it did not move. The reflective detailing is appreciated for low light running. I am now a believer and will pick this up in other colours as I see ones I like.

I was so excited to try out this scrunchie after reading the reviews. Upon opening the package, I was pleased because I loved the fabric, color, and the reflective detail of the scrunchie. However, it turned out to be a disappointing purchase.

column16: I have thick, curly hair and these are the only scrunchies that don't stretch out! These keep my hair in place even when I am dancing pretty intense. I love the colors and durability of them! I will keep buying these as they come out with new colors!

column14: Gym tested- Worth owning one (bought in black)
column16:
I have long (mid back), partially bleached, heavy, sleek asian hair. If I wrap around twice, my hair will hold loosely in a high/low ponytail or bun and if I wrap 3 times, my ponytail isn't moving. Did cleans and snatches, and my high ponytail stayed in place. Did bench and back squats with a low ponytail and was able to push my hair aside without the hair tie moving along with it (giving me a side pony). Comfortable to use to keep my hair out of my face when sleeping. Made of a nice, seemingly sweat wicking material and leaves a very minimal dent that works it way out (side note, my hair does not really hold dents).
I think the best part about the scrunchie is that I can have a secure high ponytail that is not pulled very tight and also does not fall (pulling on my forehead), which is why I think the $14 is justified. If I end up buying more colors, I'll update the review as others have noted that different colors do not perform the same.

column11: quality, color, hold, minimizes breakage, multi-functional
column16: I had a moment of pure joy the day I went into my local store to see scrunchies! I was a child of the 90s and regularly wore these. I bought one and then went online a few days later to buy more... another of this style and one of the larger style. I wear them everyday! I have major issues with any form of hair tie actually holding my hair up, I usually have to adjust every five minutes. My hair is fine, but I have a lot of it & it gets heavy. I've worn them lifting, running, to bed, and just day-to-day. They're multi-functional. I currently have three and have had them for ad least two months yet they look and work as if they're new. Fun side note, scrunchies are great to use if you want to avoid the indent in your hair and minimize breakage.

column11: the fit and holding while working out
column16: Bought three of these scrunchies, two work great. But the white one for some reason is a different material and has less stretch.
Really love this scrunchie- Nice material, love the reflective material. The army green is a great color, will buy more.

Was skeptical to buy an $8 scrunchie (the smaller version) but ended up loving it so much that i ended up buying this version a week later. I have long curly hair and never have to readjust this during my hot yoga practice or leisurely activities. Already looking forward to buying another.

When I first saw this I thought who would spend this much on one scrunchie? But, I took the risk and bought one and totally fell in love with it! Great quality and stays in tight. I went back and bought 2 more immediately. Please make more colors!!

column14: Super cute - I love the reflective details
column16: Like the Uplifting Scrunchie, this does occasionally fall out of my fine hair. Aside from that, I absolutely love it. I bought a few different colors and as funny as I initially thought scrunchies were, in the colors Lululemon manufactured, they can actually make a pony tail look quite elegant. I love the reflective detail... perfect for running.

column14: Amazing!! Great for people with thick hair
column16: I have very thick hair and I have tried all different types of hair ties, none of them can hold up my hair properly. The price of this scrunchie is worth every penny... my hair can finally stay up and i dont have to be constantly be pulling my hair back. If it was cheaper i would get it in more colours.. lol

column11: helps with tangles, has retention, comfortable, does not catch hair
column16:
The best, the number of tangles I have in my hair on a daily basis has decreased 1,000%
I always wondered why I had such tangled up hair and it turns out, I was wearing the wrong hair scrunchie this whole time
Thanks Lulu :)
I was hesitant after rocking scrunchies through the early 90s, but this one had be sold and ordering more! I've found I get way less hair breakage with this than a regular elastic. Love it!

I have super thick naturally curly hair. Most hair ties do not hold my hair or break, not this one! It keeps my ponytail up high all day and is so cute! I love the reflective detail, very helpful when I'm hitting the pavement. I have every color and check daily for new colors. I have had my black one for months and it still looks great! I have even washed it in the washing machine (in a garment bag) A++ thanks Lululemon!

column11: durability, sweat wicking, stays put, looks adorable
column14: Honestly it is so worth the hype!
column16: I have owned dozens of scrunchies - eventually they all stretch out and don't perform like they originally do.

column11: grip, doesn't pull hair out when you take it out, material
column16: This is the best scrunchie I have. I have bought it in two colors now, and I wear it every day. They are not only useful for working out. I wear them to sleep. I think it is the most comfortable hair tie to sleep in. Also, when I run, the hair tie will not slip out of place. I love it! It is a must-have!

column11: material, reflective detail, comfortable doesn't snag
column16: I've been on the hunt for a comfortable scrunchie since AA went out of business, these fit the bill. The material is super lightweight and fast drying. I love the reflective detail, perfect for late night runs or early morning commutes in the winter. I haven't had any problems with the elastic in mine, but I think a slightly wider elastic in future versions could be nice especially for those of us who have thicker hair. I have tons of hair and was comfortable with this scrunchie. My only critique would be to see some more colours other than white (online), black, and green. I think seeing it in inkwell or cranberry for fall would be beautiful. I hope that you keep these scrunchies in your line for those of us with thicker hair!

If you have long hair-this is a must have! Use these all of the time. My personal favorite- putting all of my hair crazily on the top of my head-out of the way! Has kept hair in bun for runs. Also, minimizes breakage.

I have this scrunchie in black, and I recently bought it in pelt as well. I was a little hesitant with this purchase since scrunchies were in when I was in elementary school, and I've heard if you were alive for a trend the first time around you should sit it out for round two.

This was an impulse purchase in the store. But I have to tell you this scrunchy is the best I ever had. It hold my hair nicely. I have really thick hair. It looks great on my hair too. I am going to buy it in all colors!

Love, love, love! My hair is not thick, but it is really long, and this scrunchie can wrap around my hair 3 times perfectly! It holds my hair tight and I love how the material dries quickly and looks cute. I had to buy more and now I use them when I'm riding on the boat and need my hair to be secured! Keep coming out with more colors!!

At first, I was crazy about this scrunchie and could not wait to get back to the store to get a second and third one. I even recommended this scrunchie to a few friends, who went out and purchased some. Unfortunately, after a few weeks, the scrunchie is stretched out and does not hold my hair up like it used to. I was hoping that because of the price, it would last longer.

I love this scrunchie, it makes getting all sweaty and gross, cute. Not only does it hold all my hair it looks fabulous while doing it. I would 100% recommend this to any of my friends and they would all love them.

Reading the previous reviews and talking to an educator, I thought this would be a life changing scrunchie. It's not. It's just an overpriced scrunchie. That being said, it does wick sweat pretty well so it has that going for it.

Not like the other ones, this is a must. Feels great when my hair is tied up, does not hurt comparing other ones.

I bought all three colors of the scrunchies and they are amazing! They are great for holding holding my hair bun in or wearing a ponytail. They have kept their shape (unlike most store scrunchies that get all stretched out). I would highly recommend the Locks Scrunchie.

I bought black one and first reason was because it is cute but I love the hold and the fact that it doesn't move, slide or pull my hair. Great for running and hot yoga!

column1:

Relaxed Fit
column16: I have quite a few of the original swiftly tech tanks and short sleeve shirts. I love them for working out, but this breeze version is GENIUS. It's perfect for doing errands, taking kids to the park or watching baseball/soccer games. But it's also still good for running or hiking when I don't feel like wearing a tight shirt. I thought about getting a size smaller in this version, but I stuck with my original size and thought it fit perfectly. It's still fitted enough to look neat and stylish but loose enough where you can eat a taco and still feel good about yourself. Highly recommend. I bought it in three colors and will probably buy more.

column1:
